Alma earns a living by selling fresh fish. Her husband is a fisherman. She helps sell her husband's catch. She has been engaged in fishing for more than 10 years. She and her family live in Getafe, Bohol. She is a 43-year-old, married, mother of four children. Her eldest child is 15 years old and the youngest is 6 years old.

She decided to take a loan to buy an engine for the motorboat. This would help ease the transportation of her husband's catch, thus generating higher income and starting to expand her business. She could continue to feed her children and to support their respective studies as well.

In the future, she dreams of expanding her business to make it productive and profitable.

loans.use: to buy an engine for the motorboat

loans.name: Chiem's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chiem, born in 1972, is a Thai ethnic woman. Her family consists of five members, including her husband, her daughter, her son-in-law, and a child of her daughter. The whole family is living in Son La city in Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from growing clean vegetables and breeding, so the income is just enough to cover the living expenses and save a small amount. She wants to invest in raising ducks, but she does not have enough money. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for raising ducks.

She hopes that the loan amount will help her family invest effectively in raising ducks with high productivity, and that next year it will bring her family a considerable profit. She will work hard to get money to repay the loan from M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to invest in raising ducks.

loans.name: Sok's Group

texts.en:
Sok is a resident in Battambang province and she is married. This 61-year-old woman has three dependent children. She and her husband are growing rice and raising pigs for their main income. Additionally, Sok spends her spare time working for others for a fee to supplement their income. 

Lack of rain, which is the main challenge to rice farming, causes rice to produce low yields. She decided to form a group of two members to apply for a loan from VisionFund. As the group leader, she will use her loan to boost rice yields by purchasing organic fertilizer to apply to the farmland. 

She hopes that the business will grow smoothly so that she can provide better support to her family.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer to apply to the farmland to boost rice yields

loans.name: Phuong's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phuong is a Thai ethnic woman, currently living with her husband and her two children, one son and one daughter in Son La city in Son La province. Her family’s main income is from small trade, so the income is just enough to cover the living expenses and save a small amount.

She wants to repair her house, but the saved amount is not enough to buy materials and pay for builders. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

She hopes much that the loan amount will help her family have a spacious and clean house, and all the members of the family will have better living conditions. She will work hard to get money to repay the loan from M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to buy materials and pay for builders.

loans.name: Lap's Group

texts.en:
Lap, 42 years old, is a Thai ethnic man. His family consists of four members, including his wife and his two sons. The family is living in Son La city in Son La province.

His family’s main income is mostly from his and his wife’s salaries, so the monthly income is just enough to cover the living expenses of the family and save a small amount.

He wants to repair his house and pay for the sanitation work, but he does not have enough money to buy materials. Therefore, he wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

He hopes that the loan amount will help his family have a spacious house and that all members of the family will have better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy materials to repair his house and pay for the sanitation work.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
In prior years, Vilma didn’t know where to get additional capital to buy necessities for her food business, since some of her earnings are used to pay bills and daily expenses. She was grateful when Center for Community Transformation (CCT) approved her previous loan of P25,000 and she was able to buy business essentials everyday. She wants to thank the lenders for the financial provision and thank God, first and foremost, for the people He used to run the business.

In a business, difficulties and challenges cannot be avoided. A road repair happening in the area and calamities like a typhoon followed by flooding really affects her daily earnings. Vilma applied for another loan of P30,000 to have additional money when calamities happen and to buy daily ingredients for her food business. She’s praying that lenders would consider her story, as this amount will really help in the business.

Vilma regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony, experience in the business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship, and to listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to have additional capital to buy daily ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Jenab

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients, Jenab, who is a 56-year-old married woman with one daughter. Jenab is a merchant and has been selling a traditional beverage called “cincau ice” for ten years.

She has asked for a loan of IDR 7,400,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build a sanitation and water source at their home to improve access to clean water and sanitation for their family. Her family's income is insufficient to build a toilet and water source, but Jenab will be able to repay the loan received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all the lenders.

loans.use: to build a sanitation and water source at their home to improve access to clean water and sanitation for their family.

loans.name: Onjamalala

texts.fr:
26 ans, mariée, Onjamalala est une mère de famille travailleuse infatigable, dynamique et courageuse. Elle a deux enfants qui sont âgés de 4 et 9ans et scolarisés dans une bonne école privée.
Son mari est maçon tâcheron dont le revenu n'est pas stable, il y a des fois où il ne trouve pas de contrat. Pour aider son mari à entretenir et soutenir la famille, elle exerce deux activités. Elle tient d'abord un stand d'alimentation, c'est son activité principale et ensuite elle exploite avec son mari une activité d'élevage de porc.
Les deux époux se soutiennent mutuellement dans l'exercice de leurs activités génératrice de revenu pour le bien-être de la famille et désirent offrir à leurs enfants une meilleure qualité de vie. Professionnellement, elle projette de bâtir un jour un plus grand ferme.
texts.en:
Onjamalala, 26 years old and married, is the mother of a family. She is hardworking, tireless, dynamic, and doesn't give up. She has two children aged 4 and 9 years who are attending a good private school.

Her husband is a mason, working by the job, whose income is not stable. Sometimes he does not get hired on a contract.

To help her husband to sustain and support the family, Onjamalala has two businesses. She has a food stand as her principal activity, and together with her husband, she raises pigs. The two spouses help each other mutually to see to their money-earning activities for the well-being of the family. They desire to offer their children a better quality life. Professionally, Onjamalala dreams of one day being able to build a bigger farm.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and livestock medicine.

loans.name: Srim

texts.en: Srim is 31 years old, a spinster woman who resides in the Takeo Province in Cambodia. She earns her main income from selling sugar cane juice, earning approximately $12.5 per day. Srim would like to request a loan to purchase a motorcycle for selling sugar cane juice. With this loan, she will be able to have enough to purchase a motorcycle and help her family have an additional business to improve the family’s finances. In the future, she is going to build a new proper house.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for selling sugar cane juice

loans.name: Tjin Ba 2 Group

texts.fr: Amadou Hamidou est l’homme qui a la main sur le bœuf devant le groupe. Il est malien et  âgé de 42 ans. Il vit dans le milieu rural avec sa femme et ses  5 enfants (4 garçons et une fille) âgés de 5 à 15 ans) dont  2 garçons scolarisés. Sa femme est ménagère. Amadou Hamidou gagne sa vie à travers l’élevage bovin , bœufs,   qui lui permet d’avoir un bénéfice  mensuel de 12 500f CFA par tête. Il achète et revend ses bœufs dans les marchés locaux. Après dix ans d’expérience dans l’élevage bovin, il fait recours au RMCR afin d’avoir un prêt pour pouvoir acheter plusieurs  bœufs et d’aliment bétail  de qualité pour développer son activité d’élevage. Il pense vendre ses bœufs dans les marchés de grandes villes pour gagner beaucoup d’intérêt  et  payer les études et les frais médicaux de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Amadou Hamidou is the man who has his hand on the cow standing in front of the group. He comes from Mali and is 42 years old. He lives in the countryside with his wife and his five children (four boys and one girl), aged 5 to 15 years old, of whom two boys are enrolled in school. His wife is a housewife.

Amadou Hamidou earns his living by raising cattle, which allows him to have a monthly profit of 12,500f CFA per head of cattle. He buys and sells his cattle in the local markets.

After 10 years of experience in raising cattle, he has turned to RMCR so as to have a loan to be able to buy several head of cattle and livestock feed in large quantity, to develop his cattle-raising business. He thinks he will sell his cattle in the markets of the big towns so as to make more profit and pay for the studies and the medical expenses of his children.

loans.use: to buy cattle to resell after raising them

loans.name: Tham's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tham, a Thai ethnic woman, has been in the program of M7-MFI since January 2012. She currently lives with her husband in the Mai Son district, Son La province. Her family’s main income is from the married couple’s civil servant salary so the income is just enough to cover the living expense of the family and save a small amount. She wants to build a sanitation work for her house but she does not have enough money to buy materials. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

She very much hopes that the loan amount will help her family have a clean sanitation work, which will make them feel more convenient and comfortable. She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to buy materials to build sanitation.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia, 37, lives in Buhangin, Davao City. She is married to Ricardo and they have children who are studying in high school. In addition to paying the fees for her children in school, Rosalia works hard to support and maintain the household’s daily expenses.

Rosalia operates a “sari-sari” store, a type of small convenience store in the Philippines. There she sells dry goods, grocery items and beverages, with almost all of her products being essential household needs and food. She buys these goods at wholesale prices then sells them by the piece to her neighbors and the local community. This type of store is very common in the Philippines and expectedly the competition is stiff. She tries to compete by adding frozen goods to her inventory.

To enhance her variety store and make it more competitive, Rosalia is applying for a PhP 10,000 loan which she will use to buy additional grocery items and softdrinks. Part of it will be used to buy meat, hotdogs and other frozen goods. This supplementary capital will make her business more stable and will give her higher income. In due time, she plans to add another income generating venture, something that can contribute to food production in her community, maybe a farm or animal raising endeavor.

She wants her children to get a college education to bring them better opportunities in life. She thanks God and you in advance for this financial assistance. She prays that abundant blessings return to you.

All CCT community clients like Rosalia are organized into fellowship groups of fifteen to thirty members who meet on a weekly basis. There they share stories of their work, repay microfinance loans and draw strength and inspiration from their study of the Word of God.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items, softdrinks, meat, hotdogs and other frozen goods to sell in her store

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila is a 44-year-old business woman, married to Joseph, a laborer. Currently, she is involved in a buy and sell business of different frozen products, i.e., chicken, pork and other meat products. She also has been selling personal products like shampoo, lotion, soap and ready-to-wear clothes for 9 years now.

Each day is tiring, since dealing with different kinds of people and changes of weather needs to be considered as well. However, she still perseveres in running the business and earning more profit for her children’s education and day-to-day expenses. She had faith in God’s provision until an answered prayer: someone told her about Center for Community Transformation (CCT).

Lucila decided to apply for a P20,000 loan since she needed additional capital for her business to buy products such as frozen meats, chicken, pork, and stocks of noodles, fruit juices, and rice.

Lucila regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony, experience in the business, and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationships with other partners, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy products such as frozen meats, chicken, pork, and stocks of noodles, fruit juices and rice.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 44 years old and married with three children. Two of her children attend school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Gladys has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 60,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Gladys has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Gladys would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell

loans.name: Nestoria

texts.en:
Nestoria operates a tricycle transportation services. Her husband is the one driving the unit. She has nine children. Her oldest child is 24 and the youngest is 5. To augment her income, she also raises and sells hogs. She has been engaged that kind of business for more than 10 years.

She would like to improve her both businesses by asking for additional capital. Thus, she could able to raise quality hogs and also able to maintain her tricycle transportation services also.

She is asking for a loan in the amount of 20,000 PHP to purchase tire,a chain and pig feed.

Nestoria is determined that someday she will become successful in her livelihood and continue support the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to purchase tire, a chain and pig feed.

loans.name: Evalyn

texts.en:
Evalyn is 44 years old and married with four children. Three of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Evalyn has a general store business in the Philippines. Evalyn requested a 23,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Evalyn has been in this business for six years. In the future, Evalyn would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 51 years old and married with seven children.  With two children in school, Josephine works very hard to provide for them.

Josephine runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Josephine has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack food and other groceries. 

In the future Josephine would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Virgenia

texts.en:
Virgenia is a merchant from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells commodities like mineral water, soft drinks, canned goods, seasonings, and toiletries. She is a 45-year-old married woman with five children. Her oldest child is 22 and the youngest is 4.

She has requested a loan to buy supplies for the store and materials like cement and galvanized iron. Thus, she would able to provide her customers with a comfortable place to shop and provide a friendly atmosphere as well. She could also maintain the stocks of her store and in return she could roll-out her capital.

She is determined to manage her business to support the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her store and materials like cement and galvanized iron

loans.name: Daina

texts.en:
Each day is a challenge for Daina, who is 41 years old and married with children. As a fish vendor for the past 19 years, bad weather during rainy seasons has given Daina tough times. A difficult season came this year as El Nino swept her coastal village. Climate reports forecast that this will continue until 2016, and the fish catch has started to be limited.

Daina is a wise borrower, anticipating the challenging climate changes ahead. She will use the loan of 14,000 PHP to buy additional fishing tools, including cast nets, rod holders, bait prep, and grippers that her husband will need to catch fresh fish to sell. The rest of the fish that they catch will be dried and salted to take advantage of the long dry season. Also, dried fish is priced higher in the market. This will give her more income. Part of the loan will also be utilized to buy additional groceries for her small variety store.

Daina is committed to save from her income to fund the purchase of more fish and expand her business. She also wishes to see her children finish their education, get stable jobs, and pursue their chosen careers in life.

Daina meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing tools to catch more fresh fish

loans.name: Maa Thakurani Shg 9-A Group

texts.en:
Gori is a differently-able woman who has been running a small food store for the last seven years to manage her household expenses. She is the one standing on the right-hand side in the photograph. She has been running her store on a partnership basis and has to share the profit with her partner. She struggles hard to support her family out of this income.

Gori's family includes her two sons and a daughter. Her sons have been employed somewhere to earn additional income for their family. Gori now wishes to scale up her venture by increasing her volume of business in the area. For this purpose, she seeks financial support and plans to use it for buying grocery supplies in bulk amounts from the wholesaler as well as some utensils, etc., to serve more customers and increase her earnings from this venture.

Along with her group member, Gori has requested a loan of 30,000 INR. She will use her portion to buy edible oil, sugar, rice, flour, spices, and biscuits in bulk. She is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for this support.

loans.use: to buy edible oil, sugar, rice, flour, spices, and biscuits in bulk

loans.name: Ameng

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients, Ameng, who is a 51-year-old woman and married with three sons. Ameng has been a greengrocer for twenty years; her husband job’s has been providing a shuttle service for the labor in a factory for 10 years. 

She has asked for a loan of 5,000,000 IDR from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build sanitation and a water source at her home to improve access to clean water and sanitation for her family. Her family's income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources, but Ameng will be able to repay the loan received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all lenders.

loans.use: to build sanitation and a water source at her home to improve access to clean water and sanitation for her  family.

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
LUZ MARIA TIENE 18 AÑOS DE EDAD, SOLTERA, VIVE CON SU MADRE, EN CASA FAMILIAR, EN UNA COMUNIDAD GRANDE EN LA ZONA URBANA DE CAYALTI, PROVINCIA CHICLAYO, REGION LAMBAYEQUE , COSTA NORTE DE PERU.

LUZ MARIA SE DEDICA A LA ACTIVIDAD DE COCINERA, BRINDA SU SERVICIO EN UNA POLLERIA, DESDE HACE MAS DE 5 AÑOS DE ANTIGUEDAD EN EL MISMO DISTRITO DE CAYALTI. SOLICITA PRESTAMO PARA LA COMPRA DE INDUMENTARIA PARA BRINDAR SERVICIOS DE COCINA A TERCERAS PERSONAS. DE ESTA MANERA HACER CRECER MAS SU NEGOCIO,OBTENER MÁS INGRESOS Y PODER MEJORAR SU CALIDAD DE VIDA.
texts.en:
Luz Maria is 18-years old. She is single and lives with her mother in their family home. They live in a large community in the urban area of Cayalti, which is in Chiclayo Province and Lambayeque Region on Peru's northern coast.

Luz Maria makes her living as a cook. She has worked in a chicken eatery, also in Cayalti District, for more than five years. She is requesting the loan to purchase attire for offering catering services to third parties. She will then be able to grow her business more, earn a greater income and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase attire for offering catering services to third parties.

loans.name: Amelina

texts.en:
Amelina is a hardworking woman entrepreneur.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell. She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like E-loading business.

Amelina dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
SHAZIA is a 36-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of four children and equally responsible for all of them.

She belongs to an ultra poor family; that is why she cannot afford the educational expenses. So most of her children are doing jobs as labor for daily wages. One of her sons goes with his father to help him in his business.

Her husband owns a blacksmith shop where he provides welding services. He also provides door-to- door services to his customers. Due to increase in iron prices, he is unable to buy sufficient welding material such as welding rods, soldering rods, etc to carry on his business.

To fulfill the demand of his customers and to run his enterprise, he needs some capital to buy welding material.

SHAZIA requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband so he would be able to buy material to carry on his business.

SHAZIA will very glad and thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy welding material such as welding rods, soldering rods, etc for her husband's manufacturing business.

loans.name: Naomey

texts.en:
Naomey is a first-year student at Kepler in Rwanda. After an application process that considered her grades, test scores and a personal interview, she was accepted from over 6,000 applicants. She chose Kepler because of her desire to earn a degree from a high quality institution.

Naomey plans to major in communications, with a concentration in business, and will graduate from Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. After graduating, she wants to work in the private sector.

Naomey wants to achieve career success, to contiinue her professional growth and to support the education of her brothers and sisters.

loans.use: to pay for a laptop required for a US college degree.

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr: Seydou est l’homme qui  tient la corde du  bœuf devant le groupe. Il vit dans le milieu rural avec sa famille. Il a  8 enfants, âgés de 4 à 13 ans dont  2 garçons scolarisés. Sa femme est vendeuse de farine.  Il est malien et  âgé de 36 ans. Seydou gagne sa vie à travers l’élevage de  bœufs, cette activité   lui permet d’avoir un bénéfice  mensuel de 62 500f CFA. Il achète et revend ses bœufs dans les marchés locaux. Après dix ans d’expérience dans l’élevage bovin, il fait recours au RMCR afin d’avoir un prêt pour pouvoir acheter plusieurs  bœufs et d’aliment bétail de qualité pour nourrir ses bœufs .  Son rêve est de vendre ses bœufs  pour gagner beaucoup d’intérêt  et  payer les études de ses enfants et bien s’occuper des frais médicaux de ses enfants en cas de maladie.
texts.en:
Seydou is the man holding the rope on the cow standing in front of the group. He lives in a rural area with his family. He has eight children, aged 4 to 13 years, of whom two boys are enrolled in school. His wife sells flour.

Seydou is from Mali and aged 36. He earns his living by raising cattle. This business allows him a monthly profit of 62,500 f CFA. He buys and resells the cattle in local markets.

With 10 years' experience in raising cattle, he has turned to RMCR so as to have a loan to buy several cattle and high-quality cattle feed to feed his animals. His dream is to sell his cattle to earn a lot of profit and pay for his children's studies as well as to cover the medical expenses of his children in case of illness.

loans.use: to buy some cattle to resell afterwards.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia tiene 52 años de edad, es casada, vive con su esposo y su hijo en una zona rural del distrito de Pucará que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la Sierra norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Delia se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como cerdos, pollos, gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con 06 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que solicita será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como cerdos, gallinas, patos, pavos, pollos, entre otros, así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para estos. Con esto Delia espera ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir generar mayores ingresos y por ende incrementará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Delia is 52 years old and is married. She lives with her husband and her son in a rural area of the district of Pucará which is located in the province of Jaén, Cajamarca region, in the North Andes of Peru

Delia works raising and selling small animals like pigs, chickens, ducks and turkeys amongst others. Her business is located at her residence. She has six years of experience in the business and has very good personal and work references from her area.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy a greater quantity of animals like pigs. hens, ducks, turkeys and chickens amongst others as well as buying balanced feed for them. Doing this Delia hopes to offer a better product to her clients which will allow her to make greater income and in the end improve her quality of living and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of animals.

loans.name: Maa Thakurani Shg 9-B Group

texts.en:
The "Maa Thakurani Shg 9-B" is a newly formed group made up of women who want to bring change to their daily lives through the program. They live in the same village and share values of solidarity and working together. They mainly run small businesses and do some crop cultivation.

Boidi is the lady in the picture who is standing on the right, the featured borrower of the group. She is 46 years old and a married mother of two children. She sells seasonal fruit and has perfectly mastered this business from having been doing it for more than 10 years. She sells fresh fruit like oranges, apples, bananas, pineapples, and guavas.

Along with her group member, Boidi is requesting a loan amount of 30,000 INR. With her new loan, Boidi plans to buy fresh fruit in bulk to resell. With her profits, she plans to increase her savings to better establish her business. The other member of the group, Lakshmi, is engaged in a milk-selling business.

Boidi and her group member are very happy for this loan and thankful to Kiva for this great support.

loans.use: to buy fresh fruits in bulk to resell

loans.name: M. Hayat

texts.en:
M. Hayat is the age of 42, living in the rural area of Lahore, Pakistan. He is a very hardworking and gentle person. He is responsible for his own family and old parents as well.

M. Hayat is a milkman by profession and sells milk in his community. He has been selling milk since 2000; now he is very expert and experienced in his profession. He is very expert at producing milk from a buffalo; he produces milk from his all buffaloes in no time. He has many buffaloes; this is the reason he has to do very hard work to feed them. Every day he takes his herd to the pasture for grazing, gives them a bath in the stream, and he has to stay with them the whole day due to a fear of theft. He has not much time for his family members.

M. Hayat wants to get an assistant to look after his cattle, but he does not earn enough profit to afford the salary. With the help of loan, he will buy an additional buffalo so he can increase his monthly income, get an assistant, and spend some time with his family.

Therefore, M. Hayat has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan. M. Hayat` hopes that he would be able to buy a buffalo and he will be successful in increasing his monthly income as well.

M. Hayat thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy an additional buffalo for his dairy farm.

loans.name: Faria

texts.en:
Faria is active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She lives with her three children and husband in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is the guardian of her family, her husband has been running a mobile shop for past eight years.

Faria's husband wants to purchase different types of mobile accessories for his business purposes, but due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to purchase these accessories.

Therefore Faria has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, she’ll enable her husband to purchase relevant items for his business purposes so that her husband can earn more profitable income to manage his business and household.

Faria is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's mobile business.

loans.name: Bushra's Group

texts.en:
BUSHRA is the age of 48, the mother of six daughters and one son. She is living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

She is very hard worker, gracious and honest per her husband. Her husband owns a small restaurant where he offers various types of delicious foods two times a day. He has been running this restaurant for many years, and earns good profit from his restaurant business. She helps her husband by cooking various foods at home and her husband sells it at his restaurant. He offers tea to his customers also.

Now he wants to enhance his restaurant by purchasing new plastic furniture, utensils, a cauldron, etc. Due to household expenses his savings are not enough to buy the desired things.

Therefore, BUSHRA requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy plastic furniture, utensils, a cauldron, etc.

BUSHRA thanks Kiva and appreciates the warm support for her.

loans.use: to buy furniture, utensils, a cauldron, spices, etc for her husband's restaurant.

loans.name: Shafiq Shah

texts.en:
Shafiq Shah is the age of 34, the father of two daughters and a son living in Lahore, Pakistan. He is religious, sympathetic, honest and a hard worker.

He is running a small herbal store in a nearby town to help poor people. He wants to help poor people; this is the reason he decided to open a herbal medicine shop in a poor society. Such poor people, who do not have the power to afford allopathic medicine. He can treat minor diseases also at a very low service charge, and provides the herbal medicines according to his experience. In this way he generates some income to run his house as well.

He is very famous in his area due to his kindness; this is the reason the demand for herbal medicine has been increasing and he need to buy more herbal medicine to cope with the demand. He wants to buy herbal medicines in bulk, but does not have enough capital to invest because he has to spend a large part of his savings on household expenses.

Therefore, Shafiq Shah requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan; he hopes that the lenders will support him in his noble work.

loans.use: to buy herbal medicines in bulk for his herbal store.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 40-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of two children.

Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. From the past many days his rickshaw has not been working properly so her husband is unable to generate any amount of income. Her husband wants to repair it as soon as possible. However due to the lack of money, her husband finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw.

Therefore Yasmeen has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business.

Yasmeen is so very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Carene Roxanne

texts.en:
Carene is a first-year student at Kepler. Because of her impressive test scores, academic record, and strong character, she was accepted from over 6,000 applicants this year. Carene chose Kepler because it because of its reputation for helping its students find job opportunities and build networking skills.

Carene plans to major in Communications with a Concentration in Business, and will graduate Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. At Kepler, she hopes to gain the professional and business skills to succeed in her career. She would love to work in sales and management.

loans.use: to pay for a laptop required to pursue a US college degree.

loans.name: Naldy Mercedes

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Damas Del Futuro se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Pajan,  cantón conocido por ser una zona muy ganadera de la provincia, un atractivo es el rodeo montubio que organizan en algunas épocas del año. 
En este lugar vive la señora Naldy, tiene 64 años de edad, hace ya varios años su esposo falleció y quedo viuda, pero de esa relación tiene 6  hijos mayores de edad, con ella vive uno de sus hijos el cual tiene capacidades especiales.
Doña Naldy es una mujer muy luchadora que hace lo posible para darles lo mejor a su familia, ella trabaja de maestra en una escuela de la ciudad, pero en su casa también tiene una pequeña granja en la cual cría pollos, los mismos que vende en una tercena que tiene a medias con uno de sus hijos. De esta forma ella ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos ya que lleva en esta actividad más de 30 años, antes junto a su marido en su tercena y ahora con la ayuda de su hijo el cual también puede ganarse lo suyo por el bien de su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar alimento para los pollos y carne de res Y chancho  para la venta diaria. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta ya que con los créditos ella ha podido salir adelante. Sus sueños son tener buena salud para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Damas Del Futuro" (Ladies of the Future) meets every two weeks in the Pajan Canton, which is known for being an area that raises cattle in the province. One attraction is the Rodeo Montubio that they organize at certain times of the year.

Naldy lives here. She is 64 years old. Several years ago her husband died and she was left a widow but from that relationship she has 6 adult children. One of her children, who has special needs, lives with her.

Naldy is a very persevering woman who does what she can to give the best to her family. She works as a teacher in a school in the city but in her house she also has a small farm in which she raises chickens. She sells them in a butcher's shop that she half-owns with one of her sons. In this way she has managed to get her children ahead as she has been in this activity more than 30 years, before, with her husband in their butcher's shop and now with the help of her son who also can earn his own living for the good of his family.

This loan is to buy food for the chickens, cattle and pigs for daily sale. She has been in the communal bank since the beginning and she likes it because with the loans she has been able to get ahead.

Her dream is for her and her family to be in good health.

loans.use: to buy food for chickens, cattle and pigs.

loans.name: Maricela

texts.es:
MARICELA TIENE 49 AÑOS CONVIVIENTE CON UN HIJO A SU CARGO VIVIENDO EN CASA DE SUS PADRES, VIVE EN UNA COMUNIDAD UBICADA A 48 KMS DE CHICLAYO, REGION LAMBAYEQUE, COSTA NORTE DE PERU.ES UNA COMUNIDAD HABITADA POR GENTE RESPETUOSA DEDICADA A LA AGRICULTURA, COMERCIO Y GANADERIA.

MARICELA SE DEDICA A DAR EL SERVICIO DE LA VENTA DE ALIMENTOS PREPARADOS, DESDE HACE MAS DE 12 AÑOS,CON MUY BUENAS REFERENCIAS PERSONALES Y LABORALES, NECESITA PRESTAMO PARA AMPLIAR Y MEJORAR LA INFRAESTRUCTURA DE SU NEGOCIO LO QUE LE DARÁ MEJOR ASPECTO A SU NEGOCIO Y DE ESA MANERA PERCIBIR MAYOR INGRESO EN BIENESTAR DE SU UNIDAD FAMILIAR.
texts.en:
Maricela is 49 years old and lives with her son, who is in her care. They live in her parents' house, in a community located 48km from Chiclayo, in the region of Lambayeque, on the north coast of Peru. This community is inhabited with respectable people who work in agriculture, business and ranching.
Maricela has a store selling prepared food. She has done this for 12 years and has very good personal and work references. She needs a loan to increase and improve the infrastructure of her business, which will give her business a better appearance. In this way she will see an increase in her income and improve her family's well-being.

loans.use: to increase and improve the infrastructure of her business.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr: C’est la femme qui a sa main sur les habits sur la photo, Malienne, Aminata est âgée de 37 ans .Elle est mariée et a 4  enfants dont 3 vont à l’école. Ses enfants sont âgés de 01 à 15 ans. Amina a fréquenté l’école, elle fait le commerce des habits femmes depuis 12 ans. Aujourd’hui elle souhaite développer cette activité pour en faire sa principale source de revenus. Elle prend le prêt au RMCR pour acheter les habits et revendre .Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et vend au marché de Bla en gros et en détaille. Après la vente elle peut avoir 100 000f comme bénéfice chaque mois, Le bénéfice récolté sur la vente des habits lui permet de prendre en charge : la santé, la nourriture, l’éducation et l’habillement de ses enfants. Aminata n’a pas eu de problème avec le prêt du RMCR. Dans l’avenir Aminata prétend avoir un prêt élevé pour développer son activité de commerce et satisfaire plus les besoins de la clientèle et celle de sa famille.
texts.en:
Aminata, the woman who has her hand on the clothing in the photo, comes from Mali and is 37 years old. She is married and has four children of whom three attend school. Her children are between 1 and 15 years of age. Aminata attended school; she has been selling women's clothing for 12 years.

Today, she is hoping to develop this business to make it her principal source of income. She is taking out a loan from RMCR to buy clothing for resale. She buys her stock in Bamako and sells in the marketplace at Bla, wholesale or retail.

After her sales, she can have 100,000 f in profit every month. The profit she makes on the sale of clothing allows her to cover healthcare, food, education expenses, and clothing for her children.

Aminata has not had any problems with RMCR loans. In future, she says she hopes to have a loan in a higher amount so as to develop her commercial business and better satisfy the needs of her clientele and of her family.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Damas Del Futuro que se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Pajan, cantón conocido por ser una zona muy ganadera de la provincia, un atractivo es el rodeo montubio que organizan en algunas épocas del año. 
En este lugar vive la señora Luz, tiene 84 años de edad, hace ya varios años su esposo falleció y quedo viuda, pero de esa relación tiene 9  hijos, todos ya son mayores de edad ella vive en casa de una hija.
Doña Luz para ganarse su propio sustento y así ganarse la vida y ayudarle a su hija en los gastos del hogar  se dedica a la cría de pollos y chanchos, para esto ella tiene una pequeña granja en su casa, ella mete hasta 200 pollos los cuales los cría durante dos a tres meses que es el tiempo para que ya estén listos para la venta, después de este tiempo los entrega a  comerciante que llegan hasta su casa, de la misma forma hace con los chanchos los cuales tienen un poco más de tiempo para que estén listos para la venta, su hija le ayuda en la crianza de estos animalitos que le dejan muy buenos ingresos al venderlos.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar pollos, alimento y medicinas tanto para los pollos como para los chanchos. Es fundadora del Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho. Sus sueños seguir adelante contando con la ayuda de la fundación.
texts.en:
The "Damas Del Futuro" communal bank meets every fortnight in Pajan canton, a canton known as the area with the most livestock in the province. One of the attractions is the Montubio (the name for the coastal culture of the region) rodeos that are organized at certain times of the year.

Luz lives in this place. She is 84 years old. Her husband passed away a few years ago and she is a widow. She has nine children from this realtionship. They are all adults and she lives in the house of one of her daughters.

In order to make her own sustenance, make her living and help her daughter with the household expenses Luz works raising chickens and pigs. To do this she has a small farm at her house where she keeps up to 200 chickens. She keeps them for two or three months which is the time it takes for them to be ready to sell. After this she hands them over to a businessman who comes to her house. She does the same with the pigs which she keeps for a little more time before they are ready to sell. Her daughter helps her raising these animals which provide good profit on selling them.

This loan will be used to buy chickens, feed and medicine for the chickens as well as the pigs. She is a founding member of the communal bank and she likes it as the loans help her greatly. Her dream is to carry on, counting on the support of the foundation.

loans.use: to buy chickens, feed and medicine for her chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en:
Greetings from Palestine. Fadi is 31 years old, single with no kids and lives in Yata in Hebron city. Fadi has a small stockade in front of his house. His main business is to trade in livestock, such as goats, sheep, ewes, etc. Fadi needs the loan to buy sheep and ewes in order to raise them and after that sell them and make some profits. The business faces two main challenges. The first one is the lack of liquidity which limits his ability to expand his project and the other challenge is the seasonality of the livestock trade.

For the future, Fadi hopes to expand his project by increasing the number of livestock. Fadi Thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy sheep and ewes and after that sell them and make some profits.

loans.name: Asem

texts.en:
The dream is the biggest support for any person, as Asem who is 38 years old and married with two children, and he lives in southern Jordan. Asem is from a poor family and that's why he could not complete his education and achieve his only dream. He is working in the public sector and he is working hard to provide a good life for his family.

It seems that Asem did not give up on his dream. He saved money and he started his education to be a good hero for his children. Now he is facing some financial problems that prevent him from paying for his university fees, therefore he is applying for a loan to help him pay for his university fees and achieve his dream.

loans.use: to pay for his university fees.

loans.name: Salidarité 22 Group

texts.fr: Mamouna est agée 55 ans, mariée mère de 6 enfants. Elle excerce son commerce depuis 6 ans. Ce qui fait marcher son activité c’est : son expérience, le respect et la qualité du produit. Elle veut le prêt pour acheter 6 sacs de maniocs à 100 000. L’utilité du prêt c’est de pouvoir approvisionner en quantité suffisante afin de renforcer son activité. Elle a déjà reçu le prêt 2 fois et à rembourser aux dates prévue à ACFIME.
texts.en: Mamouna is 55 and married with six children. She has been working in her business for six years. Her experience, the respect that her clients have for her and the quality of her products are the reasons for her success. She requests this loan to buy six sacks of manioc at 100 000 cfa francs. She will use the loan to stock up her business in sufficient quantity to reinforce it. She has already received two previous loans that she repaid on the date planned by ACFIME.

loans.use: to buy six sacs of manioc

loans.name: Majdi

texts.en:
Greetings from Palestine. Majdi is 31 years old. He is married with six kids. Majdi has a small stockade in front of his house. His main business is to trade in livestock, such as goats, sheep, ewes, etc. Majdi needs the loan to buy sheep and ewes in order to raise them and after that sell them and make some profit. The business faces two main challenges. The first one is the lack of liquidity, which limits his ability to expand his project, and the other challenge is the seasonality of the livestock trade.

For the future, Majdi hopes to expand his project by increasing the number of livestock. Majdi Thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy sheep and ewes in order to raise them and after that sell them and make some profits

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad lives with his parents in Irbid. He is an ambitious and positive guy. Ahmad is 21 years old, university student majoring in economy, and he did not find a suitable work beside his education.

He wishes to graduate to find good work to help his family in the household expenses and to carry responsibility from his parents. Lately his father faced financial problems and he could not cover Ahmad`s university fees, therefore he decided to apply for an educational loan to pay for his university fees and achieve his goals.

loans.use: to pay for his university fees

loans.name: Rise Group

texts.en:
Joyce is in her early 40s and is married with five children. Four of them are in school and one is grown up. She has been a food vendor for fourteen years now. She works from 9am to 3pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be Joyce's 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase stock and has managed to pay back all her loans successfully. She is doing great with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group. She used the profit to pay school fees, to repay loan, bought a TV set, a radio, a fridge and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to restock the out of stock items in her store and meet her customer's requirement. She dreams of owning a hotel.

Joyce will share this loan with her loan group Rise which consists of three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the out of stock items in her store and meet her customer's requirement.

loans.name: Delia Victoria

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Damas Del Futuro se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Pajan,  cantón conocido por ser una zona muy ganadera de la provincia, un atractivo es el rodeo montubio que organizan en algunas épocas del año. 
En este lugar vive la señora Delia, tiene 60 años de edad, hace ya varios años su esposo falleció pero de esa relación tiene dos hijos, ambos ya son mayores de edad uno de ellos  aun vive con ella.
Doña Delia es una mujer que le gusta ganarse la vida en algo que le encanta, ella es artesana y tiene un taller en el cual elabora protectores de utensilios de cocina hechos en tela, cojines y almohadas, ella les realiza distintos bordados para que sus clientes queden contentos con los productos que ella ofrece, entrega sus productos en la ciudad de Guayaquil en ciertos bazares, actualmente está por presentar un proyecto para el Consejo Provincial De Manabí  el cual la quiere ayudar a varias personas como ella para que sus productos tengan mejor ventas ya sea a nivel nacional o exportar al exterior es por esta razón que necesita de urgencia su crédito ya que así espera maximizar sus ventas y mejorar su vida.
Este crédito es para comprar hilos, telas y otros materiales necesarios  para fabricar los cojines. Es socia fundadora  del Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le ofrecen  los créditos. Sus sueños son aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
The "Damas Del Futuro" communal bank meets every fortnight in Pajan canton, a canton known as the area with the most livestock in the province. One of the attractions is the Montubio (the name for the coastal culture of the region) rodeos that are organized at certain times of the year.

Delia lives in this place. She is 60 years old. Her husband passed away a number of years ago. She has two children from this realtionship who are both adults. One of them still lives with her.

Delia is a woman who loves to make her living in something she loves. She is a crafts person and has a workshop where she makes covers for kitchen utensils, out of cloth, cushions and pillows. She adds various embroidery so that her customers are satisfied with the products she offers. She delivers her product to certain stores in the city of Guayaquil. Currently she is about to present a project to the Provincial Council of Manabí who want to help people like her to improve the sales of their product at the national level or exported abroad. For this reason she urgently needs this loan as she wants to maximize her sales and improve her life.

The loan is to buy fabric, thread and other materials she needs to make her cushions. She is a founding member of the communal bank and she likes it for the support the loan provide. Her dream is to increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread and other materials.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is a farmer living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He used the previous loan to pay for labor and buy a tarpaulin for drying coffee beans. He grows coffee and onions, which he started way back in 2007 with a hope of providing a stable income for his family of 10 members.

In future, William envisions diversifying his business to include animal raising, which will enable him to become self-reliant in his business and family. At present, he is facing challenges of theft and fluctuating market prices, which make him stay on stand still.

William has asked for a loan to pay for labor by those who are harvesting the coffee beans.

loans.use: to pay for labor by those who are harvesting his coffee beans.

loans.name: Ameer Ali

texts.en:
Ameer Ali is the age of 33. He is an energetic man living with his three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He is supporting his sibling as well. His forefathers have been doing the same business for many years and he got all the buffalo’s as inheritance. He is a milkman by profession. He sells milk in his community and produces yogurt and butter for his family's personal use. He lives in a rural area and the ways are unpaved. He has to provide door to door milk by using his bicycle. It is very difficult for him to carry milk canes on a bicycle. He wants access to more customers so he can offer more milk and can generate more income for his family.

Ameer Ali is facing problems coping with the rapid increase in inflation and household expenses. He wants to buy a mini wagon but does not have enough cash in hand and savings. This is the reason he is compelled to take a loan. Ameer Ali requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so he would be able to buy a mini wagon for carrying more milk canes. He will use the portion of profit amount for purchasing fodder. He hopes that his production will be increase and he can easily cope with the inflation. Ameer Ali thanks the Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a mini wagon to access more customers for selling milk.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline has two children. She owns a boutique, which helps her look after her family. She is a focused and hardworking woman with a zeal to develop herself and expand her business into a well-known boutique with latest the fashions and designs. 

Jackline needs to build a residential house, but lacks some materials to do so. She is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy materials such as cement and sand for constructing her house.

loans.use: to purchase cement and sand for construction

loans.name: Maa Thakurani Shg 9-C Group

texts.en:
Ketana is 25 years old and lives with her husband, her husband's siblings, and her parents-in-law in a small village of Koraput district of Odisha. She owns a grocery shop where she sells biscuits, wafers, toffees, cakes, bread, etc. In this way, she earns 3,000 INR per month, which is not sufficient to manage her big family. She is unable to provide the minimum study materials to her husband's siblings.

Ketana wants to expand her business and set up a shop in her home. She has requested a loan of 30,000 INR, together with her group member. She will set up a shop in her home, purchase goods in bulk, and add some new varieties of stationery items and snacks for her shop. The lady standing on the right in the photo is Ketana.

Ketana is eagerly awaiting your kind help and support.

loans.use: to set up a shop in her home, purchase goods in bulk, and add some new varieties of stationery items and snacks to her shop inventory.

loans.name: Helene Nafisseta

texts.fr:
Mme HELENE NAFISSETA est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 13 ans et le moins âgé a 19 mois. 03 enfants vont à l’école et elle a 06 personnes en charges.
Mme vend du poisson depuis plus de 10 ans et vend aussi des pagnes depuis 05 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans  les marchés environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, elle compte s’acheter 06 douzaines de pagnes et 100 kg de poissons.
Elle veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour agrandir son activité de vente de pagnes. Elle ambitionne acheter une parcelle et prendre en charge sa famille.
texts.en:
Mme Helene Nafisseta is married and the mother of four children. The oldest is 13 and the youngest 19 months. Three of the children go to school and she is responsible for six persons.

Mme Helene Nafisseta has been selling fish for more than 10 years and also selling lengths of African print cloth (pagnes) for five years. She stocks up in the surrounding markets.

With the loan money she intends to buy six dozen lengths of cloth and 100 kg of fish. She wants to use the profits from the loan to expand her pagne sales business. Her ambition is to buy a plot of land and support her family.

loans.use: to buy six dozen lengths of brightly colored African print cloth and 100 kg of fish.

loans.name: Tatiana

texts.en:
Tatiana is a freshman in the JMC Department at American University of Central Asia. Since her childhood Tatiana wanted to be a magical person, who could be as caring as Snow White, as strong to be able to change lives like Mulan, or just like Pocahontas. She always believed that her dreams could come true if she would study well, work hard, and be an active member of society. She joined the JMC Department to fulfill her dreams and find new friends among the AUCA community.

Thanks to her parents’ love and sacrifice over the years, Tatiana was able to devote time and energy to academic accomplishment even though money was always tight. Neither of her parents had an opportunity to attend university, and they had faced many struggles in their lives. Now, Tatiana’s parents are working as farmers, growing fruits and vegetables and raising some livestock for sale. They are confident that the priority should be given to their children’s higher education.

At present Tatiana's parents are facing some financial difficulties in paying tuition fees for their son at another university, so they are asking Kiva lenders to support Tatiana. As for Tatiana, she is happy to find a solution for her problem and is ready to pay the Kiva loan back after she graduates. Tatiana believes that Kiva is what she needs now, and by helping her, Kiva is raising a new Kiva lender in the future. As she says, it is like being the magical person she dreamed of being in her childhood, giving some money to make people well-educated and safe from poverty.

loans.use: to pay for her higher education in the JMC Department at American University of Central Asia.

loans.name: Rogers

texts.en:
Rogers is a new borrower to UGAFODE Microfinance Limited. He is married with one child and a resident of Konge-Makindye. He has applied for a loan of UGX 2,000,000 to buy home appliances. He is grateful to UGAFODE  for advancing him the funds that have helped him to improve his status. He thanks you, the Kiva lenders, for helping people to progress.

Pictured is Rogers with the UGAFODE credit staff member at his home.

loans.use: to buy home appliances

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios manages the school canteen, which she has been doing for three years. She earns additional income through hog raising and farming. 

With her determination to keep her school canteen profitable Remedios is requesting a loan for 15,000 PHP, which she will use to buy soft drinks, flour, noodles, assorted biscuits, and juice drinks to sell. This loan will help her to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, flour, noodles, assorted biscuits, and juice drinks

loans.name: Irish

texts.en:
Irish is 36 years old, married and has four children. She is managing a store for income. She has been selling grocery items for over two years. She wanted to improve her sales, but had insufficient funding, so now she is asking for additional capital of PHP 6,000 to buy canned goods, breads, soap and shampoo to sell. 

In the future, Irish hopes to keep earning good profits and achieve financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, breads, soap and shampoo to sell

loans.name: Yvette

texts.en:
Yvette is a first-year student at Kepler. She grew up with her mother and sister in Rwanda's capital of Kigali. Because of Yvette's tremendous academic record, she was accepted to Kepler from over 6,000 applicants this year.

Yvette plans to major in Communications with a Concentration in Business, and will graduate Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. She chose Kepler because she wanted to learn the professional skills that will help her stand out over her career. After graduating, Yvette hopes to run her own business someday, while also helping to support her community financially.

loans.use: To pay for a laptop required to pursue a US college degree

loans.name: Juan Amilcar

texts.es:
Amílcar es productor de café certificado  con Comercio Justo y Rainforest, la producción de café es el único sustento de su familia conformada por él, su esposa y 2 hijos, Amílcar tiene 38 años de edad, Amílcar lleva más de 18 años produciendo café.
Amílcar a diario  pone en práctica nuevas técnicas de producción con el objetivo de aumentar la calidad y cantidad de producción sin sacrificar ninguna, el principal objetivo es hacer los cafetales más sostenibles y amigables con nuestro tan maltratado medio ambiente.
Una de las formas de producción que le llama mucho la atención a Amílcar es la producción de café orgánico, el café orgánico tiene mejores mercados que el café convencional además la producción orgánica colabora para mantener la salud del ambiente y la biodiversidad animal, es por eso que Amílcar quiere iniciar la conversión de su cafetal para tener producción 100% orgánica y de comercio Justo.
Amílcar solicita un crédito para iniciar las labores de conversión a orgánico sin dejar de lado sus prácticas de comercio justo y rainforest, Amílcar quiere iniciar la certificación replantando el cafetal esto le permitirá que su cafetal al ser una plantación 100% nueva sea más productivo y sostenible.
Un crédito le ayudara a Amílcar a comprar abonos orgánicos, plantas de café de origen orgánico, pago de mano de obra y otros materiales de origen orgánico necesarios para el proceso de conversión, con las ganancias obtenidas Amílcar espera mejorar sus condiciones de vida y que sus empleados tengan la oportunidad para trabajar en un ambiente más saludable y sobre todo a ser tratados de manera justa y equitativa.
texts.en:
Amílcar grows coffee certified with Comercio Justo y Rainforest. Growing coffee is his only means of support for his family which consists of his wife, two children, and himself. He is 38 years old and has been growing coffee for more than 18 years.

Every day he experiments with new production techniques with the goal of increasing the quality and quantity of his crop without making any sacrifices. His principal aim is to make coffee growing more sustainable and environmentally sound after our bad treatment of the land. One type of production that greatly interests Amílcar is organic coffee which has better marketing possibilities than conventional ones. Also organic coffee is better for a healthy environment and animal biodiversity. For this reason he wishes to start converting his plantation to organic coffee so he will have 100% organic coffee.

Amícar is seeking a loan to start the conversion process to organic coffee without setting aside the practices of Comercio Justo y Rainforest. Once the replanting is completed, certification will show his plantation is 100% sustainable and it will be more productive. A loan will help Amílcar buy organic compost, organic coffee plants, and other organic supplies. He will hire labourers to help with the conversion. With the money he earns Amílcar expects to improve his standard of living and to provide his workers with a healthier work environment where, above all, they will be treated in a fair and equal manner.

loans.use: buy supplies such as organic compost to convert his coffee plantation to an organic one

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cows to sell.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is married and has a child. He is a salt trader at Lake Katwe and  fishes at the same lake. He is able to meet his family's needs and save money for other projects. He has been able to buy land using his savings. Moses now wants to accomplish his greatest  goal which is to build a very nice residential house on that land. However, he does not have the money to meet his construction budget. He will use the loan to buy cement, stones, and timber for construction

loans.use: to buy cement, stones, and timber for construction

loans.name: Optimism - N01Plươngqchính Group

texts.en:
Quyền is 47 years old and married. She lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. She operates a retail business selling dry food and other items, which she has been doing for more than 10 years. Her family is a low-income household in her village. The main hardship that Quyền faces is lack of capital. 

Quyền is the group leader of Optimism-N01PLươngQChính, which consists of five members. She is requesting her third loan from Thanh Hoa Micrcofinance Institution, which she will use to purchase more sugar, sweets, milk, and snacks to sell. In 2013, she joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. With her business profit, Quyền hopes to maintain a successful business, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, sweets, milk, and snacks

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda considers CCT and lenders as God’s example of a blessing. She was previously granted a 15,000 PHP loan and is very grateful that the amount helped her to buy additional products for her variety store. Today, her sales continue to increase.

Imelda aims to improve her business every year. This year, she wants to expand the business by adding additional products and stock so that customers will have a variety of choices. She also wants to have enough capital to buy ingredients for her mini-food stall.

Imelda applied for another loan of 20,000 PHP as she believes that this will be a stepping stone for her dream of having a one-stop-shop someday.

Imelda has been consistent in attending CCT fellowship group that consists of 15 to 30 members where she hears the word of God and testimonies from partners, this made her to become strong spiritually and dependent to God on every occasion.

loans.use: to purchase additional products and merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Josephat

texts.en:
Josephat is a father with two children and their sole provider. They live in Kasese-Uganda.

He operates a retail shop at a very good business site with a lot of customers. He has been able to start a business to raise pigs. Josephat has more opportunities in his business and he will use the loan to buy cosmetics, sugar, soap, and other items to sell and therefore improve his income.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, sugar, soap, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Flaviana

texts.en:
Flaviana has been involved in business since 2009, using her own working capital of $ 400.00.

She is taking the loan of $ 1000.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to buy cigarettes, biscuits, cooking oils, milk, ketchup, sauces, noodles, sweets, pens, slippers, candles, and other items to sell. She is very happy when Tuba Rai Metin offered the loan to her, because she can use this loan to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy  cigarettes, biscuits, cooking oils, milk, ketchup, sauces, noodles, sweets, pens, slippers, candles, and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El tiene 64 años de edad es casado su ocupación es empleado en una dependencia de gobierno. Hace algunos meses perdió su vista por las cataratas que padece por lo que fue inhabilitado para trabajar. El señor depende en todo momento de alguien incluso para realizar actividades de cuidado personal. El quiere recuperar su vista para valerse por si mismo para él depender de alguien es muy triste. El ocupa urgentemente un implante de lente intraocular para volver a su vida normal. Lamentablemente sus ingresos son pocos y no puede pagar el tratamiento.
texts.en:
This gentleman is 64 years old and married. His occupation is that of an employee for a government agency. A few months ago, he lost his vision as a result of cataracts and was not able to work. The borrower depends on someone at all times to help him with daily living activities. He wants to regain his vision so that he can take care of himself because he feels sad that he must rely on someone else.

The borrower is in urgent need of an intraocular lens implant so that he can return to a normal life. Unfortunately, he has very little income and is not able to pay for this treatment.

loans.use: to pay for eye surgery.

loans.name: Alexandrina

texts.en:
Alexandrina is a woman who is very interested in business; she is not overly dependent on her husband to be responsible in the household. She opened her business in 2007 with a capital base of $500.

Now she is requesting a loan of $700 from Tuba Rai Metin to add to her capital to buy more goods such as sugar, salts, noodles, tea, biscuits, cigarettes, candles, soaps, and other things to sell. She plans to open a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more goods such as sugar, salts, noodles, tea, biscuits, cigarettes, candles, soaps, and other things to sell.

loans.name: Claveles Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Claveles se unio con la esperanza de poder ayudarse las unas a las otras por medio del programa de comité de mujeres, y también a través del programa de eliminación de la pobreza. Todas ponen lo mejor de sí para poder crecer y mejorar.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Daisy, quien en su encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza mostró estar trabajando arduamente y de manera muy activa. Es una persona muy luchadora que está poniendo todo de sí para poder crecer. Ella tiene una mercería donde tiene todo tipo de productos a la venta.
La Sra. Daisy solicita de este préstamo para la compra de prendas, calzados, artículos de bazar y otros, lo que le ayudará  a concretar su negocio de mercería, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The members of the group named “Claveles” (Carnations) joined together in hopes of helping one another through the Women’s Committee Program. They are also participating in the poverty elimination program. All of them are doing their best so that they can grow and improve.

One of the members is Sra. Daisy. Her poverty elimination survey results indicate that she is working hard and remaining very active. She is a very determined woman who is doing everything she can to grow. Her business is a haberdashery where she sells all types of products.

Sra. Daisy is requesting a loan in order to buy clothes, shoes, bazaar products, and other items to sell. This will help to solidify her haberdashery business and improve her earnings.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, bazaar products, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda has been operating a sari-sari(variety) store for 2 years now. She sells items ranging from basic commodities like edible oil, vinegar, sugar, coffee, eggs, powdered milk, biscuits, tooth paste and assorted canned goods.
She is a 48 year old married woman with three dependents that are 25,22 and 10 years old.
Her husband has an income that helps to provide for the family's daily needs.
She needs additional capital for her to maintain the variety of supplies in her store. In addition to that, she could also respond and better serve her customers' needs. That will enable her to improve her business and gain higher earnings.
She has requested a loan in the amount of 20,000 PHP to buy soft drinks, rice, pig feed and gasoline.

When she buys what she plans with the loan, she will be able to manage her business well and support the needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, rice, pig feed and gasoline.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is a 53-year-old married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Margarita has had a general store for 5 years and requests 50,000 PHP through NWTF to buy groceries to sell.

In the future, Margarita would like to save enough money to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa is 52 years old and married with eight children, two of whom are in school. For the past six years she has operated her sari-sari, or small general store in the Philippines in order to make a living.

Felisa has applied for a 23,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF in order to buy more stock for her store such as snack foods, rice, canned goods and other groceries. She is saving her money to build up her business and repair her family’s home.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her store.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a hardworking married man living in Fort Portal Uganda. He is in a business of buying and selling cattle which he started way back in 2010 with a vision to provide an income for his family. Patrick is one of the model farmers in his village. He works very hard towards enlarging his farm and buying more cows for trading. His business is affected by seasonality changes especially prolonged drought when his animals lack enough water and grass to feed on. Patrick has asked for a loan to buy cows to sell.

loans.use: to buy cows to sell.

loans.name: Natalia

texts.en:
Natalia is a woman who is very interested in business and is not overly dependent on her husband to be completely responsible for the household budget. So requests a loan of $1000 from Tuba Rai Metin to buy sugar, salt, cooking oil, tea, biscuits, cigarettes, candles, soaps, ketchup, toothpaste, lighters, soft drinks and other items to sell.

She plans to open a bigger business in the future. She opened her business in 2009 with a capital base of $400.

loans.use: to buy  sugar, salt, cooking oil, tea, biscuits, cigarettes, candles, soaps, ketchup, toothpaste, lighters, soft drinks, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en: Antonio is a 31-year-old man from Timor Leste. He lives with his wife and 3 children.  He is a teacher. The family works together to provide a good life for their three children and he needs a loan of $1000 to send his children to secondary school. He hopes that by continuing his children’s education, they will have more opportunities and a better life.  The money will be used to pay educational costs including textbooks and a backpack for his son.

loans.use: to pay educational costs including textbooks and a backpack for his son.

loans.name: Mathew

texts.en:
Mathew is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Barau Village.

Mathew joined Babban Gona to increase his wealth. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Mathew will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags of maize. This season, Mathew has grand plans to harvest 30 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably.

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Mathew now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his farm’s yields.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en: Rosalia is a 39-year-old married woman with four children who works hard to support her family. She is a teacher and her husband works in agriculture. The family works very hard but it can be difficult for them to afford the cost of her son's education. This loan of $ 600 will allow her children to  study. She will use the loan to pay for tuition, textbooks, and school supplies. Rosalia loves her children very much and hopes that further education will help them to have a brighter future.

loans.use: to pay for tuition, textbooks, and school supplies.

loans.name: Palmira

texts.en: Palmira is a 25-year-old married woman with one children who works hard to support her family. She is a staff-member in a company and her husband works in agriculture. Even though the family works very hard, it can be difficult for her to afford the cost of her education. This loan of $ 800 will allow Palmira to get her University degree. She will use the loan to pay for school registration and school supplies. Palmira hopes that further education will help them to have a brighter future.

loans.use: to pay for school registration and school.

loans.name: Adzo

texts.fr: Adzo est une jeune femme mariée âgée de 22 ans résidant à Adidogomé. Mère de trois enfants, Adzo est une revendeuse de chaussures qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend  dans les quartiers environnant. Adzo sollicite ce prêt pour commander des douzaines de chaussures afin de répondre favorablement aux besoins de ses clients et avoir une autonomie financière considérable pour aider ses enfants dans leur éducation.
texts.en: Marie is a young woman, 22 years old, residing in Adidogomé. The mother of three, she is a retailer of shoes, which are supplied twice a month at the market. She resells her merchandise in nearby districts. Marie is requesting this loan to order dozens of shoes to respond favorably to the needs of her customers and to have considerable financial autonomy for helping out her children with their education.

loans.use: to purchase 10 dozen shoes

loans.name: Vimbai

texts.en: Vimbai, 25, is from the Wedza District of Zimbabwe. She is married and has a child.Three years ago, she became a matemba vendor who moved from village to village. But now she has her shop in a rented space. She supplies rice, flour, sugar, cooking oil and snacks to her community. As a Camfed Learner Guide, Vimbai also volunteers each week at the local secondary school as a teacher of life skills. Vimbai plans to use this loan to purchase morden part for her grinding meal and maize for her to produce more ealie meal for sale.Her hope is to have a stable income, one that can support her family. When she received her previous loan, she stocked her grocery shop and expanded her business to include a grinding mill. Vimbai is now an empowered and powerful woman. Thank you for supporting this loan. Now she runs a successful grinding mill.Vimbai is planning to go back to school. She hopes to become a teacher. She has managed to pay for tutorials in mathematics, which she intends to rewrite, using profits from her business. She now hopes to get a second loan to buy parts for her grinding mill and maize to produce mealie meal.

loans.use: to purchase modern parts for her grinding mill and maize to produce mealie meal.

loans.name: Dockers Group

texts.en:
Alhaji, who is in his mid 30's, is married with two children. One is still in school, and the other one is still small.

He has been selling house utensils for ten years now. He works from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily, and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Alhaji's 20th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase and to buy the fast moving items in his utensils business. He is doing great with the loan, and appreciates Kiva for the support of the group.

He used the profit to pay school fees, take care of his family, repay loans, buy a plot of land, a TV set, a radio and cupboards, to start building his house and to cover household expenses. He will use this loan to increase the house utensils for resale. He dreams of finishing building his house.
