Alhaji will share this loan with his loan group, Dockers, which has two members, who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase his house utensils for resale.

loans.name: Hilda Piedad

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Damas Del Futuro se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Pajan,  cantón conocido por ser una zona muy ganadera de la provincia, un atractivo es el rodeo montubio que organizan en algunas épocas del año. 
En este lugar vive la señora Hilda, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 5 hijos de 12, 8 (gemelos), 5 y 4 años de  edad, todos estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es artesano.
Doña Hilda junto a su esposo  tienen una panadería en un local que arriendan cerca de su casa que está muy bien ubicado para sus ventas, allí ellos elaboran pan de varios moldes y sabores así como también roscas y muchos productos más que son el deleite de sus clientes que a diario compran se su local, desde la madrugada ellos se levantan para tener listo todo para cuando lleguen sus clientes, llevan más de 9 años trabajando en esta actividad la cual les permite ganarse la vida.
Este crédito es para comprar harina, huevos, azúcar y otros ingredientes para preparar el pan. Lleva 5 años  en el grupo de crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos. Sus sueños son tener su local propio.
texts.en:
The credit group, Damas Del Futuro, (Women of the Future), meets every 15 days in the Pajan district. The area is known as a cattle zone in the province. A local attraction is  a rodeo of the Montubian people of the coastal area, organized certain times of the year.  

Mrs. Hilda lives in this area. She is 39 years old, married and has five children. They are 12 years old, twins eight years old, and a five and four year old. They all study in secondary or elementary school. Her husband is an artisan. 

Mrs. Hilda and her husband have a bakery in a locale they rent near their home. It is well-situated for sales. They make bread of various shapes and tastes such as doughnuts and many more products. The products delight their customers who make daily purchases at the bakery. Hilda and her husband rise at dawn so that they have everything ready when the customers arrive. They have been working in this activity for more than nine years. It allows them to earn a living. 

This loan is to purchase flour, eggs, sugar, and other ingredients to prepare the bread. Hilda has been in the group for five years and she is pleased with the help that the loans provide. Her dream is to have her own site for her bakery.

loans.use: to purchase flour, eggs, sugar, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Joann

texts.en:
As a housewife, Joann wants to earn income while at home. She is grateful that the Center for Community Transformation (CCT), as well as all lenders, helped her monetarily by approving her previous loan worth Php 9,000. The amount helped her to buy an additional computer set as she dreams of expanding her internet café which will result in increased income each day.

Joann is persevering to save so they can buy their own house and lot someday. For this reason, she is determined to make the business grow. So she decided to apply for another loan amounting to Php 14,000 to buy additional set of computer. More computers means bigger earnings and this may also add and attract new patrons.

Joann is consistent in attending weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members where she gains spiritual strength for member’s life changing testimony, share her own experience of God’s love, pay Micro Finance loans and hear God’s word that was conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to buy more computers for her business.

loans.name: Take A Chance - N02Th3Ttrung Group

texts.en:
Mrs Năm is 25 years old and she is married. She has been working in agriculture raising poultry for 6 years. Năm lives in Yen Dinh district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region. The income from this business is unstable because when some disease on poultry happens, they could die, which left her nothing to sell. So she will be in trouble with finance. The main hardship that Năm faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

In 2015, Năm joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. She hopes that this loan could improve her life standard. She is the group leader of "Take a chance -N02Th3TTrung", which consists of 3 members. With her business profit, Năm hopes to buy land of her own, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: To purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Lubna

texts.en:
Lubna is a responsible mother of 2 children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for 8 years. Her husband is responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family. Her husband needs to make maintenance of his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good. It requires more maintenance charges on daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to make maintenance of his taxi, therefore, Lubna has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan Lubna's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily and provide better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. Lubna also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future. Lubna is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband make wanted to repairs his taxi.

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo is a 39-year-old married father of three children, who works hard to support his family. He is a teacher and his wife is housewife.

Although the he works very hard, it can be difficult for him to afford the cost of his education. This loan of $1000 will allow Romeo to finish his university studies.

He will use the loan to pay for school registration and school supplies. Romeo hopes that further education will help his family to have a brighter future and that they will be happy.

loans.use: to pay for school registration and school supplies.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is a 69-year-old widow with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 19,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Eva has been in this business for 32 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rebecca Hope

texts.en:
Rebecca is a resident of Ojwina in the Lira district. She is 33 years old and married with two children. She is dealing in the business of selling clothes in Lira, and there is high demand for clothes in Lira since there are many people in the town. Rebecca caters to her children's education and the family with the help of her husband. 

Rebecca operates a mobile money business to earn additional income. She has applied for the loan of UGX 900,000 million with UGAFODE Microfinance to boost her business. This will help her to meet the demand of her customers. She is grateful to UGAFODE and Kiva funders for their support. She is optimistic the business will expand very soon if she keeps getting the financial boost.

loans.use: To increase her mobile money float

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 51 years old, married with five children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosalinda has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Rosalinda requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

Rosalinda has been in this business for three years. In the future, Rosalinda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell

loans.name: Yasmin

texts.en:
Yasmin is 36 years old and married with three children. With two of her children in school, Yasmin works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines, where she sells a variety of items such as sugar, canned goods, diapers, and other groceries.

She has requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Yasmin has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Mehraj

texts.en:
Mehraj, 43, lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband and child. Her husband has been working in the public sector for many years and earns the main means of support for the family. She also contributes to the family income by providing sewing services to the community.

Mehraj has applied for a 50,000 PKR loan through Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan to buy sewing supplies such as needles, thread, fabric, machine oil, etc. for her business. With these supplies she will be able to increase her monthly sales and provide her customers with better service.

Mehraj is very thankful for Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their assistance.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies such as needles, thread, fabric, machine oil, etc. for her sewing business.

loans.name: Rosaline

texts.fr: Rosaline est une femme mariée qui vit à Tokoin et qui a un enfant à charge. Agée de 31 ans, Rosaline est une revendeuse de mèches qui s’approvisionne au marché et le revend dans sa boutique et dans les quartiers. Rosaline désire ce prêt pour acheter des unités de mèches en vue d’en tirer un maximum de profit et d’amélioré les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Rosaline is a married woman who lives in Tokoin and who has a dependent child. 31 years old, Rosaline is a re-seller of locks of hair who gets her supplies from the market and re-sells in her shop and the neighbourhoods. Rosaline wants this loan to buy units of locks of hair in order to get the greatest profit possible and to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy 29 units of locks of hair.

loans.name: Koessiwa

texts.fr: Koessiwa est une femme mariée âgée de 30 ans résidante à Tokoin. Mère de deux enfants, Koessiwa est une revendeuse des produits alimentaires et des chaussures qu’elle revend à domicile dans sa boutique. Koessiwa s’approvisionne deux fois par mois  au marché et sollicite ce prêt pour commander des triplets de chaussures et des douzaines de pattes dentifrices.  Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera, Koessiwa compte améliorer sa prestation de vente et aider sa famille à avoir un bon épanouissement et une bonne éducation scolaire à ses enfants.
texts.en: Koessiwa is a 30 year old married woman living in Tokoin. Mother of two children, Koessiwa is a re-sellers of food products and shoes that she re-sells at home in her shop. Koessiwa gets her supplies twice a month at the market and asks for this loan to order triplets of shoes and dozens of toothpaste. With the profit margin that will result, Koessiwa intends to improve her sales performance and to help her family to have good prosperity and a good school education for her children.

loans.use: To buy 14 triplets of shoes and 4 dozens of toothpaste.

loans.name: Alhassan

texts.en:
Alhassan operates commercial toilets within the Nima community. For some time now, one of the structures was brought down with the intention of reconstructing it to deliver better services to the community and visitors. 

As part of the effort to reconstruct the facility, he has been able to raise some of the money and will need this loan to complete the facility. Alhassan also has another facility that is currently operating, so the proceeds will be used to service the loan when granted.

loans.use: to buy building materials to complete the construction of a toilet facility which will serve the entire community.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is a 41-year-old married man with two children. He lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. He does business selling bicycle and auto spare parts alongside growing tomatoes. He started these businesses way back in 2009, serving customers in a busy trading center, and they value him as a hardworking man.

Jackson has future prospects of becoming financially independent and educating all his children to higher levels of learning. He is facing a challenge of limited capital that hinders him from expanding his business. Jackson has asked for a loan to buy spare parts to sell.

loans.use: to add to his stock of spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to open her own bakery.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Damas Del Futuro se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Pajan,  cantón conocido por ser una zona muy ganadera de la provincia, un atractivo es el rodeo montubio que organizan en algunas épocas del año. 
En este lugar vive la señora Juanita, tiene 56 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tiene dos hijos mayores de edad e independientes, con ellos viven dos nietos de 6 y de 11 meses ya que ella los cuida porque su hija trabaja fuera de la ciudad.  El esposo es agricultor. 
Doña Juanita junto a sus marido y su hijo tiene un negocio de compra y venta de paja toquilla, ellos compran la paja toquilla de los agricultores en forma natural,  luego les dan el tratamiento adecuado para así poder vender a artesanos tanto de la ciudad o de otras ciudades que los emplean para elaborar sombreros, adornos y muchos otros productos muy apreciados por los clientes tanto nacionales y extranjeros, la mayoría de la paja toquilla se la venden a comerciantes que luego exportan al Perú lugar en el cual les pagan a muy buen precio. De esta forma ellos logran salir adelante en una actividad que la vienen realizando por generaciones.
Este crédito es para comprar paja toquilla en forma natural y azufre  que es lo que necesitan para tratar la paja. Lleva más de 10  años  en el grupo de crédito y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos pueden salir adelante. Sus sueños son tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The credit group, Damas Del Futuro, (Women of the Future) meets every fifteen days in the district of Pajan. It is known as a cattle zone in the province. A local attraction is the rodeo of the Montubian people of the coast that takes place some times of the year.

Juanita lives in Pajan. She is 56 years old, living in a civil union, and has two independent adult children. Two grandchildren, ages six and eleven months, live with her. She cares for them because her daughter works outside the city. Her husband is a farmer.

Juanita and her husband and son have a business of buying and selling straw. They buy the straw from the farmers in raw form. Then they treat it appropriately to be able to sell it to local artisans of their city and other cities. The artisans use it to make hats, ornaments, and many other products that are valued by their customers, both national and foreign. The majority of the straw that they sell to the businessmen is then exported to Peru, where they are paid a very good price. In this manner, they move forward in an activity that has been carried out for generations.

This loan is to buy the raw straw and sulfur that is necessary to treat the straw. Juanita has been in the credit group for more than ten years. She likes it because, thanks to the loans, they are able to progress. Her dream is to have good health.

loans.use: to purchase straw and sulfur.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
For the past fifteen years Isabel has managed her sari-sari, or small general store in the Philippines. She first had her doubts about the possibility of success. Market competition and customer demand was daunting.

However, she is grateful that with the help of the Lord and Kiva's field partner Center for Community Transformation (CCT) she has prospered and seen her business grow every year. For her, God has supplied customers, and her sales have surprisingly increased. Her store has become a good source of income for her family’s daily expenses.

Isabel took out and successfully repaid a prior loan of 15,000 PHP. She wishes again to express her deepest appreciation for this assistance. She now has applied for another 15,000 PHP loan to add more stock to her store such as grocery items, bottled drinks and other supplies. A plentiful supply of goods will indeed increase sales and profits.

All CCT community clients like Isabel are organized into fellowship groups of fifteen to thirty members who meet on a weekly basis. There they share stories of their work, repay microfinance loans and draw strength and inspiration from their study of the Word of God.

loans.use: to add more stock to her store such as grocery items, bottled drinks and other supplies.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house, which neither has electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past four years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Faraja Group

texts.en:
Mwavita has two children aged 6 and 11 years old. Her business is selling fish. She is asking for a new loan of $400. All members of this group finished their loan correctly, and they said that the loan generated more income for them.

Mwavita is a good mother, enterprising, dynamic, consistent, active, responsible and very hard-working. She has her business in the city of Bukavu which is an area of intense economic activity which has generated the establishment of large markets with innumerable stores and shops.

The advantage of her business is that sales are daily and routine. Her dream is to have a stable business for her children. She wants to purchase more fish to resell, This is her sixth loan with the institution in the four years she has been doing this business.

For these reasons, Mwavita is requesting a loan to buy salted fish to establish a business she can pass on to her children in the future.

loans.use: to purchase salt fish at the market.

loans.name: Rehema Grp Musoma Group

texts.en:
Jackson, in his mid 30s, is married with three children who are still in school. He has been running two projects: a retail shop and a boda boda business for two years. He works from 7am to 6pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Jackson's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to buy a boda boda and increased his shop inventory and has paid back his loan successfully. He used the profit to pay school fees, to repay the loan and to cover household expenses. He will use this loan to increase his retail inventory and to service his boda boda. He dreams of owning a big business.

Jackson will share this loan with his loan group Rehema Grp Musoma, which consists of three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase his retail inventory and to service his boda boda.

loans.name: Eudora Anita

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Damas Del Futuro se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Pajan,  cantón conocido por ser una zona muy ganadera de la provincia, un atractivo es el rodeo montubio que organizan en algunas épocas del año. 
En este lugar vive la señora Anita, tiene 48 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tiene tres hijos mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun vive en su casa.  El esposo es agricultor y ganadero. 
Doña Anita es una muy buena esposa que para ayudarle a  su marido realiza el crédito para que él lo utilice en su negocio, él se dedica al comercio, compra y venta de ganado y chanchos, dos días a la semana el recorre los campos para comprar estos animalitos que luego lleva a revender al mercado local lugar donde ya tiene sus clientes que semana a semana le compran, en ocasiones compra terneros los mismos que mantiene por un tiempo y luego ya grandes los vende, el tiene potreros en los cuales estos pueden tener un gran desarrollo,  así el se gana más lo cual les sirve para salir adelante
Este crédito es para comprar chanchos y reces para la venta del fin de semana. Lleva 4 años  en el  Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos se le mas fácil financiar su negocio. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The credit group, Damas Del Future, ( Women of the Future) meets every fifteen days in the Pajan district, known as a cattle area in the province. A local attraction is the rodeo of the Montubian people of the coast, that is held some times of the year.

Anita is a good wife who is taking out the loan to help her husband in his business. He works in the business of buying and selling cattle and hogs. Two days a week he travels the countryside to buy the young animals that he takes to resell in the local market where he already has clients that buy from him from week to week. Sometimes he buys calves that he raises for a time and then, when big, he sells. He has pastures where they can grow well. In this way, he earns more which helps him move forward.

This loan is to buy hogs and cattle for sale on the weekends. Anita has been in the credit group for four years. She likes it because with the loans it is easier to finance the business. her dream is to give the best to her family.

loans.use: to purchase hogs and cattle.

loans.name: Ayasi

texts.en:
Ayasi has 4 four children, runs a transportation business, and farms.These businesses help him to meet his family's expenses and run his business.

His taxi has mechanical problems, and he needs money to repair it. He requests a loan to buy new tires and service his vehicle.

loans.use: to buy new tires.

loans.name: Zuena

texts.en:
Zuena is a married mother of five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over two years, she has operated an open air food-selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking fat

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is married with four school going children. They live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She has operated a Khanga (women's wrap cloth) selling business, selling from home and door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition in her business. With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of Khanga’s for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of Khangas for resale

loans.name: Risper

texts.en:
Risper is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 30,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.
.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married mother of four children, three of whom attend school; the other one is still young to attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over three years, she has operated an open-air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the KES 10,000, she wants to purchase a stock of wheat flour,cooking oil,beans and maize flour for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of wheat flour,cooking oil,beans and maize flour for her business

loans.name: Ngodzero

texts.en:
Ngodzero is married with four children, all of whom attend school. They live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Ngodzero has operated a fuel business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality from other fuel selling operators in her business.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase more stock of fuel for resale. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a stock  of fuel for resale.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is married woman and has two children, one of whom attends school and the other is still too young to attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past five years, she has owned a food stall business selling to her neighbours and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil. She dreams of expanding to a modern café in the business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is a married woman with one child, who is young to attend school. She rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food .

For the past two years, she has operated a soft drink fruit juice selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces the challenges of seasonality and the high cost of transporting raw materials. 

With the 50,000 KES she wants to purchase sacks of fruits, mangoes, and passion fruits for making fruit juice for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits, mangoes, and passion fruits for making fruit juice for sale

loans.name: Mwanarusi

texts.en:
Mwanarusi is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that  neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 20,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is a married woman with six children, five of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

She has operated a restaurant selling business for ten years, selling to the neighbors. She mentioned a major challenge of seasonality in her business

With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase a sack of food stuffs like soda and wheat flour for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans and boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a sack of food stuffs like soda and wheat flour for her business.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman and has been blessed with three kids who attend school. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

Fatuma has operated a poultry selling business, which has been operational for over five years. She mentioned disease outbreak causing losses as a challenge in the business. Fatuma dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future.

With the 30,000 KES, she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feeds. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feeds

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with four children.All of whom attend school,She owns a house that has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses is food.
She has operated a video showing business for the past seven years. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase sitting chairs and paint for painting her video showing business. She decided to join Yehu to access loan and boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sitting chairs and pants for painting her video showing business

loans.name: Mehnaz

texts.en:
A responsible mother of one child, Mehnaz lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband, a taxi driver. He has been in business for the past twelve years and is the sole means of support for the family.

Mehnaz’ husband needs to do some maintenance work on this taxi. It is not in good condition, and the family hasn’t the money to refurbish it. Therefore, Mehnaz has applied for a 30,000 PKR loan through Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan to be applied toward the taxi’s maintenance. This will result in greater profits for the family.

Mehnaz also plans to put away money to meet her family's future needs. She is very grateful for Kiva and BRAC Pakistan’s assistance.

loans.use: pay for needed maintenance on her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: ELLA ES UNA MADRE SOLTERA SU ÚNICO HIJO PRESENTA SEVERO APIÑAMIENTO EN SUS  PIEZAS DENTALES LO  QUE LE PROVOCA ALTERACIÓN EN LA MANDÍBULA Y PROBLEMAS PARA ALIMENTARSE ADECUADAMENTE, APARTE DEL EVIDENTE PROBLEMA ESTÉTICO QUE ES MOTIVO DE BURLA ENTRE SUS COMPAÑEROS DE ESCUELA. NECESITA URGENTEMENTE UN TRATAMIENTO DE ORTODONCIA QUE RESULTA COSTOSO PARA LA ECONOMÍA DE SU FAMILIA.
texts.en:
This borrower is a single mother. Her only child has severe crowding of the teeth. He is in need of a jaw alignment because he has problems getting enough to eat. It is also evident that this is a cosmetic problem that needs to be corrected because of the teasing he gets from his classmates.

The borrower’s child is in urgent need of orthodontic treatment that is costly for her family’s finances.

loans.use: to pay for her child's dental treatment.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle, 26, lives in Intramuros, Philippines and is a member of Center of Community Transformation (CCT). While her husband, Basillio, is at work, Michelle is in charge of the household chores. She also sells personal products such as lotion, soap and makeup to her friends and neighbors. She earns about 8,000 PHP every month.

In Michelle’s business a customer will usually have to wait for a week or two to have their order delivered. If there were more products directly available, she could fulfill their orders immediately, which would improve her customers’ experiences and increase their loyalty.

Michelle would love to see this happen and dreams of having a display cabinet full of products. Hoping for this vision to become a reality, Michelle has applied for 10,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner CCT to increase her stock and prays for her loan request to be approved.

All CCT community clients like Michelle are organized into fellowship groups of fifteen to thirty members who meet on a weekly basis. There they share stories of their work, repay microfinance loans and draw strength and inspiration from their study of the Word of God.

loans.use: to fill her display cabinet with a full range of personal products to sell.

loans.name: Nyota Njema Group

texts.en:
Khadija, who is in her early 20s, is married with two kids, one of whom is in school and another who is still small. She has been selling used electronic equipment, such as TVs, refrigerators, radios, irons, etc. for three years now. She works from 6 am to 9 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Khadija’s third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her business stock and has managed to pay back all her loans successfully. She is so grateful for the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group. She used the profit to pay school fees and the loan repayment and to cover household expenses. She will use this loan to buy the fast moving items in her business. She dreams of building her own house.

Khadija will share this loan with her loan group Nyota Njema which consist of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy the fast moving items in her business.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 28-year-old fish monger from Mikindani Mombasa. A single mother of two who has been in this business for the past year, she is doing well.

Ester is requesting her first loan to purchase dry fish for resale and will use the anticipated profit to educate her children and buy food for the family. She hopes to purchase large stocks of dry fish in the future and make a great profit.

loans.use: to purchase dry fish for resale

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
Alona, 37, is a hardworking fisherwoman in the Philippines. She is married and has six children, four of whom are in school.

Alona took out and successfully repaid a previous loan Kiva's field partner NWTF. She has now applied for another loan, this for 23,000 PHP, to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her business. NWTF is relisting Alona's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her business.

loans.name: Saye's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été crée depuis le cycle premier du banc villageois composé de cinq femmes issues du même unies par de bonnes relations sociales et professionnelles. village. Madame Saye la responsable est âgée de 50 ans et mère de six enfants dont quatre garçons et deux filles.
Elle s'active dans le commerce par la vente d'accessoires de femmes .Avec son nouveau crédit de cinq cent mille francs CFA elle va se payer des bijoux des tissus et vêtements prêt à porter femme. Elle dispose d'une bonne expérience dans ce domaine pour l'avoir pratiqué depuis bientôt dix ans.Sa clientèle est composée des femmes de son villages.
Les bénéfices réalisés lui permettent de prendre en charge les besoins alimentaires scolaires et sanitaire de ses enfants et de renforcer son capital.
texts.en:
This group was created during the first loan cycle of the Banc Villageois. It is composed of five women from the same village, united by good social and professional relations. Madame Saye, the leader, is 50 years old and the mother of six children, four sons and two daughters.

She works at selling women's accessories. With her portion of the new loan, amounting to 500,000 francs CFA, she is going to buy jewelry, lengths of cloth, and ready-to-wear clothing for women.

She has a good deal of experience in this field since she has been working in it for almost 10 years. Her clientele is composed of the women from her village and other villages. The profit she will make will allow her to pay for food, school, and healthcare needs for her children and grow her working capital.

loans.use: to buy accessories for women in order to stock a little business.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia was able to buy containers of mineral water regularly to supply to her clients, as Center for Community Transformation (CCT) was able to approve her previous loan application. She wants to send her deepest appreciation to lenders as well, for providing financial support. The amount certainly helped her retain and add more patrons.

Aside from being involved in buying and selling of mineral water, Lydia is also currently managing her internet café business. She is a hardworking mother as she has dreams for her family. She applied for another loan of PHP 10,000 and hopes that you will once again consider her application. Lydia wants to have spare budget in maintaining her computer units and to buy more containers of mineral water each day. 

Lydia believes that if you want success to come in, you need God to be your greatest foundation. She is consistent in attending her weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members. There, she gains spiritual strength from members' life-changing testimony and sharing her own experience of God’s love, repays her microfinance loans, and hears God’s word being conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to buy additional containers of mineral water to increase her product inventory

loans.name: Onjaniaina

texts.fr:
Onjaniaina est une femme débrouillarde et travailleuse de 22 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de deux petits enfants de 3 et 5 ans. Ces derniers sont déjà scolarisés en ce moment. 
Elle et son mari exercent ensemble l'activité génératrice de revenu de la famille. C'est une jeune femme ayant de l'esprit créatif et d'ambition. Elle fabrique des protèges cahiers, comme nous pouvons voir sur sa photo. Et à part ça, elle vend d'autres articles de fournitures de bureau et scolaires. Elle en possède six années d'expérience. 
Elle est déjà propriétaire de sa maison d'habitation et son projet est  d'épargner et d'acheter des meubles.
texts.en:
Onjaniaina is a resourceful woman and worker who is 22 years old. She is married and the mother of two young children, aged three and five. Both children are already attending school at this time.

Onjaniaina and her husband run the family's income-generating activity together. This is a young woman with ambition and a creative spirit. She makes notebook covers, as you can see in the photo. Onjaniaina also sells other office and school supplies. She has six years of experience.

Onjaniaina already owns her home and her goal is to save and purchase furniture.

loans.use: purchase four rolls of plastic.

loans.name: Santa Rosa 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo de nombre Santa Rosa 2 es un grupo nuevo, dentro del cual las integrantes están en el programa de eliminación de la pobreza. Son mujeres luchadoras que quieren lo mejor para sus familias, es por eso que decidieron unirse para crecer y salir adelante.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Lilian, una persona que se destaca por su lucha diaria y a través de su pequeño negocio de venta de comidas tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia. Es una mujer muy buena en lo que hace, es por eso que tiene una buena cantidad de clientes que siempre compran de ella las delicias que prepara.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos variados para seguir haciendo sus comidas, como ser verduras, carnes, condimentos, hortalizas y otros. Agradecen por la oportunidad que reciben todas de mejorar sus vidas.
texts.en:
The group named “Santa Rosa 2” is a new group in which its members are participating in the poverty elimination program. They are determined women who want the best for their families, so they have decided to join together so that the can grow and move forward.

One of the members is Sra. Lilian, a person who is known for striving each day. Through her small business of selling food, Lilian has the means to help her family. She is very good at what she does, which explains why she has a large number of customers who always buy the delicious food that she prepares.

Lilian is requesting a loan in order to buy various supplies so that she can continue preparing food such as vegetables, meats, condiments, greens, and other items. She and the other members appreciate the opportunity they have received so that all of them can improve their lives.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meats, condiments, greens, and other items.

loans.name: Gulzar

texts.en:
Gulzar is a 52-year-old woman and a mother of three children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a fruit seller by profession, selling fruits like apples, bananas, grapes, etc. Her husband is solely responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household.

Gulzar's husband needs to purchase different types of fruits for reselling so that he can increase the size of his business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profits. Due to his unfavorable financial condition, her husband is not in a position to purchase fruits for his business.

Therefore, Gulzar has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for his business. She is very thankful to Kiva and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's fruit business.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 51 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines.

Marites is borrowing PHP 16,500 through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs. Marites has been raising pigs for three years, and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: boost her clothing sales business

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Abla est une femme mariée qui vit à Adidogomé avec ses cinq enfants à charge. Agée de 44 ans, Abla est une femme dynamique et courageuse  qui vend des habits pour enfants en circulant les quartiers environnant afin de disposer d’une bonne capacité financière. Pour atteindre ses objectifs, Abla s’approvisionne au marché et sollicite ce prêt pour commander des unités de corsages, jupes, chemises et pantalon afin de financer son commerce et trouver un bon rendement pour subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens et aider son mari à payer les frais scolaire des enfants dès la rentrée prochaine.
texts.en:
Abla is a married woman who lives in Adidogomé with her five children in her care. At 44 years old, Abla is an energetic, courageous woman who sells children's clothing by visiting the surrounding neighborhoods in order to [maintain] a good financial situation.

To meet her goals, Abla gets her supplies at the market and is seeking this loan to purchase sets of blouses, skirts, shirts, and trousers in order to finance her business and generate a good return to meet her day-to-day needs and help her husband pay the children's school fees for the coming school term.

loans.use: purchase 10 sets of blouses and skirts and 10 sets of shirts and trousers.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 28 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la agricultura siembra maíz, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, el joven vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con su trabajo y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
The young man whose face is pixelated is 28 years old and lives in a high risk area. He works in agriculture by planting corn. His products are sold at different markets that are located near his home. The borrower lives in his own house along with his wife and two children.

He is requesting a loan in order to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest controls, and other supplies so that he can improve the land that is shown in the photograph. As a result, he will be able to continue his work and have more income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest controls, and other supplies.

loans.name: Hilda Guadalupe

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Damas Del Futuro se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Pajan,  cantón conocido por ser una zona muy ganadera de la provincia, un atractivo es el rodeo montubio que organizan en algunas épocas del año. 
En este lugar vive la señora Hilda, tiene 59 años de edad, es madre soltera tiene un hijo el cual es mayor de edad y comprometido.
Doña Hilda es una mujer que siempre le toco trabajar duro ya sea para sacar adelante a su hijo cuando tuvo que hacerlo y ahora para ella salir adelante sin tener que depender de nadie, ella hace mas de 10 años se dedica a la cría de gallinas criollas,  tiene  una granja en su casa ya que allí cuenta con el espacio suficiente para esto, cría sus gallinas las cuales además de venderlas también le dan huevos los mismos que también vende a muy buen precio, ella en ocasiones con la venta de huevos se mantiene y logra salir adelante, de esta misma forma ella también vende las gallinas las cuales se venden a muy buen precio.
Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar alimento y medicinas para las gallinas. Lleva más de 4 años en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta por los beneficios que les ofrece la institución. Sus sueños son tener salud y seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The communal bank 'Damas Del Futuro' meets every 15 days in the Pajan canton, which is known for its thriving livestock industry. One of its attractions is the Montubio Rodeo, which takes places at certain times of the year.

Hilda, 59, lives in this area. She is a single mother with an adult son who is engaged. Hilda is a woman who has always had to work hard, either when raising her son or now as she tries to get ahead without having to depend on anyone.

Hilda has been raising Creole hens for more than 10 years. She has a farm at home since there is enough space for one there. She raises her chickens and in addition to selling them, she also collects their eggs and sells them at a very good price. By selling the eggs, she manages to get ahead at times. She also sells the chickens at a very good price.

Hilda will use this loan to buy feed and medicine for the chickens. She has been a member of this communal bank for more than 4 years and she likes the benefits offered by the institution. Her dream is to be healthy and to keep moving forward.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicine for her chickens.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet cannot thank you enough, lenders, for the financial assistance you have provided to her. She does not know you individually, but she prays that God will give you your heart’s desires and bless you even more.

The previous loan really helped her in buying grocery items, toiletries and beverages for her variety store business, resulting sales increases and more patrons. The loan not only improved her business, but also helped to cover day-to-day expenses.

However, some customers who are habitually not paying their debit are affecting her income. Because of this, Janet decided to apply for a loan of PHP 15,000 to restock and add products for her variety store. She is hoping that Center for Community Transformation (CCT) will once again grant her request.

Despite of being busy managing the business, Janet finds time to join CCT group fellowship, consisting of 10 to 15 individuals, where she can gain strength spiritually, hear testimonies from other CCT partners, hear God’s word, study the Word of God, build social relationships with other partners and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of groceries and other supplies for her store

loans.name: Maa Thakurani Shg 9-D Group

texts.en:
Milaki is a 22-year-old married woman living with her parents-in-law and one child in the Koraput District of Odisha, India. She is the one standing to the lefthand side in the photograph and is a single mother. She is engaged in the activity of crafting and selling handmade wall hangings, cushion covers, paper bags, candles, purses, etc., to earn her living and fulfill all the necessities of her only child. She makes these items in her home and sells them to dealers in the nearby market.

Her husband is not financially strong enough to manage the family, so she helps her father manage the family expenses. Along with her group member, Milaki has requested a loan of 30,000 INR, and she will use her portion for purchasing fabrics, colors, paper, glue, glitter, decorative glass, wax, etc., in bulk so that she can make a large quantity of her crafts. She also wants to appoint one more person, who can assist her in the business and help her to make more of the products.

In the future, Milaki wants to give training to the village girls in this art. She also has a dream of giving her parents and her child a quality standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase  fabrics, colors, paper, glue, glitter, decorative glass, wax, etc., in bulk.

loans.name: Milton

texts.en:
Milton is married with children who all attend school in Kasese, Uganda. He owns a hardware shop and also earns a salary. He is a very committed man who goes for what he wants and makes sure he achieves it. He bought land and practices agriculture on it.

Milton now wants to build a house on that same land. He already has some materials on site, but he lacks enough cement, sand and some metals. He is requesting money to buy cement, metals and sand to add to his materials and construct a house.

loans.use: to buy cement, metals and sand to add to his existing materials and construct a house.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 39 years old and married with two children who are both enrolled in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her business.

Mary Grace has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Maa Thakurani Shg 9-E Group

texts.en:
Tulabati is a 37-year-old lady living with her husband and son in a small village in Koraput district. In the picture, the lady standing on the left is Tulabati. Her husband is a farmer. He spends all day at the farm. Her son is at school. During the day, she has all day free, so she decided to form a self-help group. She invited one of her neighbour women and formed a group named Maa Thakurani Shg 9-E.

Tulabati was selected as the featured borrower of the group. Tulabati has a plan to cultivate watermelon and sell it at the market so that she can make a handsome profit. For this reason, she and her group member are requesting a loan amount of 30,000 INR. She will use her portion to buy seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides for her watermelon farming. After this investment, she will be earning and supporting her family. She is very happy that she is able do something that is worthy of her leisure time.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for her watermelon farming

loans.name: Khalid Sindhu

texts.en:
Khalid Sindhu, a 33-year-old father of one son, lives in Lahore, Pakistan where he owns a medical clinic and works as a pharmacist and consultant. He signed an agreement with an MBBS doctor who gives some time to his clinic in the evening to treat patients. Khalid Sindhu prepares doses according to the doctor's prescriptions. 

Khalid Sindhu has become very famous in the society and wants to improve his clinic by acquiring the latest medical instruments, medicines, injections and glucose. He has therefore requested a Kiva loan for that purpose. In this way he will be able provide better health services to the patients.

Khalid Sindhu hopes that through profits he will be able to expand the area of his clinic so he can treat more patients.

loans.use: to buy medical equipment, medicines and injections for his medical clinic.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is single with a child. He practices agriculture and transport business. Charles has a lot of bananas in his garden, but lacks a good market because of limited capital to move to different markets in urban areas.

The established market in his area includes middle men, who buy his products at a very low price. This discourages him so much.

Charles has got an idea of borrowing money to help him in the transportation of his goods and improvement of his life. He now requests for money to hire a motor vehicle to transport his bananas to a market to sell at better prices, and thus improve his income levels.

loans.use: to hire a motor vehicle to transport his bananas to the market to sell.

loans.name: Nahed

texts.en:
Nahed is a 47-year-old married man from Jabalia City, Gaza Strip, which is both a city and a refugee camp. He lives with his family in a small, humble house. Nahed has a photography studio in the city. It is a good business and provides him with a good income, but the recent conflict in the Gaza Strip and the siege has led to the deterioration of the economic situation in general.

Nahed has taken a loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him to buy a new camera for the studio to improve the quality of his images. He hopes that this new camera will enable him to increase his number of customers and eventually save enough income to expand his business .

loans.use: to buy a new camera for his studio.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: Ella es viuda de 60 años de edad, trabaja como empleada de limpieza en una institución publica. Se encuentra inhabilitada para desempeñarse laboralmente,  necesita tratarse de inmediato debido a que su ojo izquierdo le sangra, lo que podría provocar que pierda la cornea, Ella carece de recursos y lamentablemente no cuenta con el apoyo de su familia.
texts.en:
This woman is a 60-year-old widow who is employed as part of the cleaning staff at a public institution. She is unable to work because she needs immediate treatment for bleeding in her left eye, which could result in the loss of her cornea.

She lacks the resources and unfortunately does not have support from her family.

loans.use: to pay for eye treatment.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en:
Azra is a 42-year-old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She has one child. Her husband has been working in a public sector organization for many years. He is responsible for meeting the needs of the family. Azra provides sewing services and she contributes this income to managing the household with her husband.

She needs different kinds of supplies for her business, such as needles, thread, cloth and machine oil, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase them. Therefore she has applied for a loan from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these supplies and will also help her to increase her monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Azra is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Sania

texts.en:
Sania is a 28-year-old woman and a mother of two children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a fruit seller by profession, selling fruits like apples, bananas, grapes, etc. Her husband is solely responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household.

Sania's husband needs to purchase different types of fruits for reselling so that he can increase the size of business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profits. Due to his unfavorable financial condition, he is not in a position to purchase fruits for his business.

Therefore Sania, has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for his business. She is very thankful to Kiva and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's fruit business.

loans.name: Amivi Sitsofé

texts.fr: Amivi est une femme mariée et mère d’un enfant. Amivi vit à Adidogomé et est âgée de 29 ans. Amivi fait le commerce des caleçons et des déodorants pour gagner son revenu. Amivi s’approvisionne deux fois par mois  au marché et sollicite ce crédit pour commander des douzaines de caleçons et des unités de déodorants en vue d’augmenter ses recettes ; ce qui permettra à Amivi de mieux préparer la rentrée scolaire de son enfant et assurer les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
Amivi is a married woman and mother of one child. She lives in Adidogomé, and she is 29. She sells underwear and deodorant to earn an income.

Amivi stocks up twice a month at the market and is asking for this loan to order some dozens of pairs of underwear and some individual deodorants so as to increase her turnover. This will permit Amivi to better prepare for sending her child back to school and ensure the daily expenses for the family.

loans.use: to buy 20 dozen pairs of underwear and 17 deodorants.

loans.name: Gayatri Shg 9-A Group

texts.en:
These members belong to Gayatri Shg 9-A. One of them is Chandrama, age 23. In the picture, the lady standing on the left is Chandrama. She is a divorcee and lives with her toddler and parent-in-law in a village. She alternates her daily activities with a business of selling rice, grams, spices, wafers, hair oil and other household consumables.

Chandrama runs a small shop where she sells all these things to support her family. She has been in this business for a good amount of time, and she does well thanks to the daily effort she puts into her business. She also sells vegetables in her shop. Along with her group member, she is requesting a loan of 30,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to buy sugar, rice, edible oil, soap, detergents and other household consumables for her business. She thanks those who share her dream by this means and commits to make her payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, edible oil, soap, detergents and other household consumables for her business

loans.name: Oto

texts.en:
Oto is a first year student at Kepler in Rwanda. He was accepted from over 6,000 applicants this year, and chose Kepler because he would otherwise be unable to attend university because of cost, despite his tremendous academic record.

An outstanding student, Oto plans to major in communications with a concentration in business, and will graduate from Kepler with a B.A. from a U.S. accredited university. He also hopes to improve his communications skills.

After graduating, his dream is to become a successful entrepreneur, and to develop a company that can provide opportunities to his fellow Rwandans.

loans.use: to pay for a laptop required for a U.S. accredited college degree.

loans.name: Gayatri Shg 9-B Group

texts.en:
Parbati is a 34-year-old differently-able woman who lives with her husband and two children in a small village in Koraput district, Odisha. Her children are in school. She works in a ladies tailoring shop where she get 1,500 INR per month, which is very little at this time, so she planned to open a small tailoring shop in her house where she can earn more money and give enough time to her family as well.

Along with her group member, Parbati has requested a loan of 30,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to buy a new tailoring machine and thread in bulk to start her tailoring shop. She hopes that now she can provide more help to her husband financially for managing the family responsibilities.

Parbati is thankful to those who are going to be a part of her dream in any way. She is the one standing on the right in the photograph.

loans.use: to buy a new tailoring machine and thread in bulk to start her tailoring shop.

loans.name: Lizel

texts.en:
Lizel is 42 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school. Lizel works very hard to provide for them.

Lizel runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of groceries to sell. She has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries.

In the future Lizel would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Princesa

texts.en:
Princesa, 65 years old, is married and a resident of Simacolong, Lazi, Siquijor in the Philippines. Her husband is a fisherman. The fish he catches are sold in the public market or to their neighbors. They have been in this business for many years already.

Since she wants to be more productive, Princesa has now decided to enter into business herself, purchasing fish in bulk for resale at the market. She and her husband agreed to join Kiva's field partner Paglaum MPC to avail themselves of its loans because they want to buy fishing nets. Aside from the financial assistance they receive, they say that they also enjoy the add-on benefits like insurance and savings.

Princesa has now applied for a 14,900 PHP loan to buy fish to resell. She hopes that with Paglaum’s help and her husband’s patience and diligence, she is looking forward to being a successful vendor and owning her own stall in the market.

loans.use: to buy fish to resell.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi est une femme mariée dynamique qui vit à Adidogomé  avec ses trois enfants et son mari. Afi est âgée de 36 ans et  s’active parfaitement  pour avoir une bonne situation financière. Afi  est une marchande de parfum qui vend aussi les pagnes et qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Pour atteindre ses objectifs, Afi  sollicite ce prêt pour commander des douzaines de parfum afin de répondre favorablement aux attentes de ses clients et avoir une autonomie financière remarquable  pour aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire.
texts.en:
Afi is an energetic married woman living in Adidogomé with her husband is three children. She is 36 years old and works very hard to improve her financial situation. Afi sells perfumes as well as traditional colorful “pagnes” fabric. She stocks up at the market twice a month.

To meet her goals, Afi is seeking this loan to buy dozens of perfumes in order to meet customer demand and become financially autonomous so as to be able to support her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy four dozens of perfumes.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es:
Leonor es un joven que vive en la ciudad de Asunción, vive con sus padres y hermanos. Actualmente trabaja como secretario administrativo en una empresa, y a la vez está estudiando la carrera de contabilidad.
Él es una persona que está luchando para poder crecer y salir adelante. Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su carrera.
texts.en:
Leonor is a youth who lives in the city of Asunción and lives with his parents and siblings. He is currently working as an administrative assistant, but he is also going to school to study accounting.

He is a person who is working hard to grow and get ahead. He is asking for this loan in order to invest it in paying university fees associated with his degree.

loans.use: to pay for University fees.

loans.name: Emeliana

texts.en:
Emeliana is driven by the passion to sell. At the age of 54, married and living in Tagmanocan, Lazi, Siquijor, she runs a store that primarily supports their family.

Every day, Emeliana never tires of tending her store. She is a full fledged member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and has taken several loans already. She has religiously repaid her obligations without records of default.

Now, Emeliana is taking another loan to purchase inventories of sugar, milk, oil, and noodles to resell. Having enough inventory would mean income opportunities.

In the future, Emeliana dreams of sustaining her store so she can continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to purchase inventories of sugar, milk, oil, and noodles to resell.

loans.name: Asghar Shehzad

texts.en:
Asghar Shehzad is 42. He is an honest person living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

He is a milkman by profession. He sells milk and sells bull calves to the butcher. He has a few buffaloes and cows, and he produces milk two times in a day from all of his cattle. He provides door to door milk to his customers also, and takes money on a monthly basis. He has been doing this business for many years and generating income for his family. All his efforts are for providing comfort to his family members.

He found that he can produce more milk from buffaloes than from cows. He made a plan to buy a buffalo, but the price of a buffalo is more than the price of a cow, and he does not have enough savings to buy a buffalo.

Therefore, Asghar Shehzad has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that he will be able to buy one buffalo for producing more milk. Asghar Shehzad wants to keep buffaloes instead of cows to grow his business, and wants to maintain his cowshed with the profit amount. He hopes that he will be able to buy a buffalo and be able to generate maximum income.

Asghar Shehzad thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy an additional buffalo for producing more milk.

loans.name: Maria Fernanda

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Damas Del Futuro se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Pajan,  cantón conocido por ser una zona muy ganadera de la provincia, un atractivo es el rodeo montubio que organizan en algunas épocas del año. 
En este lugar vive la señora Maria, tiene 28 años de edad, es madre soltera tiene dos hijos de 8 y 5 años de edad los mismos que estudian en escuela.
Doña Maria es una mujer que hace lo posible para que a sus hijos no les falte lo necesario para vivir, ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa por catalogo, su forma de ventas es puerta a puerta, ella trabaja tres o cuatro días a la semana, aprovecha las horas de la mañana que sus hijos están estudiando para salir a realizar sus recorridos, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Lleva más de 5 años con este negocio el cual le permite ganarse lo suyo y sacar a delante ella sola a sus hijos.
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisas y blusas  ya que tiene varios pedidos por entregar. Lleva 2 años en  el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus pequeños por lo cual lucha día a día.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Damas Del Futuro" (Ladies of the Future) meets every two weeks in the Pajan Canton, which is known for being an area that raises cattle in the province. One attraction is the Rodeo Montubio that they organize at certain times of the year.

Maria lives here. She is 28 years old and is a single mother of two children who are 8 and 5 years old. They attend school.

Maria is a woman who does what she can so that her children don't lack for what they need to live. She makes a living selling clothing by catalog. Her method of sales is door to door. She works three or four days a week, taking advantage of the hours in the morning that her children are in school to go out on her routes. She leaves her products on credit and collects every week. She has more than 5 years in this business which allows her to earn her own living and, by herself, get her children ahead.

This loan is to buy pants, shirts and blouses as she has several orders to deliver. She has 2 years in the communal bank and she likes it because the loans are a great help.

Her dream is to give the best to her little ones - that's why she perseveres every day.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts and blouses.

loans.name: Luzarina

texts.en:
Luzarina is 55 years old from Bien Unido. She is married and her husband is into fishing. Luzarina sells his catch, and that of other fishermen. 

She also makes and sells dried fish and seashells. She is asking for a loan to invest more in this business. She will use it to buy more of fish and seashells to sell. 

Her profits will be used to buy healthy food for herself and her husband, and will also be reinvested for the same business. She will also save a part of her profits.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish, dried fish and seashells

loans.name: Petita

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Damas Del Futuro se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Pajan,  cantón conocido por ser una zona muy ganadera de la provincia, un atractivo es el rodeo montubio que organizan en algunas épocas del año. 
En este lugar vive la señora Petita, tiene 52 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tiene tres hijos mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun viven con ella.  El esposo es agricultor. 
Doña Petita es una mujer que le gusta trabajar y así ganarse sus propios ingresos para salir adelante, ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, zapatos y productos Avon y Yanbal  (perfumes, cremas, bisutería, etc.), su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su casa lugar hasta donde llegan sus clientes si necesitan de alguna prenda, deja sus productos a  crédito y cobra cada semana, lleva más de 15 años dedicada a esta actividad  razón por lo cual ya cuenta con muy buena clientela que siempre le piden sus productos.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatos, perfumes, cremas, bisuterías y todo lo que ella vende. Lleva más de 15 años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque el grupo es muy unido. Sus sueños es seguir mejorando su vida.
texts.en:
The "Damas Del Futuro" communal bank meets every fortnight in Pajan canton, which is known for it's high livestock production. One attraction is the Montubio rodeo which is organized a few times a year.

Petita lives in this place. She is 52 years old and is in a common-law relationship. She has three children from this realtionship and one of them still lives with her. Her husband is a farmer.

Petita is a woman who likes to work and from it earn her own income to get ahead. She works in commerce selling all types of clothing, shoes and Avon and Yanbal products (perfume, cream, jewellery, etc.). Her method of sales is from door to door and she also sells from her house where customers come if they need some clothing. She leaves her products on credit and collects every week. She has been working in this business for more than 15 years so she has a good clientele who always request her products.

This loan is to buy clothing, shoes, perfume, cream, jewellery and everything she sells. She has been in the communal bank for more than 15 years and she likes it as the group is very united. Her dream is to continue to improve her life.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, perfume, cream, jewellery, etc.

loans.name: Mervic

texts.en:
Mervic hails from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is married with a ten-year-old son. Her husband is a fisherman. She is the one who sells her husband's catch. She has been engaged in fishing for 11 years now. In addition to that, she is also a dealer of Avon products. She sells items like lotion, beauty products, body spray and ladies' apparel.

She is asking for a loan to purchase gasoline, buy Avon products and materials for house repair. These would enable Mervic and her family to improve her income and be able to provide nutritious meals. She could also purchase a variety of Avon products to sell. Thus, she could settle her obligations and handle her finances.

In the future, she is doing her best to improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to  purchase gasoline, buy Avon products and materials  for house repair.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is married with children. He is a specialist in looking after compound designs. He gets contracts to plant, cut, and clean people's compounds. Through this, Joshua has been able to buy a motorcycle for his transport business. He is a very honest man, and, if trusted with a loan, he cannot fail to pay it well.

He dreams of living a desirable life. He is requesting a loan facility to buy construction materials, like bricks and stones, to construct a house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials, like bricks and stones, to construct a house.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John, a resident of Kyenjojo, is aged 25 and a very hardworking young man with one child. He deals in agricultural produce, specifically selling maize, beans and groundnuts depending on the season. He started this business in order to raise money for his family and it’s very lucrative. Ambitious as he is, he has also ventured into timber sales and is hopeful that it will equally pick up.

He normally buys the produce from farmers when prices are low, stores them and in times of scarcity sells at a higher price. His dreams are to have a well off family and educate his child to university plus a business goal of owning the biggest produce store in town. John is in need of a loan to buy maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: Meri

texts.en: Meri is 60 years old. She lives in Batumi with her son and daughter-in-law. Meri is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, she has a plot of land where she grows mandarin and walnut trees and sells the harvest locally. The income is only seasonal and the family decided to start an additional business. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 2600 GEL. With the received credit the family will purchase a car and Meri's son will serve people as a taxi driver in order to increase the family income. Meri thinks that the business will be profitable and she awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a car so her son can work as a taxi driver.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en: Edith is a 55-year-old widow with four offspring living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. After the death of her husband, Edith's life became harder in terms of providing basic needs for her family and she decided to start a general merchandise retail shop. For six years now it has been doing well alongside seasonal crop growing for additional income. She is a very hardworking woman and has educated her children to good levels. She only dreams of having a well furnished house which is self contained. Edith has challenges of high rental fees for her shop but nevertheless she works hard. Edith is requesting a loan to add stock of rice, sugar, flour and cooking oil to sell.

loans.use: to add stock of rice, sugar, flour and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 31 years old and from Bien Unido,  Bohol. She is engaged in buying and selling squid. She also has a fishing business.  She is married and her husband works as a driver. She is trying to support her husband by engaging in the squid selling business.
Liza is asking for a loan so she can increase her capital for more squid to sell.  She will also use the loan to pay for boat repairs.  She hopes that her business would improve and expand in the future thus giving her the opportunity to earn more income for her to reinvest and save and to renovate her house. Her profits will also help support her 9 year old son.

loans.use: to buy more squid and pay for boat repairs

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic perseveres on how to earn more each day for her family. The previous loan that she applied for helped her buy stock of pork sausages, hotdogs and other frozen goods. Marivic wants to give all of the praise to God for giving her the business and loyal patrons each day. She also wants to thank Center for Community Transformation (CCT) and lenders for their help financially.

Marivic is contemplating ways to market the products that she’s selling to increase sales. She wants to add more stock of frozen goods so that customers may buy bulk orders from her. With this, Marivic is requesting another loan of PHP 16,000. Though the profit on this kind of business is not that dramatic compared to other businesses, Marivic believes that the amount, if ever granted, will make a big impact on her business.

Marivic is consistent in attending the weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members where she gains spiritual strength from the members' life changing testimony, shares her own experience of God’s love, pays microfinance loans and hears God’s word, which is conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to purchase more frozen goods and other merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Sumaira

texts.en:
Sumaira is a responsible mother of three children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan.

Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for 15 years. Her husband is responsible to fulfill the needs of entire family.

Her husband needs to do maintenance on his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good. It requires increasingly more maintenance on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to maintain his taxi. Therefore, Sumaira has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Sumaira's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily, and can provide better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. Sumaira also plans to build savings with the profits to meet her family's needs in future.

Sumaira is very grateful to Kiva and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband to repair his taxi

loans.name: Yona

texts.en: Yona is a trader dealing in the selling of secondhand clothes and at the same time growing cocoa that adds more income. He lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He is faced with a challenge of inadequate capital that hinders progress of his business. However, he has hopes of expanding his cocoa business and also building a permanent house for his family of five children and his wife. Yona has asked for a loan to pay workers providing labor in his cocoa gardens with the hope of realizing a bigger harvest to sell.

loans.use: to pay workers providing labor in his cocoa gardens.

loans.name: Mahmud

texts.en:
Greetings from Palestine. Mahmud is 38 years old and single with no kids. He lives in Yatta in Hebron city.

Mahmud has a small stockade in front of his house. His main business is to trade livestock, such as goats, sheep, ewes, etc. Mahmud needs the loan to buy sheep and ewes in order to raise them and later sell them and make some profits.

The business faces two main challenges. The first one is the lack of liquidity, which limits his ability to expand his project, and the other challenge is the seasonality of the livestock trade.

For the future, Mahmud hopes to expand his project by increasing the number of his livestock. Mahmud thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy sheep and ewes in order to raise them and later sell them to make some profits.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en:
Oscar considers Center for Community Transformation (CCT) as God’s extension of blessing for approving his prior loan amounting to PHP 17,000. He is grateful that there are lenders willing to help entrepreneurs who are financially incapable. Aside from running a variety store business, Oscar also supplies soft drinks to other variety stores. The amount helped him buy cases of soft drinks. And still, he wants to thank lenders for having considerate heart in helping others.
