Oscar aims to step up in the business. This year he wants to add more grocery products to his variety store so that customers will have an array of choices and cases of soft drinks as well. He wants to have more stores to supply bottled drinks and for the variety store business to become a one-stop-shop. With this, Oscar applied for another loan worth PHP 20,000 to buy more cases of soft drinks since he wants to add stores to supply the product.

Oscar is consistent in attending the weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members where he gains spiritual strength from the members' life changing testimony, shares his own experience of God’s love, pays microfinance loans and hears God’s word which is conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to buy more cases of soft drinks for his buy-and-sell business.

loans.name: Joesela

texts.en:
Joesela is 45 years old and married with six children. With two children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Joesela runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Joesela has been in this business for twelve years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, sugar, soft drinks and other groceries.

In the future Joesela would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a repeat client of UGAFODE Microfinance, applying for a loan of UGX 1,500,000. She is a married woman with children.

She is a businesswoman doing stone quarrying. In a bid to increase her working capital and expand the business, she has applied for a loan of UGX 1,500,000 to help her buy equipment and hire labour to increase the production of the stones to meet the customers' demands.

She is very grateful for the support UGAFODE Microfinance and Kiva lenders offered to her since she is now able to fund her business.

loans.use: to boost business

loans.name: Anlly Catalina

texts.es:
Anlly es una mujer con 21 años de edad, madre de una pequeña con 3 años de edad, la cual ama con toda sus fuerzas, ella se dedica a vender mercancía desde su casa, lo que le permita pasar más tiempo con su hija y como persona humilde brindarle lo que necesita.
Actualmente tiene una gran cantidad de pedidos, pero no cuenta con mucho capital de trabajo, es por esto que solicita un préstamo con el cual hará la compra de mercancía como jeans, camiseta y ropa interior, con esto espera satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes y seguir creciendo con su negocio.
Su propósito es comenzar a realizar nuevas actividades las cuales le generen más ingresos, piensa en vender frutas y criar cerdos para luego venderlos.

Para esto cuenta con la ayuda de Interactuar y los colaboradores de portal Kiva.
texts.en:
Anlly is a 21 year old woman. She is the mother of a 3 year old little girl whom she loves with all her strength. She makes a living selling merchandise from her house which allows her to spend more time with her daughter and as a humble person, provide her with what she needs.

She currently has a large quantity of orders, but she does not have a lot of working capital. This is why she is requesting a loan with which she will buy merchandise like jeans, t-shirts, and underwear. She hopes to satisfy the needs of her clients with this and continue to grow her business.

Her goal is to start conducting new businesses which will generate more income. She is thinking about selling fruit and raising pigs to sell.

Anlly is counting on the help of Interactuar and the Kiva site contributors.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like jeans, t-shirts, and underwear.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.en:
Gerardo decided to invest in a waste-to-energy biodigester in order to reduce his operating expenses. Indeed, he has spent an important part of his income on expensive LP gas, wood, and chemical fertilizers.

By inputting his sheep's and rabbits' manure in the biodigester, the natural methanisation process and bacteria will transform it into renewable energy (biogas) and organic fertilizer. This will allow him to displace the unsustainable external inputs he used to buy, improving his cost-effectiveness and allowing him to have better margins on the animals he sells.

His wife will no longer have to cook with wood, which was putting her health at risk as she was inhaling toxic smoke on a daily basis. As he will start spending less, Gerardo plans to save money and to progressively increase his sheep herd to expand his farm.

This loan represents 18% of the full cost of the biodigester. The remaining part is being covered by a government subsidy and a downpayment from the client.

loans.use: to purchase an 8 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Eloy

texts.en:
Eloy is a Mexican dairy farmer; he owns cows and sheep and dedicates himself to the production and sale of cheese. He also owns a field, where he cultivates corn to feed his animals.

By purchasing a biodigester, he will be able to replace the expensive and unsustainable LP gas, wood, and chemical fertilizers he used to buy to cook and work. He will use the biodigester to transform his animals' manure into renewable energy and organic fertilizer, thereby reducing his operating costs and transforming waste into precious resources.

The productivity and cost-effectiveness of his farm will improve, while protecting the environment and becoming a model for sustainable farming. With his savings, Eloy plans to buy additional cows and sheep of different breeds and improve the infrastructure on his farm.

This loan represents 51% of the full cost of the biodigester. The remaining part is being covered by a government subsidy and a downpayment from the client.

loans.use: to invest in a 40 m3 Sistema Biobolsa waste-to-energy system.

loans.name: Ma. Lourdes

texts.en:
Maria Lourdes owns a few cows and hogs; she sells her cows' milk and sells the hogs for their meat. She cultivates corn on a small plot of land, which she feeds to her animals.

She decided to invest in a biodigester in order to displace the expensive LP gas she used to buy in tanks on a monthly basis, as well as wood and chemical fertilizers. With Sistema Biobolsa, she will become her own supplier of renewable energy and biofertilizer, simply by inputting her animals' manure in the biodigester.

She will live in a cleaner environment as the waste will be treated instead of being piled up, emitting greenhouse gases, attracting flies, and contaminating underground water sources. Cooking with biogas instead of wood will eliminate the toxic smoke she used to inhale every day, improving her and her family's health. As she starts saving money, Maria Lourdes wants to buy material to improve her animals' corral and work on the farm's infrastructure.

This loan represents 53% of the full cost of the biodigester. The remaining part is being covered by a government subsidy and a downpayment from the client.

loans.use: to purchase an 8 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen was looking for a solution to reduce costs on her farm, as she was spending an important part of her revenue in fossil fuel-based LP gas, wood, and chemical fertilizers.

She decided to purchase a biodigester because it is transforming her hogs' and sheep's manure into alternatives to these expensive inputs. Indeed, she will become her own supplier of biogas and organic fertilizer, allowing her to cook and heat water with renewable energy, as well as to improve the yield of her pumpkin and bean field in a natural manner.

In addition to becoming more cost-effective and productive, Carmen will reduce her carbon footprint as the treated waste will no longer emit greenhouse gases nor contaminate underground water sources. As she starts saving money through this waste management solution, she plans to buy additional sheep to increase her milk production, and to improve her farm's infrastructure.

This loan represents 50% of the full cost of the biodigester. The remaining part is being covered by a government subsidy and a downpayment from the client.

loans.use: to invest in a 10 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Rene Heberto

texts.en:
Rene Heberto dedicates himself to raising and selling sheep for a living. He used to pile his animals' waste up outside the farm, where it was generating bad smells, emitting greenhouse gases, and contaminating underground water sources.

He sees Sistema Biobolsa as a waste management solution which provides the additional benefit of producing renewable energy (biogas) and organic fertilizer. Therefore, Rene Heberto will be able to displace the expensive LP gas he used to buy, as well as the wood his wife was cooking with and the chemical fertilizers he was applying on his corn field.

His farm will become a cleaner place to live and work, while he will reduce his operating costs and improve the yield of his field in a sustainable way. As he starts saving money, Rene Heberto plans to buy additional sheep in order to expand his farming activities.

This loan represents 21% of the full cost of the biodigester. The remaining part is being covered by a government subsidy and a downpayment from the client.

loans.use: to acquire a 6 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Blanca Elvia

texts.es:
Blanca es una señora separada con 62 años de edad, madre de siete hijos ya mayores. Humilde y muy trabajadora, que por necesidad económica monto su propio negocio, una tienda la cual ubico en un pequeño local arrendado por un vecino. Su deseo de salir adelante es admirable, porque pese a su edad no disminuye esfuerzos para lograr su objetivo, el de formalizar su negocio para que en un futuro pertenezca a sus nietos.

Actualmente tiene una dificultad, debido a que no cuenta con mucho surtido, sus ventas han mermado mucho, es por esto que se encuentra solicitando un crédito el cual lo invertirá en la compra de productos de aseo personal y de la canasta familiar como lo es el arroz, aceite, lentejas, bebidas y otros.
Espera seguir creciendo con su negocio, que sus clientes la busquen por calidad, buen servicio y economía.

Las circunstancias difíciles por las que ha pasado esta señora, y su empuje para superarlas la hacen merecedora de la ayuda que solicita.
texts.en:
Blanca is 62 years old, separated and the mother of seven children, now all adults. Humble and hard-working she started her own business, a store which is located in a small shop leased from a neighbor. Her desire to get ahead is admirable because in spite of her age she has not lessened her efforts to achieve her objective, which is to formalize her business so that in the future it can belong to her grandchildren.

Currently she has a problem. As she doesn't have much stock her sales have diminished a lot. For this reason she finds herself requesting a loan which she will invest in buying personal care products and basic food items like rice, oil, lentils, drinks and others.

She hopes to continue to expand her business that her clients seek out for quality, good service and good price. The difficult times this woman is going through and her drive to overcome them makes her worthy of the support she is requesting.

loans.use: to buy personal care products and basic food items like rice, oil, lentils, drinks and others.

loans.name: Haide

texts.en:
Haide is 46 years old, married and has two children, one of whom is in school.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Haide requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for two years now and has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Haide would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Amma

texts.en:
Amma is in her early 40s and married with four children, who are still in school.

She has been running a fishmongery since 2013. She works from 7am to 8pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be Amma's 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase her stock of fish, and she has paid back her loan successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees, to repay the loan, to reinvest in her business, and to cover household expenses.

She will again use this loan to increase her stock of fish in her fishmongery. She dreams of opening another fishmongery in the future.

Amma will make sure she pays back her loan according to the loan schedule.

loans.use: to increase her stock of fish in her fishmongery.

loans.name: Imarika Group

texts.en:
Adam is in his mid 30s and a divorcee with three children.  One of them  is attending school and the other two are still small.  He has been running a retail shop for eight years now. He works from  06am to 10.30pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Adam's 20th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to keep on restocking the out of stock items in the shop store and has managed to pay back all his loans successfully.  He is really happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for their support.  He used the profit to pay school fees, to repay loan, built his own house, bought a radio, bought a TV set, mattresses, sofa set, beds, cupboards for utensils, cupboard for clothes and covered household expenses.  He will use this loan to increase on the fast moving items like sugar, beans, salt, rice, flours in his shop and meet his customers' requirement. He dreams of owning a whole sale shop as well as making his retail shop big.

Adam will share this loan with his loan group Imarika which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase on the fast moving items like sugar, beans, salt, rice, flours in his shop and meet his customers'  requirement.

loans.name: Henry Joy

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Damas Del Futuro se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Pajan,  cantón conocido por ser una zona muy ganadera de la provincia, un atractivo es el rodeo montubio que organizan en algunas épocas del año. 
En este lugar vive el señor Henry, tiene 33  años de edad está casado y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de  13  y 9 años los mismos que estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposa es farmacéutica. 
Don Henry es un hombre muy trabajador que para lograr sus ingresos y así poder sacar adelante a su familia realiza lo necesario para ganarse la vida, el trabaja de ayudante en un bus de transporte interprovincial, pero al mismo tiempo el también  se dedica al comercio, el compra motos usadas las mismas que luego repara ya que también es mecánico y luego una vez reparadas las vende otra vez y con esto se gana algo extra por estas transacciones, el necesita de crédito en su mayoría para comprar ciertos repuestos que necesita ya que tiene varias motos para arreglar y necesita arreglarlas ya para su venta posterior, de esta forma y con trabajo duro el logra sacar adelante a su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar repuestos para arreglar las motos que tiene en su casa. Lleva tres años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos. Sus sueños son tener su propio bus de transporte.
texts.en:
The credit group Damas del Futuro meets every fifteen days in Cantón Pajan. Cantón is known in the province for having a lot of livestock. An attraction is the Montubio (ethnic group) rodeo which is organized some seasons of the year.

This is where Henry lives. He is 33 years old and is married. He has two children from this relationship who are 13 and 9 years old and who are in school. His wife is a pharmacist. Henry is a very hard working man who in order to earn his income and be able to support his family, does what is necessary to make a living. He works as an assistant on an inter-provincial transport bus, but at the same time he also makes a living in business. He buys used motorcycles which he later repairs, since he is also a mechanic, and once they are repaired he sells them again. Through these transactions he earns something extra.

For the most part, he needs the loan to buy certain spare parts that he needs since he has many motorcycles to repair, and needs to repair them now for resale. With this and hard work he succeeds in providing for his family.

This loan is to buy spare parts to repair the motorcycles he has at his house. He has been part of the credit group for three years and he likes it because the loans are fast. His dream is to have his own transport bus.

loans.use: to buy spare motorcycle parts.

loans.name: Jolly

texts.en:
Jolly is 58 years old, married and has six children, one of whom is in school.

Jolly is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Jolly requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Jolly has been raising pigs for ten years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jolly would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Clecencio

texts.en:
A loan of UGX 1,000,000/= helped Clecencio to improve his coffee gardens by pruning them and helped him to buy more bags of coffee for sale. He has been able to expand his coffee business into bigger markets.

Clecencio has four children, of whom three attend school. He still carries out coffee selling alongside coffee growing to increase his profits and meet the family's demands. He has been in that business for the past 15 years, and hopes that he will be able to educate his children to higher levels of education, though seasonality and theft of his coffee are still big challenges.

He is requesting a loan to buy more bags of coffee for his produce shop to sell.

loans.use: to buy more bags of coffee for his produce shop to sell.

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en:
Musarat is a 50-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her one son. Her husband has been running his own business of clothes selling for 12 years. Her husband is responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household. Her husband needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for resale purposes, but due to insufficient financial means he is unable to purchase these clothes. Therefore Musarat is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that she can assist her husband in purchasing these clothes in bulk for his business. Her husband can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan amount.

Musarat is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband increase his clothing business.

loans.name: St. Joseph's College Layibi School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Robert. He is the head teacher of St. Joseph's College Layibi School, a boys school in the rural area of Layibi in Arua, with 1200 students. St. Joseph's College Layibi School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 1000 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

St. Joseph's College Layibi School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Robert ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases. He also hopes it will increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Cecilia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Cecilia es madre soltera con 31 años de edad, debido a que no cuenta con la ayuda del padre de su hija, para el sostenimiento de la misma, ella por necesidad económica se dedicó a la cría y venta de ganado bovino, con este negocio ha tenido un gran progreso, se generan muy buenos ingresos con los cuales logra cubrir las necesidades que su hogar amerita.
Con el fin de mejorar sus ventas y aumentar sus clientes, esta mujer solicita un crédito con el cual comprara más ganado bovino.
Sus sueños son muchos, pero los principales son mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, formalizar su negocio y en un futuro dejárselo a su hija.
Apoya a esta mujer con ganas de salir adelante, haga un préstamo.
texts.en: Cecilia is a 31 year old single mother. Because she does not have any support from her daughter's father and because of her financial need, she started raising and selling cattle. With this business she has had much success, earning good income that helps her cover the needs of her household. With the objective of improving her sales and increasing the number of customers, this woman is requesting a loan to buy cattle. She has many dreams, but the main ones are to improve the conditions of her house, to formalize her business, and to leave it to her daughter in the future. Support this woman with her desire to move ahead and make a loan.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy new stock of materials to design her customers' clothes.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 54-year-old married man from Rafah City. He lives with his wife in a simple house. Mohammad works as an employee in a local company where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. He would like to improve the family's living conditions and buy some necessary items.

Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a water purification machine for the family house. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to provide clean water for his family.

Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for the family house.

loans.name: Fouzia

texts.en:
Fouzia is a responsible mother of one child. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for 13 years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. Her husband needs to make maintenance of his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good. It requires more maintenance costs on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to make maintenance of his taxi, therefore Fouzia has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan Fouzia's husband can afford the maintenance costs easily, and provide better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. Fouzia also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future.

Fouzia is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband repair his taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: ELLA ES UNA JOVEN MADRE DE FAMILIA QUE TIENE PROBLEMAS DENTALES QUE LE PROVOCAN FUERTES DOLORES EN ENCÍAS Y MUELAS QUE LE IMPIDEN ALIMENTARSE ADECUADAMENTE. LE URGE UN TRATAMIENTO PARA RECUPERAR SU SALUD BUCAL, SIN EMBARGO EL TRATAMIENTO ES COSTOSO Y NO LO PUEDE SOLVENTAR YA QUE EL SALARIO DE SU ESPOSO ES POCO.
texts.en: She is a young parent who has dental problems that cause her severe pain in her gums and molars and prevent her from eating properly. A treatment has been recommended to her for recovering her oral health, however the treatment is costly, and she cannot afford to pay for it, as her husband's salary is low.

loans.use: to obtain dental treatment

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 50 years old and married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Lolita has a fishing business in the Philippines. Lolita requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Lolita has been in this business for twenty years. In the future Lolita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 42 years old, married and has four children. Three of her children are enrolled in school.

Teresita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Teresita requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Teresita has been raising pigs for seven years now, and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
“Nothing is impossible” is the preferred motto of Margie. She is 48 years old, married and has three children. For her, just for the sake of her children's future she can do everything. Any type of business that she can manage, and will earn her greater income, she enters it.

Margie is engaged in a retailing and direct selling business. While managing her sari-sari store business, Margie also sells fragrances, lotions, and ready to wear items around their village. She has been doing business for eight years. She is doing all of this because she wanted to help her husband in carrying their needs. Her husband's salary as a driver is not enough to sustain all of their needs.

Margie needs an additional capital of PHP 50,000 to buy more groceries, fragrances, and shoes. She hopes to earn greater income and be able to meet her children in school who are in college and high school level of education.

loans.use: to buy more groceries, fragrances, and shoes.

loans.name: Tania Magdalena

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Damas Del Futuro se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Pajan,  cantón conocido por ser una zona muy ganadera de la provincia, un atractivo es el rodeo montubio que organizan en algunas épocas del año. 
En este lugar vive la señora Tania, tiene 42 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tiene una hija de 20 años la cual ya es independiente.  El esposo es agricultor. 
Doña Tania es una mujer muy luchadora que le gusta trabajar y con su esfuerzo ayudar a  su marido con los gastos que genera el hogar ya que el no gana mucho en sus faenas en el campo, ella tiene  una granja de pollos, en temporadas meten hasta 300 pollos los cuales los cría durante dos o tres meses que es el tiempo para que ya estén listos para la venta,  luego de este tiempo  los entrega a comerciantes y  también vende por libras por su casa, de esta forma ella logra ganar algo que le sirve para salir adelante junto a su querido esposo.
Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar pollos, alimento y medicinas para que tengan un mejor desarrollo. Lleva más de 5 años en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan a ella y todo el grupo. Sus sueños son tener salud y seguir adelante.
texts.en: EL Grupo De Crédito Damas Del Futuro meets every fifteen days in Cantón Pajan, an area known for its animal husbandry.  An attraction is the Montubio Rodeo, which is organized at various times throughout the year.  Miss Tania lives in this place.  She is 42 years old, she cohabits with her partner, and from this relationship, she has a 20-year-old daughter who is already independent.  Tania's partner is a farmer.  Miss Tania is a fighter - she enjoys putting effort into her work, helping her partner with household expenses since he does not earn much through his work in the fields.  She has a chicken farm.  In season, they put in up to 300 chickens, which she raises over two or three months, which is the time it takes for the chickens to be ready for sale.  After this time, she delivers them to merchants and also sells them by the pound from her house.  In this way, she is able to earn something that allows her to advance herself along with her beloved partner.  She will use this new loan to purchase chickens, feed, and medicine for the chickens so they develop better.  She carries more than 5 years in the Grupo De Crédito and she appreciates it for the help she and the whole group receive.  Her dreams are to be healthy and continue advancing herself.

loans.use: to buy chickens, chicken feed, and medicine for chickens

loans.name: Gayatri Shg 9-C Group

texts.en:
Jhima is 43 years old and a single mother with three children. She is the lady standing on the right side in the photograph.

Jhima works hard to provide for her family. She runs a grocery store in Koraput district of Odisha, India and requested a loan amount of 30,000 INR along with her group member through Kiva's partner Peoples Forum. She will use the loan to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, cooking oil, drinks, etc.

She is an enterprising and industrious woman and has been running the grocery store for five years. She also earns an income from farming vegetables.

Jhima aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college. She is in dire need of your kind help.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, cooking oil, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Sonia Esther

texts.es:
Sonia es una señora con 48 años de edad, ella es soltera y madre de tres hijos ya mayores de edad, dedicada a la preparación y venta de comida, una actividad que aprendió gracias a su hermana, quien también se dedica a lo mismo.
Con esto ha tenido un gran avance, ha logrado superar difíciles situaciones económicas, las cuales vivió luego de quedarse sin empleo por varios meses. 
Sus ventas últimamente han bajado, esto se debe al poco capital de trabajo, es por esto que se encuentra solicitando un préstamo el cual lo invertirá en la compra de alimentos al por mayor y remodelará su local, ya que su estado actual no es el adecuado para la venta de alimentos.

Su sueño es ayudar económicamente a sus hijos para pagar sus estudios profesionales.
Con su ayuda esta mujer podrá alcanzar sus metas, anímese, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
Sonia, 48, is single and has three adult children. She works in food preparation and sales. She learned this business from her sister, who is in the same line of work.

She has made a lot of progress with this business. She has overcome difficult financial circumstances, as a result of having been unemployed for several months.

Her sales have gone down recently, due to low working capital. This is why she is applying for a loan which she will invest in a bulk purchase of food and remodeling her shop, since its current state is not ideal for food sales.

Her dream is to help her children pay for their professional studies.

With your help, this woman will be able to achieve her goals. Be inspired, make a loan!

loans.use: to buy food in bulk and remodel her shop.

loans.name: Gayatri Shg 9-E Group

texts.en:
Kum is a 38-year-old divorced woman standing to the right side in the photograph. She was happy with her children and her husband, a tractor driver. After eight years of marriage, she separated from her husband due to some personal reason. At that time, she had a son aged seven years and a daughter aged five years. She has been struggling since then to support her family.

She started a snack and tea stall at her house, which is located quite close to the market. She cooks and sells local snacks and tea in the mornings and evenings, the general hours for such a business. She sells betel on a small scale during the rest of the day to fill her day and support her income.

She hopes for a bright future for her children. With the three years of experience in running the shop, she wants to expand her business to meet customer demand. She, along with her group member, is requesting a loan of 30,000 INR.

Kum will use her portion of the loan amount to buy some utensils and stock up on raw materials such as besan and oil for cooking her snacks, as well as buy new products like packaged snacks and wafers to stock in her betel shop. She also plans to buy some furniture to seat her customers, as she sees an increase in her customer base.

She says that the increased cash flow can change her life and provide better education to her children.

loans.use: to buy some utensils and stock up on raw materials such as besan and oil for cooking her snacks, as well as buy new products like packaged snacks and wafers to stock in her betel shop.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: EL ES UNA PERSONA MAYOR DE EDAD, ACTUALMENTE LABORA EN UN TAXI, POR SU EDAD  PRESENTA PROBLEMAS DENTALES QUE SE HAN COMPLICADO PORQUE ADEMAS SUFRE DE UNA ENFERMEDAD CRÓNCA. REQUIERE DE ATENCIÓN INMEDIATA QUE NO PUEDE SOLVENTAR PORQUE SUS RECURSOS SON ESCASOS.
texts.en: He is a senior and currently operates a taxi. Due to his age, he is having dental problems, which have been complicated by the fact that he also suffers from a chronic illness. He needs immediate attention, which he cannot afford because of his scarce financial resources.

loans.use: to obtain dental treatment

loans.name: Gayatri Shg 9-D Group

texts.en:
The "Gayatri Shg 9-D", a newly formed group, is made up of women who want to bring change to their daily lives through the program. They both live in the same village and share values of solidarity and working together. They mainly run small businesses and do some crop cultivation.

Dharama is the lady in the picture who is standing to the right. She is the featured borrower of the group. She is a 28-year-old widow, and she has two children. She cultivates and sells paddy rice and has perfectly mastered this business from having been doing it for more than seven years. Her father helps her in this business.

With her new loan, she plans to buy seeds and fertilizers for her paddy farming. With her profits, she plans to increase her savings so as to better establish her business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her paddy farming.

loans.name: Nelmie

texts.en:
Nelmie is a 30-year-old business woman and a resident of Batasan, Philippines.  As a source of income, she and her husband, Marvin, are managing a buy and sell business basically of materials for appliance repair. They’ve been in the industry for more than ten years with three employees and gradually are able to invest in home furniture and save for their future. They’re also working hard for their child’s education. She’s thankful to God for having the business and earning about 50,000 PHP every month. 

Though God always provides patrons for their business, still there are other expenses that need to be paid. Profits that are supposed to be put on the business are being used to pay for bills and for other expenses. With this, she needs to have supplementary capital to buy magnet wire and washing machine parts. That’s why she applied for 50,000 PHP. She’s trusting God that her application will be granted since she has been a dedicated member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) . 

Nelmie has been consistent in attending a CCT fellowship group that consist of 15 to 30 members where she hears the word of God and testimonies from partners. This made her become strong spiritually and dependent on God on every occasion.

loans.use: To buy magnet wire and washing machine parts for her buy and sell business.

loans.name: Ana Liza

texts.en:
Ana Liza is 39 years old and married with five children. With three children in school, Ana Liza works very hard to provide for them.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Ana Liza has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, shampoo, bread, rice and other groceries. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mahadeb Dandi Shg-A Group

texts.en:
Kamala is a 41-year-old hardworking and differently abled lady. The lady standing in a green saree is Kamala. She is living with her husband and two daughters, who are attending school/college.

Kamala makes local food items like papad (crackers) and badi (fried) from different varieties of lentils like black gram. Her husband goes to different villages from house to house to sell these items. These are local, popular side dishes that are round and eaten fried in oil/roasted over a fire, or added to curries for flavour.

She grinds the lentils and makes dough by adding other ingredients like rice, salt, oil, water, and desired seasonings. She then rolls the dough into thin rounds and dries them in the sun to make them ready to fry for selling. She spends seven to eight hours a day at these activities. It is her determination to see that her children are well-educated that has been getting her through this hard manual labour, despite her disability.

She, along with her group member, is requesting a loan amount of 30,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to buy a grinder that runs on electricity. This will let her grind the lentils and make her life much easier. She also wants to buy more raw materials such as lentils (black gram), rice, oil, onions, and garlic to make more of these items and sell in bulk to shops in the village market.

She wants to give a better education to her children and get them a better standard of life.

loans.use: to buy a grinder and raw materials such as lentils (black gram), rice, oil, onions, and garlic.

loans.name: Nazan

texts.en:
Nazan is a 38-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her 3 children. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the family.

Nazan is also providing sewing services and earns income to contribute with her husband to managing the household. She needs different kinds of goods e.g. needles, threads, pieces of cloth, machine oil and etc. for her business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these above accessories and also help her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Nazan is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her sewing business.

loans.name: Modesto

texts.en:
Modesto is a fisherman. He catches and sells fresh fish to the locals in his place. He also engages in seaweed farming. He grows and sells seaweed as an additional source of income. He has been engaged in fishing for more than 10 years now.

He is a 44-year-old married man with eight children from Talibon, Bohol. His oldest child is 22 and the youngest is 4.

He is asking for a loan to buy materials for boat repair like plywood, epoxy (adhesive) and nails. This will improve his fishing activity. It could also help him in transporting his daily catch. Thus, he could manage his earnings and be able to handle his finances.

He dreams of expanding both sources of income to support the welfare of all his children and also to provide them with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy materials  like plywood, epoxy (adhesive) and nails to repair his fishing boat.

loans.name: Victoria Group

texts.es:
En una comunidad muy tradicional del Estado de México se ubica un grupo con el nombre de Victoria; dicho  nombre hace referencia al deseo que tienen los integrantes por triunfar en sus proyectos. La mayor parte de la población se dedica a la agricultura en donde los  sembradíos de maíz resaltan a lo largo y ancho de todo el municipio.
   Don Gerardo es un hombre muy trabajador y sonriente, también es un padre de familia responsable ya que atiende de su esposa Aurelia y sus cuatro hijos. Todo el esfuerzo de su trabajo va encaminado al bienestar de su familia y especialmente a la educación de sus muchachos. Desde hace 8 años la pareja decidió realizar viajes a la Ciudad de México para encontrar mejores oportunidades de empleo. Don Gera, como le conocen, inicio laborando como albañil y obtenía buenos ingresos, sin embargo el hecho de encargar a sus hijos durante tanto tiempo le hizo volver a su comunidad. “A mí nunca me ha gustado trabajar como albañil, lo que más me apasiona es estar detrás del volante” comentó con una sonrisa. Por esta razón, una vez que regresó se dedicó a buscar empleo como chofer de taxis; tiempo después encontró una vacante y trabajó durante seis años como empleado. Posteriormente gracias a los ahorros que juntó pudo comprar un vehículo y trabajar por su propia cuenta. Desde entonces labora todos los días desde muy temprano teniendo como habito el buen trato al cliente y una actitud positiva.
   Su esfuerzo y dedicación se han visto reflejados en la estabilidad económica de su familia y de su actividad. Ahora con la oportunidad del préstamo podrá invertir en la compra de autopartes además de terminar de pagar sus permisos. Mientras tanto, Aurelia lo apoya trabajando en la venta de productos de belleza, es promotora y tiene un sueldo base además de comisiones. Ambos están muy contentos y agradecidos con VF México y KIVA  ya que siempre han confiado en su trabajo. 
   Los otros integrantes del grupo son Araceli quien invertiría en cerdos; Aurelia, en productos de belleza y Simona, en ovejas.
*La fotografía fue tomada en el municipio junto al taxi de Don Gerardo.
texts.en:
In a very traditional community in the State of Mexico there is a group called Victoria. That name references the desire of the group members to succeed in their projects. Most of the population works in agriculture, with corn fields stretching throughout the town.

Gerardo is a very hardworking man who is often smiling. He is a responsible family man who tends to his wife and their four children. All the effort of his work goes toward the welfare of his family, especially toward schooling for his children.

Eight years ago the couple decided to start visiting Mexico City to find better work opportunities. Gera, as he is better known, began working as a mason and made good money. However, the act of leaving his children for so long made him return to his community. "I never have liked working as a mason. What I'm really passionate about is being behind the steering wheel," he says with a smile.

For that reason, once he returned, he began looking for work as a taxi driver. Some time later, he found an opening and worked for six years as an employee. Later, thanks to the savings he accumulated, he was able to buy a car and work for himself.. Since then he works every day starting very early, and is in the habit of treating his customers well, with a good attitude.

His effort and dedication are reflected in the economic stability of his family and his business. Now, with the opportunities a loan presents, he will be able to invest in auto parts in addition to paying for his permits. In the meantime, Aurelia supports him by working in cosmetic sales. She is a consultant and has a base salary in addition to commissions. They are both very pleased with and grateful to VF México and Kiva, who have always had confidence in their work.

The other members of the group are Araceli who invests in pigs; Aurelia who invests in beauty products; and Simona who invests in sheep.

*The photograph was taken in town, next to Gerardo's taxi.

loans.use: to invest in auto parts and pay for permits.

location.town: San Miguel La Labor, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is 44 years old and is married with five children. One of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Cheryl has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 18,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other fishing equipment.

Cheryl has been in this business for 21 years. In the future, Cheryl would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other fishing equipment.

loans.name: Dilek

texts.en:
Dilek is 41 years old, married and has one child. She started making ceramics in the basement of her house. Later on she opened her own workshop, moulded and produced her own ceramics and sold them. In time, she developed her business and opened a bigger workplace outside the city where she both produces and sells her products. With the help of the second loan from MAYA, she bought bulks of ceramics.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff

Dilek Hanım 41 yaşında evli ve 1 çocuk annesi. Seramik işine kendi evinin bodrumunda siparişle fileli seramik yaparak başlamış. Daha sonra atölyesini açarak seramikleri kendi dökmüş ve buradan satışını yapmaya başlamış. Zamanla işlerini geliştirerek şehir dışında hem satış hem atölye olarak kullandığı daha büyük bir yer açmış. Maya dan 2. kredisini kullanan Dilek Hanım kredileri ile seramik aldı.

loans.use: to buy ceramics.

loans.name: Mahadeb Dandi Shg-B Group

texts.en:
Radha is a 50-year-old widowed lady from a small village in the Koraput district of Odisha. She is a hardworking agricultural labourer, earning a daily wage.

Apart from her full-time work as a labourer, she also runs an animal husbandry business. A household income of 6,000 INR and expenses of 5,000 INR would mean savings as low as 1,000 INR per month. With the current scenario, the family of three has a long way to go before they make significant changes in their lives.

Radha wants to make sure that her family is headed towards a brighter and better future, even if it means doubling the amount of work that she does. She wants to expand her small-scale animal husbandry business by buying a new buffalo.

She, along with her group member, is seeking a loan amount of 30,000 INR for this purpose. With the help of the loan, she is confident about increasing her monthly earnings by 2,000 INR. This increase, though it seems minimal, can make a lot of difference in her life.

Radha is the lady standing to the right hand side in the photograph.

loans.use: to buy a new buffalo.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.ru: Его зовут Хасан Ему 22 года. Он живет в Фархоре с семьей. Он решил начать новый бизнес в сфере животноводства. Хасан планирует получить кредит, построить коровник, купить корма и еще несколько голов бычков и телят. Он верит, его поддержат в его начинаниях, и он начнет свой бизнес.
texts.en: Hasan is 22 years old.  He lives in the Farkhor district of Tajikistan with his family.  He has decided to start a new business in the field of animal husbandry.  He is planning to get a loan in order to build a barn and buy animal feed and a few head of young bulls and calves.  He is confident that he will receive some support in his endeavors and that he will be able to start his business.

loans.use: to buy a few calves, animal feed, and to build a barn.

loans.name: La Calera Group

texts.es:
Juana es integrante de un grupo llamado La Calera proveniente del Estado de México y es, también, de las mujeres que tienen grandes aspiraciones en la vida sobre todo en beneficio de su familia. Su mayor orgullo son sus cuatro hijos de los cuales dos estudian en la escuela de su comunidad. Desde hace tres años decidió iniciar con la cría de ovejas, compra los ejemplares desde pequeños a un precio de 500 a 600 por cabeza; posteriormente y después de alcanzar un peso ideal los vende a personas que se dedican a cocinar distintos platillos tradicionales. “Por alimento para animales no me preocupo porque aprovecho lo que crece del campo, el único gasto proviene de medicamentos y herramientas para el corral” comenta Juanita, como le dicen de cariño. Ella recuerda que en un inicio sólo tenía un animal, pero desde que conoció a VF México su negocio ha incrementado y actualmente tiene cuatro ovejas. Con la nueva oportunidad del préstamo ha decidido comprar tres ejemplares más para continuar aumentando su producción.
   Tras todos los años de experiencia sabe que la mejor manera de aprovechar la actividad es manteniendo a un ejemplar semental y las demás hembras para que nazcan de dos a tres crías por año. Tiene, además, una cantidad de dinero destinada a cualquier emergencia referente a su negocio. Juanita está muy contenta porque su negocio gradualmente crece además porque sus ganancias ayudan a solventar gastos como educación y alimentación para sus hijos. Las metas que tiene a largo plazo son ampliar su casa y ver graduados a sus pequeños hijos. 
   Los demás integrantes del grupo son Juana M., María del Carmen, Patricia, Vicenta, Maricela, Juana S., Susana y Gregorio y Cristina quienes de igual forma solicitaron un préstamo para invertirlo en cría de ganado.
*La fotografía fue tomada en las escaleras del quiosco municipal, Juanita es quien viste un rebozo color rosa.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the group called "La Calera" [the lime quarry], based in the state of Mexico. She is also a woman who has great aspirations in life, particularly for the good of her family. Her greatest pride is her four children, two of whom attend her community's school.

Three years ago, she decided to start raising ewes. She buys them when they are little for a price of 500-600 per head. Later, after they reach an ideal weight, she sells them to people who make a living cooking various traditional dishes. "I don't worry about food for the animals because I take advantage of what grows in the countryside. The only cost comes from medicine and tools for the corral," says Juanita, as she is affectionately called.

She recalls that when she started, she had only one animal, but since she learned of VF México, her business has grown, and she currently has four ewes. With the new loan opportunity, she has decided to buy three more animals to continue increasing her production.

After all her years of experience, she knows that the way to make the most of her work is to keep one stud, with the rest females, so that two to three young are born each year. She also has a sum of money set aside for any emergency related to her business.

Juanita is very satisfied because her business is gradually growing, and because her earnings help to cover expenses such as education and food for her children. Her long-term goals are to expand her house and to see her little children graduate.

The other members of the group are Juana M., María del Carmen, Patricia, Vicenta, Maricela, Juana S., Susana, Gregorio, and Cristina. Likewise, they requested a loan to invest in raising livestock.

*The photo was taken on the steps of the town pavillion. Juanita is the one dressed in a pink shawl.

loans.use: to buy three sheep

location.town: San Juan Cote, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Talib Hussain

texts.en:
Talib Hussain is 28 years old and lives with his family in Lahore, Pakistan. 

He recently set up a mobile shop near his home. He offers different types of mobiles, accessories and provides a recharge facility. He has attained a list of customers in a few days. Nowadays, he is facing problems due to the lack of availability of funds because he wants to increase the stock of mobile accessories, which are very famous and costly nowadays. He just began this business and does not have further cash on hand to purchase the desired inventory.

This is the reason Talib Hussain contacted Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan and requested a loan. With the help of a loan; he can easily purchase mobile accessories and extra recharge of various networks. In this way, he can easily attract more customers and can generate more income to provide for his family.

Talib Hussain is very thankful to such lenders who take an active part is raising loans.

loans.use: to buy mobile accessories and extra recharge for his mobile shop.

loans.name: Bertha Camila

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de refrigerios,la socia vende hamburguesas,salchipapas y empanadas,la socia por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a su familia,el sueño de la socia es tener un cafetin.La socia solicita el credito para comprar panes,salchihas y carne para preparar la hamburguesas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: This member makes a living selling snacks, including hamburgers, salchipapas, and empanadas. She supports her family by means of this business. Her dream is to have a small cafe. She is asking for the loan to buy breads, sausages, and meat to make the hamburgers. She is happy for the loan and she promises to comply with the payment of her dues.

loans.use: to buy breads, sausages and meats to prepare hamburgers.

loans.name: Santa Rosa Group

texts.es:
En un lugar pequeño del Estado de México conocido por su tranquilidad, actualmente se están recolectando los primeros elotes que los lugareños se dedicaron a cuidar durante todo el año. La referencia al cultivo de este producto tradicional se remonta hasta tiempos prehispánicos donde, igual que ahora, era la base de su alimentación. 
   Doña Cristina es integrante del grupo Santa Rosa y se caracteriza por ser muy dedicada pues siempre ha visto la manera de sobresalir en sus negocios para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos. Doña Cristi, como la llaman de cariño, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, no obstante esto no ha sido impedimento para ser encargada de varios negocios. Tiene una tienda de abarrotes desde hace 13 años y recientemente abrió un negocio donde prepara y vende tortas. Asimismo tiene la meta de poder abrir una cocina en donde pueda ofrecer comidas completas.
   Esta vez está solicitando un crédito a VFMéxico y KIVA para abastecer, por una parte, su tienda de abarrotes y, por otra, para comprar ingredientes que ocupa en la preparación de las tortas. Por otro lado también atiende una tienda escolar donde pasa la mayor parte del día mientras que su nuera atiende los otros negocios. Por lo anterior mencionado se encuentra muy agradecida con el crédito ya que por varios ciclos han confiado en ella y apoyado de la mejor manera.
   Los otras integrantes del grupo son Alejandro, María Martina, Lucia y María Elena quienes invertirán en ovejas; Luisa, en ropa y Patricia, en una tienda de abarrotes.
* La fotografía fue tomada en las escaleras del quiosco municipal, Doña Cristina es quien viste suéter y falda en color negro.
texts.en:
In a little place in the state of Mexico known for its tranquility, right now they are gathering the first ears of corn which the locals make a living from by tending them during the whole year. The reference to the cultivation of this product hails from pre-Hispanic times when, as it is today, it was the basis of their diet.

Cristina is a member of the Santa Rosa group and she is characterized as very dedicated since she has always seen a way to stand out in her businesses in order to improve the quality of life for her children. Cristi, as she is affectionately called, did not have the opportunity to study. Regardless, this has not been an impediment to being in charge of her various businesses. She has had a grocery shop for thirteen years and recently she opened a business where she prepares and sells sandwiches.

This time, she is requesting a loan from VFMexico and Kiva in order to supply in part her grocery shop and the other part to buy ingredients that are used in the preparation of sandwiches. On another front, she tends a school supply shop where she spends most of her day while her daughter-in-law looks after the other businesses. As previously mentioned, she is very grateful for the loan since for various cycles they have trusted her and supported her in the best way.

The other members of the group are Alejandro, Maria Martina, Lucia, and Maria Elena, who invest in sheep; Luisa, in clothing; and Patricia, in a grocery shop.

* The photograph was taken on the steps of the municipal pavilion. Cristina is the one dressed in a sweater and a black skirt.

loans.use: to buy supplies for the preparation of food.

location.town: Rioyos Buenavista, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Melde

texts.en:
Melde is 49 years old and married.

Melde is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Melde requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Melde has been raising pigs for six years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Melde would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Paata

texts.en:
Paata is 28 years old. He lives in Batumi with his parents. His family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have nut and mandarin trees. The family works hard and they sell their harvest seasonally.

Paata owns a flat and has decided to start a new business, which will be more stable. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan for renovating his flat. As the flat is renovated, they will rent it out and will have stable income.

Paata hopes that the business will be profitable and he awaits your support.

loans.use: to renovate a flat and rent it out to generate income.

loans.name: Awurade Ne Me Hewfo Group

texts.en:
Gladys, the group representative, sells foodstuff and vegetables. She is 65 years old and lives alone. She wants to expand her foodstuff and vegetable business, and believes that after the expansion of her business, she will be able to earn good monthly profits.

Similarly, other remaining members who are engaged in various income generation activities are also facing a shortage of working capital. So, they decided to take a loan of GHS 3,500. From this loan: Gladys would be able to purchase more foodstuff and vegetables which she would sell to her customers, Rhoda would be able to upgrade the stock of her material business, Mary would be able to expand her second hand clothing business, and Grace would be able to invest in her second hand clothing business.

A Kiva loan would help these women realize their entrepreneurial dreams.

loans.use: to purchase more foodstuff and vegetables which she will sell to her customers.

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
La socia Mariela se sigue dedicando al trabajo como dentista,la socia tiene un consultorio donde trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este trabajo y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el trabajo como odontologa.La socia solicita el crédito para comprar una instrumentos de trabajo como una silla odontológica.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Mariela makes a living as a dentist. She has a clinic where she works from 8:00 a.m until 6:00 p.m. She has been working in this field for 5 years and it is going very well. Her dream is to expand her work as a dental surgeon.

She is requesting the loan to buy equipment such as a dental chair. She is happy for the loan and promises to pay the installments.

loans.use: to buy equipment such as a dental chair.

loans.name: Asli

texts.en:
Aslı is a 37-years-old, married mother of two. With the help of the loan from MAYA, she bought oyster mushroom soil and started growing oyster mushrooms. She sold her mushrooms to wholesalers and started to make money.

In the future, she is planning to grow mushrooms in a bigger place and expand her business.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff

Aslı Hanım 37 yaşında evli ve 2 çocuk annesi. Maya dan aldığı kredi ile istiridye mantarı toprağı alarak mantar yetiştirmeye başladı. Yetiştirdiği mantarları anlaştığı toptancılara vererek kendine gelir elde etmeye başladı. Gelecekte daha büyük bir yerde mantar yetiştirerek işini geliştirmek istiyor.

loans.use: to buy mushroom soil

loans.name: Maria Lita

texts.es:
María, gracias a los créditos se mantiene desarrollando sus  actividades agrícolas y de crianza de cerdos, comenta que ha tenido una mejoría en sus ingresos y ha podido cancelar su deuda.
Como al utilizar créditos tiene buenos resultados nuevamente solicita apoyo para comprar abono, insecticidas y semilla para sembrar granos básicos, considera que así seguirá trabajando sin problemas.
texts.en:
María, thanks to the loans, continues developing her agricultural activities and breeding pigs. She says that she has had an increase in her income and was able to pay off her debt.

Since the use of the loans has had good results, she again requests support to purchase fertilizer, insecticides, and seed to plant basic grains. She believes that she will continue to work without issues.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticides, and seed to plant basic grains, and she believes she can continue working without issues.

loans.name: Nurcan

texts.en:
Nurcan is married and has one child. She has been selling lingerie, bed sheets and covers in house meetings for 10 years. She has regular customers.

With the help of the loan from MAYA, she bought bulks of lingerie and sheets.


Translated from Turkish by Maya staff

Nurcan Hanım evli ve 1 çocuk annesi. Nurcan Hanım 10 yıldır ev toplantılarında iç çamaşırı ve pike takımı satışı yaparak evine ek gelir sağlıyor. Düzenli bir müşteri çevresine sahip olan Nurcan Hanım maya dan aldığı kredi ile çamaşır ve pike takımları aldı.

loans.use: to buy lingerie and sheets

loans.name: Münevver

texts.en:
Münevver is 66 years old and has a child. For 6 years she had been selling simit (Turkish bagel) in a small carriage and was a support for her child and her grandchildren. She took a break for two years but now she wants to work again. In order to get a carriage from the municipality she needs to pay a deposit and so she is planning to get a loan from Maya.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Münevver Hanım 66 yaşında ve 1 çocuk annesi. Simit arabasından simit satışı yaparak 6 yıl boyunca çocuğuna ve torunlarına destek olmuş ve bu işe 2 yıl ara vermiş. Tekrar belediye den simit arabası alabilmek için depozito yatırması gerekiyor ve bunun için maya dan kredi kullanacak.

loans.use: to buy a Turkish bagel car.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is a 55-year-old partner of CCT from Baseco Manila, Philippines and the wife of Ridante. Together, they have been selling fresh vegetables in the area of Baseco for ten years already, with an average earning of PHP 12,000 every month. She is grateful that through the business she and her husband were able to support their children’s education. She has one college student and the other one is working already and helping them with their finances.

Even though it is difficult to earn nowadays, Ester is determined to make the business grow. She dreams to have their house renovated and save money for their future. Selling vegetables really helped them sustain their day-to-day expenses. However, Ester still needs to have added capital for the business so she applied for another PHP 10,000 loan to have supplementary funds for buying fresh vegetables every morning.

On a weekly basis, Ester regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony, experience in the business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build a social relationship with other partners, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to have supplementary capital for buying fresh vegetables every morning for her business.

loans.name: Mahadeb Dandi Shg-C Group

texts.en:
Kundo, standing on the right in the photo, leads the Mahadeb Dandi Shg-C, a self-help group comprised of two enterprising and industrious women from the Koraput district of Odisha. She is a divorcee and runs a tailoring business. She shoulders the responsibility of providing for her large family of six, currently contributing nearly half of the household income and saving 2,000 INR every month. To this same end, she seeks to buy a sewing machine to further expand her tailoring business. With a new sewing machine, she will be able to process her customer's order within the stipulated time and increase her work efficiency, which will double her monthly savings. Together with her group member, Kundo seeks a loan of 30,000 INR to buy a new sewing machine to expand her business. Your timely loan will help both women reap sizable profits and fund the education of their children.

Kundo is eagerly awaiting your kind help and support.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine to expand her business.

loans.name: Mahadeb Dandi Shg-D Group

texts.en: Mahadeb Dandi Shg-D is a group that consists of two women from a small village in Koraput district, Odisha, India. They applied for a loan of 30,000 INR from Peoples Forum. Tulasa is the leader of the group. She is a 32-year-old married woman, and a mother of two children, living with them in a small house that needs expanding. That house is not enough for all the members of the family; it consists of a few rooms. Tulasa is an uneducated woman, and works as a labourer for others, with a small daily wage. That wage is not enough to cover the necessary needs of the family and to expand the house. Tulasa wants to start a grocery shop so that she will be able to expand her house by saving some money to do that. For this reason, she, along with her group member, turned to Peoples Forum and took out a loan of 30,000 INR to purchase basic household items in bulk to resell. Tulasa is happy with this loan and thankful to Kiva and its lenders for this great support. Tulasa is standing on the right hand side in the photograph.

loans.use: to start a grocery shop and to purchase basic household items in bulk to resell

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es:
Gilberto es casado convive con su esposa y dos hijos, tiene 30 años de residir en la localidad, él cultiva maíz para luego venderlo en su etapa de elote, así puede tener alimento para su familia y generar ingresos suficientes para cubrir otros gastos de su hogar, tiene 8 años de dedicarse a dicha actividad.
Con el financiamiento podrá comprar básicamente insumos agrícolas y pagara la preparación de una manzana de terreno para cultivar maíz, le permitirá continuar trabajando y tener mejores cosechas, espera que la inversión sea de beneficio para incrementar sus ingresos.
Los objetivos que Gilberto tiene son trabajar muy duro para que sus cosechas sean abundantes, cancelar su deuda y ayudar a sostener su hogar.
texts.en:
Gilberto is married and lives with his wife and two sons. He is 30 years old and lives in the town. He grows corn to sell as corn on the cob, in this way he can have food for his family and generate enough income to cover other household expenses. He has been doing this work for 8 years.

With the loan he will be able to buy basic agricultural supplies and pay for the preparation of a plot of land to grow cord, which will allow him to continue working and to have better harvests. He hopes that the investment will be beneficial to increase his income.

Gilberto's goals are to work very hard so that his harvests will be abundant, to pay off his debt, and to help to sustain his home.

loans.use: to buy basic agricultural supplies and to pay for the preparation of a plot of land to grow corn, which will allow him to continue working and have better harvests.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 47 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Rowena has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell.

Rowena has been in this business for five years. In the future, Rowena would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Victor Cristobal

texts.es: Victor tiene 58 años de edad de estado civil casado con dos hijos, el se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de maiz Victor el dinero lo va a utilizar en compra de abonos, ureas, semilla, para poder tener una excelente produccion, el tiene el sueño de comprar un terreno y en sus tiempos libres le gusta mucho leer
texts.en: Victor is 58 years old. He is married and has two children. He works in agriculture, specially cultivating corn. Victor will use the loan to buy fertilizers, urea and seeds in order to have an excellent production. His dream is to buy a plot of land. In his free time he likes to read a lot.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, urea and seeds.

loans.name: Mahadeb Dandi Shg-E Group

texts.en:
Nila, who is an active member of this group, is engaged in a fishing business. In the picture, the woman standing on the right is Nila. She purchases the fish from different places and ponds and sells them near the market in the village. She, along with her group member, also does fish raising in a pond that is near her house. Nila’s husband also does this business and helps her. In this way, she earns some money that she put towards household expenses. However, it is not sufficient to manage all her daily activities and monthly family expenses, as her two sons and one daughter, ages 15, 13 and 11 years, are all studying in the local school. Therefore, she along with her group member is requesting a loan of 30,000 INR to enlarge her business.

The loan amount will help her take a pond on rent and purchase more baby fish to rear. In this way, she will be able to earn a good amount after all expenditures in the business.

Nila and her group member extend their gratitude for providing them support and making them financially empowered.

loans.use: to rent a pond and purchase more baby fish to raise.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: La Señora Margarita es una persona de 51 años de edad de estado civil casada, alcanzo a estudiar hasta la primaria, cuenta con cinco dependientes económicos a su cargo, vive en casa propia, es de construcción rustica con material local, ubicado en la comunidad de Dami Rancho - Tiraque, su actividad económica,  es la agrícola produce; papa y avena, todos los productos mencionados son cultivados aproximadamente en una superficie de 2 has. Los cuales cuentan con riego, ya que es aplicado por inundación. El dinero que tenía anteriormente fue destinado para la compra de dos toros para utilizar como yunta, en ese sentido la señora Margarita requiere un préstamo para poder comprar semilla de papa y abono orgánico (gallinaza), con la producción en el futuro, con la intención de que se mejore  sus ingresos y al mismo tiempo mejorara, una mejor vivencia familiar con sus dependientes económicos.
texts.en: Señora Margarita is a 51-year-old married person, she has a primary school education. She has 5 dependents, she lives in her own house, it is a rustic building with local material, located in the community of Dami Rancho - Tiraque. Her economic activity is agriculture, she produces potatoes and oats, all of her products are grown on a plot of approximately 2 hectares. They expect irrigation, since it comes in the form of a flood. The money she already had was used for the purchase of two bulls to use as yokes, in this sense Señora Margarita needs a loan to be able to buy potato seeds and organic fertilizer (hen droppings), with her future production, with the intention of increasing her income and at the same time making a better family life for her dependents.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and organic fertilizer, to increase her production, and in this way increase her income for her family.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria opta por solicitar un nuevo crédito debido a que no cuenta con el capital suficiente para la nueva temporada de siembra, comprara insecticidas, herbicidas, abono y pagara mozos para realizar los cultivos de granos básicos.
Los créditos le dan la facilidad de mantenerse trabajando y cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia, ha enfrentado problemas de salud pero sigue esforzándose para superarlos.
texts.en: Victoria is requesting another loan because she does not have enough capital for the new planting season. She will buy insecticides, herbicides, fertilizers, and will pay for laborers to cultivate basic grains. The loans will make it easier for her to keep on working and covering the basic needs of her family. She has faced health problems, but she continues working hard to overcome them.

loans.use: to buy insecticides, herbicides, fertilizers, and to pay for laborers to cultivate basic grains.

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es:
Luis, necesita de más capital para seguir manteniendo su fuente de ingresos, comprara insecticidas, abono, herbicidas y además pagara obreros para sembrar en dos manzanas de tierra granos básicos, espera que la cosecha sea abundante en este nuevo ciclo de siembra que inicia en agosto.
El crédito anterior le ayudo en su momento para tener todos materiales necesarios para sembrar granos básicos, desafortunadamente la cosecha no fue abundante y tuvo pérdidas por la falta de lluvia, pero alberga la esperanza de tener mejores cosechas en el futuro, su familia se mantiene y ha cumplido con sus compromisos.
texts.en:
Luis needs more capital to continue maintaning his source of income, to buy insecticides, fertilizer, herbicides, and also to pay workers to plant basic grains on two plots of land. He hopes that the harvest will be abundant in the new planting cycle which begins in August.

The last loan helped him at the time to have all of the materials he needed to plant basic grains. Unfortunately, the harvest was not abundant and he had losses because of the lack of rain, but he maintains hope of having better harvests in the future. His family supports him and he has made his payments.

loans.use: to buy insecticides, fertilizer, herbicides, as well as to pay workers to plant basic grains on two plots of land.

loans.name: M. Awais

texts.en:
M. Awais, age 41, is living with his family in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

He has been running a small general store for eight years; he has been selling general store items so he could easily bear the household expenses. His shop is situated in a populated area and lot of customers are available here to buy miscellaneous general store items.

He wants to offer all those products that are necessary and consumable on a daily basis. A few days ago, he planed to offer these additional products so he could impact positively his net income. But he does not have cash in hand to buy inventories such as bread, jam, milk, cookies, butter, sandwiches, patties etc.

Therefore, M. Awais has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that he would be able to buy inventories such as bread, jam, milk, cookies, butter, sandwiches, patties etc.

He is very glad after taking this loan and hopeful that he will be successful in fulfilling each request for any item and abstain from the disappointment of his customers. In this way, he will be able to generate maximum profit from the sale of additional bakery items. He is very thankful for Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy bakery items for his general store to fulfill the requirements of his worthy customers.

loans.name: Vicent

texts.en:
Vicent is a new client of UGAFODE Microfinance applying for a loan of UGX 500,000. He is a married man with children.

He is practicing agriculture. In a bid to increase his working capital and expand the business, he has applied for a loan of UGX 500,000 to buy farm inputs in the form of mulch and to hire laborers to prune his banana plants. This will guard against loss of moisture leading to increased yields and income.

He is very grateful for the support UGAFODE Microfinance and Kiva lenders offered to him since he is now able to fund his business.

loans.use: to boost his business by buying mulch and paying laborers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: in order to invest in tubes, tire rims, pins, patches, glue, etc.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Edgar es un hombre campesino con 25 años de edad, desde muy niño se dedica a realizar labores de campo junto a sus padres, con esto ha tenido un gran progreso, ya es dueño de varios cultivos, los cuales le generan muy buenos ingresos que son invertidos en sus estudios y su hogar.
Trabaja todos los días durante 8 horas diarias.
Con el propósito de mejorar sus ventas, aumentar sus clientes y de tal manera sus ingresos, Edgar solicita un préstamo con el que comprara semillas de frijol y arveja, también insecticidas, fungicidas y herbicidas para sus cultivos.
Su mayor sueño es continuar trabajando para pagar la educación de sus hijos, pues son el motor para este hombre seguir luchando día a día.

Edgar espera de su ayuda para alcanzar sus metas, anímese, preste hoy.
texts.en:
Edgar is a 25 year-old farmer who from the time he was young has worked in the field with his parents. In this work he has made great progress, and he is now the owner of various crops which offer a good income that he invests in school and in his household.

He works every day for 8 hours.

With the goal of increasing his sales, he wants to grow his client base and thus his income. Edgar is asking for a loan in order to buy seeds for beans and peas, as well as insecticides, fungicides, and herbicides for his crops.

His greatest dream is to continue working in order to pay for school for his children. They are his motivation to keep struggling day after day.

Edgar hopes that you will help him accomplish his goals. Go for it! Support him today.

loans.use: to buy seeds for beans and peas, as well as insecticides, fungicides, and herbicides for his crops.

loans.name: Ruth Marinela

texts.es:
Ruth, comparte su vida con sus dos hijos, ella cubre todos sus gastos, desde hace varios años ella tiene como negocio la vende de productos de la canasta básica, lo emprendió por sus deseos de superación, lo atiende de seis de la mañana a siete de la noche, su dificultad es cuando las ventas bajan.
Tiene como fincalidad invertir el crédito en la compra de productos enlatados, aceite, bebidas, golosinas, pan, huevos, entre otros, le serán de ayuda para ofrecer nueva mercadería a sus clientes, espera que sus ventas y clientes aumenten.
Sus sueños son ampliar más su negocio, tener mejor alimentación, vestuario y salud junto a sus hijos.
texts.en: Ruth shares her life with her two children. She covers all of their expenses. For many years, Ruth has run a business where she sells staple goods. She started it based on her desire for self-improvement, and works there from six in the morning until seven at night. It gets hard for her when sales decline. Her plan is to invest her loan in the purchase of canned goods, oil, beverages, snacks, bread, eggs, etc. which will help to offer new merchandise to her clients. Ruth hopes that her sales and customers will increase. Her dreams are to grow her business, and to have better food, clothing, and health for her and her children.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, oil, beverages, snacks, bread, eggs, etc. which will help to offer new merchandise to her clients.

loans.name: Adelaida
