texts.en: Adelaida is a 63-year-old woman from Tubigon, Bohol. She is married with five adult children. Her husband works hard as a fisherman and does extra works to earn a living. Adelaida helps her husband by doing a sari-sari store business. She has been doing this for two years. Thus, she is asking for a loan to buy grocery items such as soft drinks, chips, bread, biscuits, candies, canned goods, noodles, toiletries, laundry soap, cooking oil, spices, coffee, powdered milk and chocolate drinks. In the future, she wishes to improve her business to have a successful and sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, chips, bread, biscuits, candies, canned goods, noodles, toiletries, laundry soap, cooking oil, spices, coffee, powdered milk and chocolate drinks

loans.name: Akwaadu Group

texts.en:
This group, Akwaadu, consists of two women who all sell firewood, wax prints, cooking utensils, fish, corn and cassava dough and always repay their loans successfully.

Comfort (shown first on the left) is the representative of this group and she is requesting a new loan because she ended the last one successfully. She is single, 58 years old, and she lives alone but in the family house. In order to increase her capital, she is requesting a new loan from ID-Ghana so that she can buy more firewood and wax prints to sell to customers. Comfort says the last loan helped her so much. She is a very brave woman and this is her second loan with Kiva and her eighth loan with ID-Ghana.

loans.use: to buy more firewood and wax prints to sell to customers.

loans.name: Brandon Exneyder

texts.es:
Brandon es un joven muy trabajador con 18 años de edad, que gracias a unas clases que recibió de todo aquello relacionado con la belleza, hoy en día tiene su propia peluquería, un negocio que le ha ayudado a salir de sus problemas económicos y pagar sus estudios.
Su problema actual es que no cuenta con muchas de las herramientas que su profesión amerita, es por esto que solicita un préstamo con el cual comprara una silla y máquinas de peluquería.
Su deseo es abrir nuevos locales y llegar a generar empleo a las personas que a su edad lo necesitan.
Su mayor sueño es tener su vivienda propia, tener una mejor estabilidad económica y gozar de una buena calidad de vida.

Con su aporte este joven podrá continuar cumpliendo sus sueños, anímese, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
Brandon is a young worker, 18 years of age, who, thanks to classes he received concerning everything related to beauty care, today he has his own hair salon. The business has helped him escape past economic problems and pay for his studies.

Brandon's problem at present is that he lacks many of the tools that his profession requires. That is why he is requesting a loan to purchase a chair and hair-cutting equipment.

His desire is to open new locations and begin to generate jobs for people his age who need them. His major dream is to have his own home, secure greater economic stability, and enjoy a good quality of life.

With this contribution this young man could continue to achieve his dreams. Act now, make a loan.

loans.use: purchase a chair and hair care equipment.

loans.name: Charina

texts.en: Charina is from Tubigon, Bohol. She is a married woman with eight children. Six of these are still school-aged children who are 20, 18, 15, 12, 6 and 3 years old. To support the needs of their children, Charina is in the hog-raising business while her husband works hard as a hollow-block maker. Aside from this, they also have a farm which gives them an extra income. Charina wants to improve her business to sustain the needs of her big family. She wants to provide for the needs of her family. With this, she is asking for a loan to buy piglets and feed and to buy fertilizer for their crop.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en: Corazon is engaged in raising pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for six years. Corazon is a 66-year-old woman and a mother of five adult children. Her husband works hard as a carpenter. They work together to sustain each day and to have a better means of living. Thus, Corazon is asking for a loan to buy feed and additional piglets to raise. In the future, she dream of being a successful woman.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is 35 years old. She is married and they have three children. She is a farmer and has been in the business for three years. She makes a monthly income of 18,000 Kenya shillings.

This is her first loan from VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy maize for planting. She will use the profit from her expanded business to educate her children.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a financially stable family.

loans.use: to buy maize for sale

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en: Ma. Elena is a 50-year-old woman from Tubigon, Bohol. She is married with five children. The oldest child is 13 years old and the youngest child is 9 years old. Ma. Elena is engaged in selling food to the community to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. She is asking for a loan to buy ingredients such as flour, sugar and cooking oil. In the future, she wishes to improve her business for sustainability.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar and cooking oil

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a 64-year-old businesswoman and has a passion for cooking. She carefully makes sure that not just the taste but the quality of food is always present. Currently, she is selling viands for lunch and dinner just in front of her house in Quezon City, Philippines. She has been doing this for eight years already and she is thankful to God that He sends customers daily.

Aside from her husband’s daily salary, Teresita’s food business is also a medium for them to have extra income to pay their daily expenses. She aims to save money for their future, that is why she perseveres to make the business grow. Teresita decided to apply for a PHP 15,000 loan this year to buy grocery items, canteen equipment and construction materials for the improvement of her business.

Despite being busy managing the business, Teresita spends time attending CCT group fellowship that consists of 10-15 individuals, where she can gain strength spiritually and where she hears testimonies from other CCT partners and is able to hear God’s word, study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, canteen equipment and construction materials for the improvement of her food business.

loans.name: Juan Alfredo

texts.es: Juan es soltero tiene 24 años de edad, un hijo que vive con el Juan realiza el credito para compra de materia prima para realizar su actividad de agricultor con estos recursos comprara semilla, abono, urea, tambien se preparara el terreno para la siembra, el sueño de Juan es poder comprar un terreno en los tiempos libres realiza deporte en la comunidad
texts.en:
Juan is single and 24 years old. He has a son who lives with him.

Juan is taking out the loan to purchase raw materials to carry out his job as a farmer. With these resources, he will buy seed, fertilizer, and urea. He will also prepare the land for sowing.

Juan's dream is to be able to buy a plot of land. In his free time, he plays sports in the community.

loans.use: to buy agricultural materials.

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
Anabelle is 35 years old and married with three children. With all three children in school, Anabelle works very hard to provide for them.

Anabelle has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional groceries to sell.

Anabelle has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods and other groceries.

In the future Anabelle would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell

loans.name: Gülcan

texts.en:
Gülcan is divorced and living with her son. After her divorce, she started working in her family's dairy products shop. She has had two loans. With the help of the first loan, she bought bulk amounts of milk, yoghurt, cheese, and butter, sold them and made money. With the help of the second loan, she is planning to buy bulk amounts of milk, yoghurt, cheese, butter and eggs, sell them to make money and expand her business.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff

Gülcan hanım eşinden ayrı bir oğlu ile beraber yaşıyor. Eşinden ayrıldıktan sonra baba mesleği olan mandıracılık yapmaya başlıyor, iki kez mikro kredi kullandı ilk aldığı mikro kredi ile dükkana toptan süt, yoğur, peynir, tereyağ aldı sattı ve para kazandı. Kullandığı ikinci kredi ile mandıra dükkanına toptan süt, peynir, yoğuRt, tereyağ ve yumurta alarak satarak para kazanmak ve işlerini geliştirmek istiyor.

loans.use: to buy milk, yogurt, and cheese products.

loans.name: Güngör

texts.en:
Güngör is married and a mother of three. She is selling dairy products. This is her second loan. With the help of the first loan she bought milk, yoghurt, cheese and butter in bulk, sold them and gained money. With the help of her second loan she is planning to buy milk, yoghurt, cheese and butter in bulk, sell them, gain money and improve her business.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff

Güngör hanım evli üç çocuk annesi. Mandıracılık yapıyor iki kez mikro kredi kullandı. Kullandığı ilk kredi ile dükkana toptan süt, yoğurt, peynir, tereyağ alarak sattı ve para kazandı. Kullandığı ikinci kredi ile dükkana toptan ürün alacak, süt, yoğurt, peynir, tereyağ alarak satarak para kazanmak ve işlerini geliştirmek istiyor.

loans.use: to buy products to sell.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 29 years old and single with no kids. He runs a grocery store in Qifeen in Tulkarem city. Mohammad works 12 hours a day in his grocery store, and he employs a part-time worker to help him. Mohammad has been in this business for four years and he sells all home necessities like food and cleaning materials.

The grocery store is the only source of income for Mohammad. Mohammad says that the challenge for his business is the difficulty in getting the goods from the suppliers. He requested the loan to buy necessary goods and some supplying products for the store. He says that the extra income from this loan will help him improve his living status. In the future, Mohammad would like to expand his business into a supermarket. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy some supplying products for his grocery

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en: Elsa and her husband own a tricycle (a motorcycle with a covered sidecar, which is a common mode of public transportation in the Philippines) for a living. Her husband has driven this tricycle for three years. Aside from this, they have a farm that also gives them an income. They raised two children, ages 22 and 17 years old. Elsa dreams in the future of improving their livelihood to have a better means of living. With this, she is asking for a loan to help her increase their profitability. She is asking for an amount for tricycle maintenance and to buy fertilizer and seedlings for their farm.

loans.use: to pay for tricycle maintenance and to buy fertilizer and seedlings for their farm.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en: Fernando is from Tubigon, Bohol. He is a 49-year-old married man with five children. Two of these children are 20 and 17 years old and still need to attend school. To earn a living and to provide for the needs of his children he is engaged in a fishing business. He has been doing this for two years.  Thus, he is asking for a loan to buy fishing net to increase his livelihood. In the future, he wishes to send all his children to school to get a degree.

loans.use: to buy fishing net

loans.name: Selma

texts.en:
Selma's husband died a year ago. She has a shop where she sold jeans with her husband for years. She continued after her husband's death. She heard about Maya from one of her friends and applied for a loan. With the help of the loan, she is planning to buy more jeans and improve her business.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Selma hanımın eşi bir yıl önce vefat etmiş. Eşi ile beraber uzun yıllar kot pantolon satışı yaptıkları dükkanı var. Eşinin vefatından sonrada dükkanda satışlarına devam ediyor. Maya mikro krediyi bir arkadaşından duymuş ve yararlanmak istemiş. Aldığı mikro kredi ile dükkana kot pantolan alarak ve satarak işini geliştirmeyi hedefliyor.

loans.use: to buy more jeans.

loans.name: Martha Helena

texts.es:
Martha es una señora con 43 años de edad, tiene tres hijos con 12, 20 y 23 años de edad.
Ella realiza diferentes actividades como el cultivo y la cría y venta de ganado, con este negocio ha logrado sobrevivir con los suyos sus hijos luego de separase de su esposo.
Trabaja todos los días durante cinco horas.

Se encuentra solicitando un préstamo con el que comprará insecticidas, fertilizantes y también concentrados al por mayor para sus pollos y cerdos.

El sueño de esta señora es mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, pues esta lleva muchos años de construida y su actual estado no es el mejor.

Las circunstancias difíciles por las que ha pasado esta señora, y su empuje para superarlas la hacen merecedora de la ayuda que solicita.
texts.en: Martha is a 43-year-old woman with three children aged 12, 20, and 23. She pursues different activities, such as cattle farming and breeding. With this business she has successfully gotten by with her children since separating from her husband. Martha works everyday, five hours a day. She is currently requesting a loan to purchase wholesale insecticides, fertilizers, and animal feed for her chickens and pigs. Ruth's dream is to improve the condition of her home, which has taken many years to construct, and whose current condition is not the best. The difficult circumstances that have befallen this woman, as well as her push to overcome them, make her deserving of the help she is requesting.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale insecticides, fertilizers, and animal feed for her chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Zaina

texts.en:
Zaina is a married woman and has been blessed with three kids who attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.
Zaina operates a poultry-selling business, which has been operational for over four years. She mentioned disease outbreak causing losses as a challenge in the business. Zaina dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feeds. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feeds

loans.name: Yayan

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients, Yayan, who is a 23-year-old married woman with two sons. Yayan has been selling sell retail gasoline for a year. Her husband has been a construction worker for 10 years. She has asked for a loan of IDR 7,000,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build a water source at their home to improve access to clean water and sanitation for their family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources but Yayan will be able to repay the loan received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all the lenders.

loans.use: to build a water source at their home to improve access to clean water and sanitation for their family.

loans.name: Fafil

texts.en:
Greetings from Palestine. Fadil is 29 years old, married with two kids, and lives in Yatta in Hebron city. Fadil has a small stockade in front of his house. His main business is to trade in livestock, such as goats, sheep, ewes, etc. Fadil needs the loan to buy sheep and ewes in order to raise them and then sell them and make some profits. The business faces two main challenges. The first one is the lack of liquidity which limits his ability to expand his project, and the other challenge is the seasonality of the livestock trade.

In the future, Fadil hopes to expand his project by increasing the number of livestock. Fadil thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy sheep and ewes in order to raise them and then sell them and make some profits.

loans.name: Girlie

texts.en: Girlie and her partner are engaged in the fishing business to earn a living. They have been doing this for two years. Thus, she is asking for a loan to buy fishing net to help them increase their livelihood. Girlie is blessed with an eight-year-old daughter.  She wishes to send her to college in the future. In addition, she is a 26-year-old woman and a resident of Tubigon, Bohol.

loans.use: to buy fishing net

loans.name: Andrw Damian

texts.es:
Andrw es un joven campesino con 20 años de edad, humilde y muy trabajador, dedicado a realizar labores de campo desde muy niño, un medio por el cual esta familia ha logrado salir adelante y superar duras situaciones económicas.
Trabaja todos los días durante 10 horas.
Se encuentra solicitando un préstamo con el cual comprara insecticidas, fertilizantes, fungicidas y semillas de papa criolla.
Su mayor sueño es mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, pues el estado actual de esta no es el mejor.
 
Su actitud positiva y sus ganas de salir adelante, permiten ver en este hombre unas ganas inmensas de superarse y por supuesto una respuesta favorable a su petición.
texts.en:
Andrw is a 20-year-old young man from the country. He is humble and very hard-working. He has made a living through country work since he was very young, through which this family has managed to move forward and overcome difficult economic situations.

He works every day for 10 hours.

He is requesting a loan with which he will buy insecticides, fertilizers, fungicides, and Creole potato seeds.

His biggest dream is to improve his house's condition, as its current state is not the best.

His positive attitude and his drive to succeed allow his desire to better himself to be seen, and of course, a favorable response to his loan request.

loans.use: to buy insecticides, fertilizers, fungicides, and Creole potato seeds

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda is a 46-year-old woman from Tubigon, Bohol. She is married with nine children. She and her husband raised them through the fishing business like the other community in this town. She is asking for a loan to buy fishing net to increase their livelihood. In the future, Imelda wishes to send all of her school-aged children to college and have them get a degree. She wants them to have a stable means of living.

loans.use: to buy fishing net

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en: Lanie is a 36-year-old woman from Tubigon, Bohol. She is engaged in selling RTW (ready to wear) products such as bags, shirts, underwear, and beauty products such as hair grower, facial cream, sun block, toner, and beauty soap. She has been in this business for more than five years. This business helps her sustain their daily needs. Thus, she is asking for a loan to buy the products mentioned above (such as bags, shirts, underwear, and beauty products). Lanie wants to expand her business. She dreams of owning a facial care clinic in the future.

loans.use: to buy bags, shirts, underwear, and beauty products such as hair grower, facial cream, sun block, toner, and beauty soap.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson was able to buy grocery items for his variety store business. He is now able to provide products that are demanded by many and which have made him attract more patrons. He wants to extend his sincerest appreciation to lenders for the financial assistance they have provided.

Samson has many plans for his family. He wants to have their house renovated and he also aims to have complete products to sell to earn more profit daily. He really works hard because of the love he has for the family. He wants his children to finish college and find a decent job in the future. To make this happen, Samson is applying for a new loan amounting to PHP 50,000. He believes this will make a great impact on the business. He is hoping that this loan would be granted to him soon.

Samson is consistent in attending weekly fellowship group for CCT partners. These consist of 15 to 30 members where he gains spiritual strength for members' life-changing testimony, shares his own experience of God’s love, pays microfinance loans and hears God’s word that is conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in his business.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: Lorna is a 45-year-old woman and is engaged in raising pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than 11 years. She is asking for a loan to buy feed. Aside from raising pigs, Lorna also engages in selling food. She works hard together with her husband, who is a painter, to provide for the needs of their children. They have three teenage children aged 19, 17 and 15 years old. In the future, Lorna dreams of improving her business to increase their livelihood.

loans.use: to buy feed

loans.name: Elvin

texts.en:
Evlin is married and a mother of two. She retired from a public company. After retirement she had hard times financially. She heard about microcredit from one of her friends and applied for a loan. With the help of the loan she is planning to buy and sell lingerie and improve her business.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Evlin hanım evli iki çocuk annesi. Kamudan emekli olmuş. Emekli olduktan sonra ekonomik olarak zor günler yaşamış, bir arkadaşından mikro krediyi duymuş ve maya mikro krediye başvurdu ve kredi kullandı. Aldığı kredi ile çamaşır alarak satış yaparak para kazanmak ve işlerini geliştirmek istiyor.

loans.use: to buy lingerie

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 28 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Julieta has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Julieta requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell.

Julieta has been in this business for five years. In the future, Julieta would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Lady Diana

texts.es: Lady tiene 24 años es soltera trabaja como cajera en un negocio de su localidad el dinero solicitado lo utilizara para comprarse una refrigeradora que necesita, Lady tiene el suño de poder comprar un vehiculo, en los tiempos libres ella se dedica a pasear con sus amigas
texts.en:
Lady is 24 years old. She is single and works as a cashier at a business in her community.

She will use the requested money to buy herself a refrigerator that she needs.

Lady has a dream to be able to buy a vehicle. In her free time, she spends time with her friends.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman who has been blessed with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house, which has no electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Fatuma operates a poultry selling business, which has been operational for over five years. An outbreak of disease, which caused losses, has been a challenge in her business. Fatuma dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future.

With the 50,000 KSH Fatuma will purchase chicks and poultry feed. She joined Yehu in order to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feed

loans.name: Khalid

texts.en:
Khalid is a 21-year-old single guy who lives with his parents. He runs a sheep farm in Rafah in the Gaza Strip. The farm is next to his parents' house. He works alone on the farm. Khalid has been in this business for three years He sells all sheep products and also sells the sheep themselves.

Khalid started the business with only 4 sheep and he now has 12 sheep. The farm is the only source of income for Khalid and his family.

Khalid says that one of the challenges for his business is the political situation, as there are no certainties in Gaza. The other challenge is the competition in the market.

He requested the loan in order to buy new sheep for the farm. He says that the extra income from this loan will help him improve his family's standard of living. In the future, Khalid would like to expand his business and sell additional livestock on his farm.

loans.use: to buy new sheep for the farm.

loans.name: Jonie Roy

texts.en:
Jonie Roy is a faithful member of Center For Community Transformation. The loan that was previously granted to him really helped maintain his cassava farm. Being a single parent with two kids has motivated him more to put forth his best efforts to take care of his farm.

He is again seeking a PHP 40,000 loan to buy more seedlings and fertilizer and pay for labor for a productive harvest. He thanks the Lord for Kiva and CCT who are supportive of small businessmen like him. He supplies cassava to a number of fruit/vegetable stand owners in his community and at the town public market. His farm means a lot to him as this is his only source of income to support his two kids.

Jonie Roy aims to sustain and grow his farm. He wants his children to finish their studies to allow them better opportunities in life. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizers and seedlings for a productive cassava harvest.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Mary Ann works hard to support her family.

She has a passenger tricycle business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fattening pigs and selling frozen foods. Mary Ann is borrowing 18,000 PHP, through NWTF, in order to buy wheels and other spare parts for her passenger tricycle business.

Mary Ann has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dreams of saving money to expand her business, and continuing to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy wheels and other spare parts for her passenger tricycle.

loans.name: Sikukuu

texts.en:
Sikukuu is a married woman. She has three children, all of whom attend school. Sikukuu owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Sikukuu has operated a business selling firewood, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other firewood operators in her business.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of firewood for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of firewood for resale

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: Ella esta preocupada por su mamá porque lleva una semana con dolor en sus molares, la señora necesita extracciones y tratamiento urgente de endodoncia o podría seguir perdiendo mas piezas dentales. Ella no quiere que su madre siga con dolor y sin poder comer bien  pero por el momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder pagar el tratamiento.
texts.en: She is worried about her mother, because she has had pain in her back teeth for a week. She needs extractions and urgent root canal treatment, or she could continue losing more teeth. She doesn't want her mother to continue being in pain and not able to eat properly, but at the moment she doesn't have the necessary money to be able to pay for the treatment.

loans.use: to obtain dental treatment for her mother

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a married man with one child, and a repeat client of Ugafode Microfinance.

A driver by occupation, Emmanuel and his wife also own a sand mining pit. He has applied for a loan of 1,500,000 UGX to increase his mining area, so that he can increase the amount of sand he extracts in order to increase his sales and profits. However, he is faced with the challenge of limited carrier vehicles to transport sand to his real area of operation, where clients can easily access it, and a lack of capital for expansion.

Emmanuel is very grateful for the support that Ugafode Microfinance and Kiva lenders have offered to him, so that he is now able to fund his business.

loans.use: to purchase more sand to sell to his clients.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia and her husband are engaged in the fishing business to earn a living. They have been doing this for two years. She is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets, in order to increase their catch.

Lucia and her husband work hard to provide for the needs of their children. They have three children, ages 13, 10, and seven. Lucia is 41 years old, and dreams of increasing their income so that in the future they can send all of their children to college. She dreams of each of them finishing a degree.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is able to attract new patrons and increase her monthly sales through the loan which was previously granted to her by CCT. Aside from the daily earnings of her husband, Felix, the direct selling really is helping them on their daily expenses. She is grateful that she can now help her husband with their finances.

Being involved in a direct selling business, where her neighbors and friends are mostly her patrons, there are times that she has to compromise her capital because of delayed payments affecting her sales and profit. Now, she is requesting an approval of her new loan amounting to 26,000 PHP, which she will be using to buy more products for her business. 

Alma regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony, experience in the business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationships with other partners, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy additional items for her buy and sell business.

loans.name: Nesrin

texts.en:
Nesrin is a mother of two. Both her children are married. Her husband passed away two years ago, and she is living alone. She is selling cosmetics and health products via a network system.  

She used a loan two times, bought bulks of products, gained money and developed her business. With the help of the third loan, she is planning to buy bulks of cosmetic products, make good sales, gain more money and improve her business.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Nesrin hanım iki çocuk annesi.  Çocuklarının ikisi de evli.  Eşi iki yıl önce vefat etmiş yalnız yaşıyor.  Netwörk sistemi ile kozmetik ve sağlık ürünleri satışı yapıyor.  Mikro krediden iki kez yararlandı toplu ürün alıp satarak para kazandı ve işini geliştirdi.  Üçüncü çektiği mikro kredi ile kozmetik ürünleri toptan alarak ve satarak para kazanmak ve işini geliştirmeye devam etmek istiyor

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a married mother of one child, who attends school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over two years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition in her business. 

With the 40,000 KES, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour and cooking fat

loans.name: Yuli Andrea

texts.es:
Yuli es una joven con 20 años de edad, una mujer emprendedora y muy trabajadora. Su labor es hacer manicure y pedicure a domicilio, con esto ha logrado un gran avance, esto le genera muy buenos ingresos con los cuales logra cubrir las necesidades que su hogar amerita.

Actualmente no cuenta con muchos de los implementos que su profesión necesita, es por esto que solicita un préstamo con el cual comprara esmaltes para uñas, corta uñas, pinceles y otros.
Sus sueños son muchos pero el principal es llegar a tener su propia casa, mejorar las condiciones económicas y poderle brindar a su hijo las comodidades necesarias.

Cuanta con la ayuda de Interactuar y los prestamistas del portal Kiva.
texts.en:
Yuli is a 20-year-old young, entrepreneurial, and hardworking young woman. She works doing manicures and pedicures in her clients' homes, through which she has achieved major progress. Through this work, she earns a good income, which manages to cover household needs.

Currently, she doesn't have many of the tools required for her profession. For this reason she is requesting a loan to buy nail polish, nail clippers, brushes, and more.

She has many dreams, but her main one is own her own home and improve her economic situation to provide her son with basic commodities.

She counts on help from Interactuar and Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy nail polish, nail clippers, brushes and more.

loans.name: Toempheakdey

texts.en:
Toempheakdey is 21 years old, single and a second-year business administration university student.

She resides with her parents in the Svay Rieng Province, Cambodia. Her father is a rice farmer and her mother is a factory worker.

Due to the fact that she is short of the finances to pay her tuition fees from the second to the fourth year, she would like to request a loan. With this loan, she will be able to have enough finances to cover her university fees and earn a bachelor’s degree successfully.

After graduation, Toempheakdey is going to find a good job with a decent salary, so she will be able to save money to build her own house.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees from the second to the fourth year.

loans.name: Sülfiye

texts.en:
Süfliye is married and has a child. She makes souvenirs and gifts at home and sells them once a week on stands.

With the help of the loan she is planning to buy bulk fabrics, beads and decorative ribbons, produce the items, make money and also improve her business.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Süfliye hanım evli bir çocuk annesi. Evde ürettiği hediyelik eşyaları haftada bir gün stant da satışını yapıyor. Kullandığı mikro krediyle kumaş boncuk fisto malzemelerini toptan alarak ve üreterek para kazanmak ve işini geliştirmek istiyor.

loans.use: to buy fabric, beads and decorative ribbons.

loans.name: Malak

texts.en:
Greetings from Palestine. Malak is 22 years old. She is a married woman with three kids and lives in Beita in Nablus city.

Malak has a small stockade in front of her house. Her main business is to trade in livestock, such as goats, sheep, ewes, etc.

Malak needs the loan to buy sheep and ewes in order to raise them, and after that sell them and make some profits. The business faces two main challenges. The first one is the lack of liquidity which limits her ability to expand her project, and the other challenge is the seasonality of the livestock trade.

For the future, Malak hopes to expand her project by increasing the number of livestock.

Malak thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy sheep and ewes in order to raise them, sell them and make some profits.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy feeds for her poultry

loans.name: Margarito

texts.en: Margarito has been engaged in raising pigs for four years. He is from Catigbian, Bohol and works hard to provide the needs of his family. He is 58 years old, married and has raised eight children. He is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets and feed as well. In the future, he dreams of improving his business for sustainability.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Rahimjon

texts.ru: Это Рахимчон. Родился и вырос Рахимчон в городе Исфаре. Ему 26 лет, он женат и имеет двоих детей. На протяжении нескольких лет он со своей бригадой занимается строительством и ремонтом домов. Этим он хорошо зарабатывает, и в семье никогда не было не достатка в чем либо. Однако в семье Рахимчона случилась беда. В глаз младшего брата Рахимчона Наимчона во время кошения травы попало инородное тело, после чего глаз воспалился и со временем Наимчон стал терять зрение. Для восстановления зрения нужна дорогостоящая операция, которую делают в России. Рахимчон с большой надеждой обращается к Вам за помощью в получении кредита для лечения своего брата.
texts.en: Rahimjon was born and grew up in the city of Isfara.  He is 26 years old, married, with two children.  For the past few years, he and his team have been involved in construction and home repairs.  Thanks to this activity, he makes a decent income, and his family is not lacking anything.  However, Rahimjon's family has been struck by misfortune.  While he was cutting grass, Rahimjon's little brother, Naimjon, got a foreign body into his eye.  His eye became inflamed and he eventually started to lose his vision.  In order to have his vision restored, Naimjon needs a costly operation, which can only be done in Russia.  It is with great hope that Raimjon is turning to you for some support.  He looks forward to receiving this loan so that his brother can be cured.

loans.use: For the treatment of his brother

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy poultry to sell.

loans.name: Erenia

texts.en:
Erenia is 48 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school.

Erenia works hard to provide for her family. She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Erenia has borrowed and repaid 25 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from fattening pigs and charcoal retailing businesses.

Erenia aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en: Adelaida is a seasoned farmer in Tabuc Sur, Oroquieta City, Mis. Occ. She has cultivated her own farm land for almost 28 years. She is asking for a loan from Paglaum MPC to purchase bags of fertilizer.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizer

location.town: Oroquieta-Tabuc Sur, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occid

loans.name: Leser

texts.en:
Leser is 34 years old and married with four children.

Leser works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, eggs, shampoo, soap and other snacks foods to sell.

Leser has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from fish vending.

Leser aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, eggs, shampoo, soap and other snacks foods to sell

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca still remembers how Center for Community Transformation (CCT), lenders and Kiva helped her to step up her buy and sell business. Prior to receiving her previous loan, she only bought one or two pieces of each of the personal products and grocery items she sells. That’s why she wants to thank Center for Community Transformation (CCT) and the lenders for the approval of her previous loan and monetary provision. She was able to buy a bulk quantity of products for her buy and sell business, which resulted in a sales increase and enticed more patrons. Currently she is earning about PHP 8,000 every month.

In a buy and sell business, entrepreneurs can’t avoid customers who’ll loan products to them, which she considers a challenge in the business. Delayed payments will also affect the business’ capital and profit. She’s working hard since she has children to raise and expenses that need to be paid. Rebecca wants to have complete products to refill her display cabinet. With this, she decided to apply for another loan of PHP 14,000. She’s praying that CCT will once again consider her application since the amount will really be a great help for the business.

Rebecca is consistent in attending the weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members where she gains spiritual strength from members' life changing testimony, shares her own experience of God’s love, pays microfinance loans and hears God’s word that is conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: To buy personal and grocery items for her buy and sell business.

loans.name: Zulfera

texts.ru: Это Зулфера. Она уроженка района Шахритус. Зулфера замужем и мать четверых детей. Муж бизнесмен. Он занимается торговлей деятельности. Старший сын находится на заработках  загранице. В семье не только Зулфера зарабатывает муж, и дети тоже зарабатывает. У нее не большая и дружная семья. Они помогают друг другу. Зулфера 10 лет занимается уборщицей в авиакассе. Она любить убирать и ухаживать, по этой причине Зулфера занимается уборщицей. Ни все умеет убирать и ухаживать. Зулфера хочет взять кредит для покупки стройматериалы для завершения ремонта дома. У нее имеется не законченный дом. Ей нужно цемент, алебастр, краски и другие стройматериалы. Из-за нехватки денежных средств она решила взять кредит. Зулфера верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Meet Zulfera, a native of the Shahrituz district of Tajikistan.  Zulfera is married and the mother of four children.  Her husband is a businessman and involved in retail.  Her oldest son is currently working abroad as a migrant worker.  In Zulfera's family everyone works: Zulfera herself, her husband, and her children.  The family is small but quite friendly: everyone always helps one another.

Zulfera works as a cleaning lady at a travel agency.  She enjoys cleaning and taking care of things, which is the reason why she chose this activity.  Not everyone knows how to do that well.  Zulfera is taking a loan to buy construction supplies to finish building her house, as construction is not over.  She needs some cement, alabaster, paints and other building supplies.  She has decided to take a loan due to a lack of personal resources.  She relies on you and on your support.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies.

loans.name: Abdulmumin

texts.ru: Абдулмумин 37 летний мужчина из района Бохтар. Он не смог получить высшее образования из-за финансового положения семьи был вынужден не учится, а работать. Сейчас Абдулмумин женатый человек и он отец троих детей. Его дети школьники. На сегодняшний день Абдулмумину тяжело собрать троих детей в школу, так как школьная форма, книги и учебники стоят дорого. Абдулмумин единственный кормилец в семье. Он планирует получить кредит и купить все необходимые принадлежности для учебы в школе.  Поддержите Абдулмумина.
texts.en: Abdulmumin is 37 years old and he comes from the Bohtar district of Tajikistan.  He didn't get the chance to receive a higher education and, instead of studying, he was forced to work because of his family's financial situation.  Today, Abdulmumin is married and the father of three school-age children.  He's having a hard time sending his three children to school because school uniforms, books and textbooks cost a lot of money.  Abdulmumin is the only bread-winner in the family.  He wants to take a loan to buy everything that his children need for school.  Please support him.

loans.use: to buy school uniforms, books and textbooks for his children.

loans.name: Orzugul

texts.ru: Орзугул добрая и отзывчивая женщина. Живет Орзугул в Бохтарском районе. Она замужем и имеет детей. Старший сын Орзугул находится в Российской Федерации на заработках. Каждый месяц он присылает домой денежные средства. Однако своей зарплаты уборщицы и денег высылаемые сыном оказалось не достаточно, чтобы закупить младшим детям школьную форму и канцелярские товары.  В связи с этим Орзугул обратилась за кредитом.  Пожалуйста, помогите ее детям обрести новую школьную форму.
texts.en: Orzugul is a kind and generous woman.  She lives in the Bohtar district of Tajikistan.  She is married, with children.  Her oldest son is in Russia as a migrant worker.  He sends money home every month.  The income that Orzugul makes as a cleaning lady plus the money she receives from her son is still not enough to buy school uniforms and stationery supplies for the youngest children.  For this reason, Orzugul has decided to apply for a loan.  Will you please help her children get new school uniforms?

loans.use: to buy school uniforms and stationery items for her young children.

loans.name: Samuel De Jesus

texts.es: Samuel de 33 años de edad vive en casa propia con su madre, el se dedica al cultivo de maiz, frijol y maicillo desde hace 17 años comercializa sus productos durante todo el año y con las ganancias que obtiene logra salir adelante, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de abonos, herbicidas, insecticidas y mano de obra para poder tener un buen cultivo y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Samuel is 33 years old and lives in a house that he owns with his mother. Samuel has been working growing corn, beans and sorghum for 17 years. He sells his products throughout the year and, with profits from sales, is able to move forward in life.

Samuel is applying for a loan in order to buy manure, weed-killer and anti-pest treatments, and to pay labourers. This loan will give Samuel good crops and he can thus earn a higher income.

loans.use: to buy manure, weed-killer and anti-pest treatments, and to pay labourers.

loans.name: Mirian Violeta

texts.es:
Miriam tiene 62 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene 1 hijo a su cargo; vive con su hijo y su conyugue en el caserío Las Juntas en el distrito de Pomahuaca, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.En dicho caserío sus actividades principales son la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Miriam se dedica al comercio, cuenta con una pequeña bodega ubicada en su domicilio, su negocio es estable cuenta con más de 10 años de experiencia, además se dedica a la fabricación de chocolate en barra, ella cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales, por su buen servicio y experiencia. El destino del crédito es para invertir en el negocio compra de materia prima para la elaboración de chocolates(compra de cacao, azúcar, entre otros) y para compra de productos para surtir su tienda(arroz, azúcar, aceite, entre otros). Con esta inversión ella podrá adquirir una utilidad aceptable para que mejore su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Miriam is 62 years old and has a partner and one son in her care. Miriam lives with her son and partner in the Las Juntas hamlet, in the Pomahuaca district of the Jaen province, Cajamarca region, in the northern highlands of Peru. In Las Juntas, the locals mainly make a living in farming, cattle-raising and trade.

Miriam herself works in trade. She has a small shop in her house. The business is stable, and Miriam has more than ten years' experience. In addition to the shop, Miriam produces chocolate bars. She has good personal and professional references locally because of the good service she offers, and her experience.

This loan will be used to buy supplies (cacao, sugar and more) for producing chocolates and to buy goods (rice, sugar, oil and more) to stock up her shop. With this investment, Miriam will be able to earn an acceptable profit margin for improving her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies for producing chocolates.

loans.name: Rosa Cecilia

texts.es: Rosa es una microempresaria que inició su negocio motivada por una amiga que le sugirió vincularse a las ventas por catálogos de productos de uso personal y desde ese momento mejoró su condición de vida y la de su familia, ella en compañía de su cónyuge e hijos, habitan en Cartagena de Indias un municipio del departamento de Bolívar en donde se consolida su clientela y les promueve productos de la oferta de catálogos, ofreciéndoles facilidad de pago; aunque su experiencia es tan solo de un año, su capital es insuficiente para responder a toda la demanda de solicitudes por parte de sus clientes que habitualmente le solicitan cremas corporales, perfumes, shampoo, prendas de vestir y calzado. Todos los días a partir de las 2 p.m. hasta las 6 p.m. está a disposición de sus clientes y en la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir artículos del catálogo y con esta inversión podrá responder a sus pedidos que se deben cancelar anticipadamente, así continuará ejerciendo su actividad comercial sin contratiempos. Su meta a futuro es ampliar su negocio y aperturar un local.  Su meta familiar es tener su casa propia en una urbanización de Cartagena de Indias.
texts.en:
Rosa is a small-time entrepreneur. She started her business following encouragement from a friend who suggested that she sell personal products from catalogues. Since then, Rosa has improved her and her family's living conditions.

Rosa lives with her partner and children in Cartagena de Indias, a municipality in the Bolivar department, where Rosa has a customer base to whom she sells products from catalogues. Rosa offers different payment facilities to those customers.

Rosa has just one year's experience, and does not have enough capital to cover demand from customers who are ordering body lotions, perfumes, shampoo, clothes and footwear.

Every day from 2pm to 6pm, Rosa is available to her customers.

Rosa is currently applying for her first Kiva loan through Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo. She will use it to invest in products from catalogues. This investment will allow Rosa to fulfill customer orders, which will then be paid off. Rosa can thus continue with her work without any setbacks.

Rosa's goal for the future is to expand her business and open a shop. Her personal goal is to own her own house in an urban area of Cartagena de Indias.

loans.use: to invest in products from catalogues.

loans.name: Arusgul

texts.ru: Арусгул проживает на районе Бохтар с двумя сыновьями и мужем. Она занимается растениеводством, как и вся ее семья. Арусгул уже 5 лет работает в сфере сельскохозяйственной деятельности. Ее семья живет в небольшом доме. Их дом давно не ремонтировался, они боятся, что этой зимой дом не сможет выдержать холода. Арусгул с сегодняшнего дня хочет начать ремонт, чтобы к началу зимы ремонт был закончен. По этой причине Арусгул обратилась за кредитом. Она на заемные деньги собирается купить стройматериалы.
texts.en: Arusgul lives in the Bohtar district with her two sons and her husband.  Like everyone in her family, she is involved in agriculture.  She has been growing crops for five years already.  Her family lives in a small house which hasn't been repaired for a long time.  The family's afraid that the house will not be ready to withstand the cold this winter.  Arusgul would like to start repairing her house right now, so that all insulation work is complete before the winter.  For this reason, she is taking a loan and is planning to use her money to buy construction supplies.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies.

loans.name: Farzona

texts.ru: Фарзоне 24 лет. Она образованная девушка. Фарзона работает медсестрой в госпитале. В этой сфере деятельности она работает много лет. Фарзона любит помогать людям и любит ухаживать о больных. Она замужем, но пока не имеет детей. Фарзона  заботливая девушка. Она желает людям добро. Фарзона живет в городе Душанбе. Она хочет купить себе стиральную машинку. До сегодняшнего дня у нее нет стиральная машинка. Фарзона решила взять кредит и приобрести себе стиральную машинку, чтобы постирать вещи на машинке. Она надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Farzona is 24 years old.  She is a well-educated young woman who has been working as a nurse in a hospital for several years already.  She loves to help people and take care of the sick.  She is married but doesn't have any children yet.  She is a very caring woman who always wishes people the best.

Farzona lives in Dushanbe.  She would like to buy a washing machine because she has never had one.  She has decided to take a loan for this purchase and she is looking forward to doing her laundry with a washing-machine.  She relies on your support.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 22-year-old Palestinian refugee, who works and lives in a Palestinian refugees camp, just like most Palestinians living in Lebanon.
Ali has been working as house painter on his own since 2006, with eleven years of experience, since he had to quit school and start work experience at the age of eleven.
Ali is building his future house, he is planning to settle and make his own small family he dreaming about. Unfortunately, his business income isn't enough to cover these increasing construction needs and expenses.
He decided to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay for his own house's necessary construction, and floor tiles expenses.
This is Ali's third loan cycle with Al Majmoua, his previous loans were invested in paying for maintenance expenses in his parents house, and he proved to be a good standing borrower.

loans.use: to pay for his own house's necessary construction, and floor tiles expenses.

loans.name: Nehemiah

texts.en:
Nehemiah is 23 years old, single and supporting his younger brother.

He practices tea farming and has been in this for two years earning a monthly income Kshs.8,000.

He has borrowed a loan of Kshs.10,000.This being his first loan and he intends to buy fertilizer and tea seedlings to expand his farm for better profits.

He plans to use the anticipated profits in repaying back the loan and dreams of going back to school to further his studies.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser and tea seedlings.

loans.name: Zeina

texts.en: Zeina is a 47 year old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and three children. He husband represents the main income source, his only target is to satisfy their family needs and improve their lifestyle. Today, with the aim to help her children and to pay their study fees, she is applying for a loan from kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. In the future, she plans to take more Kiva loans and help her continue her education.

loans.use: to help her children and to pay their study fees

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret is married with seven children living in Kasese-Uganda.She operates a retail shop, does farming of produce products and also has a small bar for extra income.She caters for her family's welfare using the income attained from her businesses.She desires to have a bigger retail shop but is limited by capital and inflation.She wants money am to buy more drinks, soap, sugar among others for selling.She hopes she will achieve her dream through commitment and saving.

loans.use: to buy more drinks, soap, sugar for selling

loans.name: Too Myaung Village Group

texts.en:
Aye, 25 years old is married with a child, studying primary education. She sometimes helps her husband at the paddy farm mostly during harvest times, since he can't handle yielding all the acres. Aye also looks after their ducks and she is expert at that as Aye has years of experiences growing them. This loan will help Aye's family purchase high quality feeds; to have nutritious eggs and vaccines; to be healthy and productive. She aims her child to be schooled till graduations and have enough financials to cover family's living cost.

This loan will help 12 members, purchase ducks and high quality feeds. Duck raising has recently become very popular in Myanmar and a way to boost income in rural areas. Ducks growers work very careful, not to get harshly on their ducks as it effects the productions rate.
Pictured above are some members from Too Myaung Village Group, named Aye, Lwan, Hte, Myint and Zin. Too Myaung Village is located in Ayeyarwaddy Delta Region where most households focus on crop farming and raising ducks.

loans.use: to purchase high quality feeds and vaccines

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is the age of 38; she is mother of four daughters and two sons. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan, where her son is a rickshaw driver by profession. From the past many days his rickshaw is not working properly because of which he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible.

However due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing rickshaw. Therefore,Asia has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her son to buy a new rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Asia is so much thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to use this loan to buy an Auto Rickshaw for her son.

loans.name: Angel Samuel

texts.es: Angel tiene 20 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos se dedica a realizar trabajos temporales, con el dinero solicitado el comprara un televisor, tiene el sueño de tener un negocio propio y en sus tiempos libres realiza actividades deportivas
texts.en: Angel is 20 years old. He is single and has no children. He works at temporary jobs. With the money he has asked for, he will buy a television. His dream is to have his own business and in his free time, he plays sports.

loans.use: to buy a television,

loans.name: Reinaldo

texts.es:
Reinaldo es un hombre con 35 años de edad, con esfuerzo y dedicación logro montar su propio negocio, una tienda la cual ubico en un local cercano a su casa arrendado por un familiar, además allí tiene unas mesas de billar, lo que hace que sus ingresos sean un poco mejores.
Trabaja todos los días durante 8 horas.

Con el propósito de aumentar sus clientes, mejoras sus ventas e incrementar sus ganancias, Reinaldo se encuentra solicitando un préstamo con el cual comprara frutas, verduras y también mesas, sillas y estantes nuevos.

Su mayor sueño es comprar una casa propia, brindarle a su familia una buena estabilidad económica y mejor calidad de vida.

Con su aporte este hombre podrá continuar sus sueños, anímese, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
Reinaldo is a 35 year old man. With hard work and dedication, he has been able to open his own business, which is a store in a locale close to his home, rented by a relative. In addition, he also has billiard tables there, which makes his income a little better. He works every day for 8 hours.

In order to increase his customers, improve his sales and increase his profits, Reinaldo is asking for a loan to buy fruits and vegetables, as well as new tables, chairs and shelves.

His biggest dream is to buy his own home and offer his family good financial stability and a better quality of life.

With your support, this man can continue with his dream. We encourage you to make a loan.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables, as well as new tables, chairs and shelves.

loans.name: Magdaleno Isaias

texts.es: Don Magdaleno de 52 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, el se dedica al cultivo de maiz y frijol desde hace 15 años, comercializa sus prodcutos en los pueblos aledaños y con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de fertilizantes para tener un buen cultivo.
texts.en: Magdaleno is 52 years old. He lives in his own home with his two children. He has grown corn and beans for 15 years. He sells his products in nearby towns and with his profits he is able to pay for some household expenses. He is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer to have a good crop.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia tiene 51 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y su hijo en casa propia de material rústico en la parte rural del distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La población del distrito se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Celia se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como gallinas, patos, pavos, cuyes, entre otros. El destino del crédito será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales para su negocio así como también para realizar arreglos y mantenimiento a su unidad móvil. Con esto Celia espera brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, lo que se verá reflejado en un aumento en su nivel de ingresos y por ende en su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Celia is 51 years old. She lives with her spouse and their son in her own home made of rustic materials in the rural part of the district of Pucará, province of Jaén, Cajamarca region, in the northern sierra of Peru. The district's population works in agriculture, ranching and trade.

Celia works raising and selling small animals such as hens, ducks, turkeys, guinea pigs, and more. The loan will be used to buy a larger quantity of animals for her business, as well as make repairs and do maintenance on her mobile unit. With this, Celia hopes to offer her customers a better service, which will be reflected in an increase in income level and therefore in her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of animals.

loans.name: Carmen Elena

texts.es:
Carmen es una mujer con 28 años de edad, tienen 2 hijas con 4 y 8 años de edad, dedicada a la cría de aves, un negocio por el cual ha podido superar difíciles situaciones económicas. De allí se generan muy buenos ingresos, los cueles son invertidos en el estudio de sus hijas y en la compra de alimentos para su hogar.
Se encuentra solicitando un préstamo con el cual comprara peces, pollos, cerdos y remodelará el punto donde cría y vende estos.
Su meta es continuar trabajando para pagar los estudios de sus hijos, pues son el motor que impulsa a esta madre para luchar día a día.
Para esto ella cuenta con la ayuda de Interactuar y los prestamistas del portal Kiva.
texts.en:
Carmen is a 28 year old woman. She has 2 daughters, ages 4 and 8. She works breeding birds, which is a business where she has had to overcome difficult economic situations. She gets a good income from the business, which she invests into the education of her daughters and into buying food for the home.

She is asking for a loan that she will use to buy fish, chickens, pigs and to remodel the area where she breeds and sells them. Her goal is to continue working to pay for her children's education. They are the engine that drives this mother to fight every day. She is counting on the help of Interactuar and the Kiva loaners.

loans.use: to buy fish, chickens, pigs, and to remodel the area where she breeds and sells them.

loans.name: Virgen De Las Nieves Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VIRGEN DE LAS NIEVES”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco. 

La socia es la Sra. Carmen Rosa ella es conviviente y tiene 38 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de comida, la socia realiza diferentes platos como pollo al horno, sopas y saltados de carne, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, verduras y pollo.


Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de venta de celulares, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant. 

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The borrowers belong to the Virgen de las Nieves communal bank. This bank is located in Cusco district, which belongs to Cusco province and Cusco department.

The borrower is Carmen Rose. She is partnered, 38 years old, and has 1 child. The borrower works at her business selling food. She makes different dishes such as baked chicken and meat soups and stir-fries. The borrower works from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm. The borrower has been in this business for 8 years now and is going very well for her. Her dream is to have a restaurant. The borrower asks for the loan to purchase products to cook such as rice, vegetables, and chicken.

The other borrowers work at a business selling clothing, a business selling cell phones, a grocery store business, and a restaurant business.

The borrower is grateful to those who are a part of this dream through this platform and promises to make her payments on the established schedule.

loans.use: to purchase products to cook such as rice, vegetables, and chicken.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es: Doña Magdalena, tiene 54 años de edad, es casada, y reside en el municipio de Tocoa junto a su esposo. Anteriormente su negocio era una pulpería y no le dio buenos resultados. Hace ya 3 años que se dedica a la venta de calzado para damas caballeros y niños. Este negocio lo tiene en su casa y cuenta con buena clientela. Vende sandalias y zapatos en general. Ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por un monto de 15,000 Lempiras para invertirlo en la compra de otros estilos de sandalias y calzado para surtir su negocio y con una parte mejorar las instalaciones del local del negocio. El préstamo le ayudará en aumentar las ventas y cambiar el tipo de calzado. Su meta es tener un local propio aparte y comprar un vehículo para que su esposo le ayude a vender en otros lugares.
texts.en: Magdalena is 54 years old, married, and lives in the municipality of Tocoa with her husband. Previously, her business was a general store and it didn't have good profits. For 3 years now, she has worked selling women's, men's and children's shoes. She has this business in her house and has a good customer base. She sells general sandals and shoes. She has decided to ask for a loan for the amount of 15,000 lempiras to invest it in the purchase of other styles of sandals and shoes to stock her business and, with a part, to improve the furniture in her retail space. The loan will help her to increase her sales and change the type of shoes. Her goal is to have her own separate retail space and purchase a vehicle so her husband can help her sell in other places.

loans.use: to purchase new sandal and shoe styles and improve the furniture in her business.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a businesswoman from Tuyabang Bajo, Oroquieta City, Mis. Occ. where she has a retailing business.

She has also been a member of Paglaum MPC for almost 6 years, and they have been her financing partner for her business ventures. She has made such good sales in her business that she has been able to venture into hog raising for additional income.

Judith wants to have a sufficient inventory of goods to sell, and so she is asking for a loan for this purpose. The amount will be used to restock her store with consumable goods such as junk food, canned goods, noodles, condiments and other items.

loans.use: to restock her store with consumable goods such as junk food, canned goods, noodles, condiments and other items.

loans.name: Rosabel

texts.es:
Rosabel es una mujer de 20 años, soltera, sin hijos, y su negocio es el tejido de ‘lluchus’ (gorros de lana).
Ella es dulce, cariñosa, y muy sensible. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘16 de febrero’ zona residencial muy humilde, viejas construcciones de adobe adornan el lugar.
Rosabel es de piel canela, baja estatura y físico delgado. Su lengua materna es el Aymara y habla español. Su vida la realiza en casa de sus familiares que trabajan, viven en una casa propia construida de adobe que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su negocio es el tejido de ‘lluchus’, los lluchus son gorros de lana muy comercializados en el altiplano y en el área rural debido al fuerte frio durante todo el año, “inicie mi actividad tejiendo para mi hermana ya me independicé y necesito algunas herramientas para mi trabajo…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que tiene los conocimientos sobre el tejido, la desventaja es que no cuenta con una lista de clientes. Su sueño es establecer su negocio, ella desea comprar un máquina de tejer y lana por mayor para continuar con su negocio. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 9 meses que se dedica a esta actividad independientemente.
Es por esos motivos que Rosabel solicita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina de tejer y lana por mayor para establecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosabel is a 20-year-old woman, single, with no children, and her business is knitting "lluchus" (woolen hats).

She is sweet, loving, and very sensitive. Her business is located in the 16 de febrero zone, a very humble residential zone; old buildings of adobe adorn the place.

Rosabel has cinnamon-colored skin, is short, and has a thin physique. Her native language is Aymara and she speaks Spanish. She has her life in the home of relatives who work. They live in a house they own, made of adobe which has all the basic services. Her business is weaving "lluchus". Lluchus are hats made of wool sold frequently in the high plains of the Andes and in the rural areas due to the very cold temperatures year-round. "I began my business weaving for my sister, and now I became independent and I need some tools for my work..." she says. The advantage of her business is that she has the knowledge of weaving, the disadvantage is that she doesn't have a list of customers. Her dream is to establish her business. She wants to purchase a weaving machine and wool in bulk to continue with her business. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the 9 months she has done this work independently.

For these reasons, Rosabel asks for a loan to purchase a weaving machine and wool in bulk to establish her business.

loans.use: to purchase a weaving machine and wool in bulk to establish her business.

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es: Don Mariano de 55 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus cuatro hijos, el se dedica desde hace 30 años al cultivo de granos basicos (maiz y frijol)gracias a su trabajo es omo el puede salir adelante con su familia y solventar los gastos de su casa, el cliente esta solicitando a INTEGRAL un credito para la compra de fertilizantes pra poder obtener una buena cosecha y asi mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Mariano is 55-years old and lives in his own house with his four children. He has worked for 30 years growing basic grains (corn and beans). Thanks to his job, he can get ahead with his family and cover the household expenses. He is asking for a loan through Integral to buy fertilizers to be able to have a good harvest and thus a better income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.es:
Wilson tiene 41 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y sus hijos, vive en el distrito de Colasay, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Wilson se dedica al cultivo de café de variedad Catimor, en el caserio Flor de la Esperanza. Desde hace 3 años, en el Caserio Flor de la Esperanza. Solicita crédito para comprar abono para su cultivo, pues abonando su cultivo él podra asegurar una gran campaña, lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Wilson is 41-years old. He lives with his partner and children in the district of Colasay, province of Jaén, in the Cajamarca region in the northern highlands of Peru. His community works mainly in agriculture, livestock and business.

Wilson works growing the Catimor variety of coffee, on the Flor de la Esperanza (Flower of Hope) homestead. He has worked here for 3 years. He is asking for a loan to buy compost for his crops. By fertilizing his crops, he will be able to assure a great season which will allow him to improve his income, increase his earnings and improve his and his family's quality of life in a short time.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizer for his crops.

loans.name: Tea

texts.en:
Tea is a 32-year-old married woman from the village Boslevi. She has three children and a husband, who is the only breadwinner in the family. He works at the local railway and gets a small monthly income that is really hardly enough, and the family lives in poverty.

Tea is engaged in cattle breeding and in cultivation of nuts and grapes, from where she gets a small seasonal income. To tackle the financial difficulties and make a stable source of income, Tea decided to open a small general store near the house. Tea's loan request was rejected each time, because the creditors did not find the existing family income sufficient to approve the loan.

Her loan request was approved in the framework of a joint initiative by Kiva and Credo. The start up loan program provides start up credit soft conditions for the country's rural poor, who, regarded as "high risk borrowers" because of their low income, do not have access to credit products.

With the received credit, Tea will purchase stock of various products for the general store and also renovate the place. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva startup loan, will significantly increase the family's income and the family members will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to open a small general store near her house.

loans.name: Ibechou Group

texts.en:
Bharthi is 49 years old, living in Imphal East district of Manipur. She formed a group called Ibechou, consisting of five members. The members need loans of INR 7,000 each for their respective businesses.

Bharti is the leader of this group and she plans to use the loan for buying raw materials for expanding her weaving business. Currently her household income is INR 10,000 and it is not enough for a family of seven. With the help of this loan, her household income will increase to INR 13,000.

With your help, all the women in this group will be able to contribute to their family household incomes and save an amount for their businesses and any future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Romana

texts.en:
Romana is 39 years old, married and supporting a family of five children between 18 years and 1 year old.

She has been in dairy farming for over ten years now, earning a monthly profit of KES 10,000.

Romana has applied for a loan of KES 30,000. This being her first loan, she intends to purchase a dairy cow to increase milk production.

She plans to use the anticipated profits from her business to educate her children and hopes to be financially sustainable in future.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a committed member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT). She’s blessed that her previous loan of PHP 40,000 was granted. Currently, she’s managing a variety store, a canteen and an e-loading business. She wants to thank lenders for being involved in the Kiva program and helping others financially. She has been able to buy additional products for her businesses.

Evelyn aims to make her variety store into a one-stop shop where she can offer products by the piece as well as complete items. She also dreams of having another branch of her canteen. However, most of her customers are her neighbors and friends, and that’s why she couldn't avoid lending products. To compensate, Evelyn has decided to apply for another loan of PHP 50, 000 this year to buy additional stocks of grocery items for her variety store and food business. She is hopeful that CCT will once again grant her request so that her business will have a wide variety of choice to offer.

On a weekly basis, Evelyn regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony and her experiences in business, and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and to listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationships with other partners, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional products for her inventory

loans.name: Viviana Elizabeth

texts.es: Viviana es soltera tiene un hijo se dedica a la compra venta de cerdos solicita el dinero para aumentar el numero de cerdos y asi poder cubrir los pedidos que tiene, tiene un sueño de tener su casita propia y en sus tiempos libres ella descansa
texts.en: Viviana is single. She has a son and works buying and selling pigs. She is asking for a loan to increase the number of pigs to be able to cover the orders that she has. Her dream is to have her own house. In her free time she rests.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a 44-year-old married woman with four children. Fifteen years ago she started working in the beauty care domain from her house to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their children. She has a good reputation among her region for her professional skills.

Hanan is a hard worker who is trying desperately to develop her business, but she is also a sacrificing mother who deprives herself for the sake of her children. She has requested a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay for her daughter's wedding expenses. She is very excited for this day and she is trying to make it a very special day as her daughter dreams.

Hanan hopes to expand her business more in the future through opening her own beauty salon to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's wedding expenses.

loans.name: Kareen Group

texts.en:
Bouthaina is the featured borrower for Kareen Group. She got together with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Bouthaina is a 47-year-old married mother of one child. Twelve years ago, she started selling Tupperware to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their beloved child. Bouthaina is a hard worker and ambitious woman who is trying hard to develop her business, thus today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with new collection of Tupperware to satisfy her customers' needs. Bouthaina is the lady sitting in the middle.

With respect to the other group members, Nadine is the first lady on the right, and Ghada is the first lady on the right.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with new collection of Tupperware.

loans.name: Lindy

texts.en:
Lindy runs this variety store in Bacolod City, Negros Occidental. Just like other business owners, she also experiences stiff competition and lack of capital. Sometimes it hampers the smooth operation of her business and consequently affects her income. It’s good that she also earns from her massage therapy service that she’s been doing for 15 years already. She’s does home service massage therapy to her clients. Her income adds to her husband’s earnings as a carpenter and sustains her family’s usual everyday needs.
