Lindy’s forward-looking mindset drives her to improve her store further. She knows that a time will come when she can no longer offer massage therapy service due to old age. Hence, she applied for additional capital of PHP 23,000 that she will use to buy more supplies to enhance her inventory. She aims to set aside some amount for her and her husband’s retirement because self-employed workers like them have no medical insurance and retirement benefits as they age. She hopes you can extend financial assistance to her and give her a little assurance for her future.

She prays for a growing business, good health and more blessings for her whole family. She meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from religion.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study religion, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more supplies to enhance her inventory.

loans.name: Heba Group

texts.en:
Carole is the featured borrower for Heba Group. She got together with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Carole is a 25-year-old single lady who got employed five years to cover her needs and expenses, as she is still continuing her studies. She is a hard worker and independent lady. Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay her institute tuition fees. Carole is the first lady on the right.

With respect to the other group members, Iman is the lady standing in the middle, and Hiba is the first lady on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to pay her institute tuition fees.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen, 47, from Tigbauan, Iloilo makes these “kaing” with the help of her husband, Roger. It’s been their source of income for almost 30 years. It provides for their everyday needs and educational expenses of their 4 children. However, it’s not sufficient for them to set aside some savings for the future and emergency situations like sudden illness of their children. Due to insufficient money, their daughter died few years ago. Helen and her whole family were devastated but their faith in God strengthened them as they continue with their livelihood.

The above picture shows pile of woven bamboo crates or hampers, commonly known in the Philippines as “kaing”. Those in the picture are unfinished products which need final weaving of the lid and handle. These woven bamboo hampers are used as containers for harvested products such as mangoes, melons, tomatoes, and others. Its open ventilation and durability makes it suitable for transporting such products from farm to market.

Now Helen aims to boost her production and sales with the aid of PHP 20,000 additional capital to buy more bamboo as raw material for her business. Hopefully she can save efficiently from additional profit that she can derive from this. She prays that her children will never get serious illness again. It’s her desire to see them finish their studies and have a brighter future. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more bamboo as raw material for her woven bamboo hamper business

loans.name: Maria Seneth

texts.es:
Maria es una señora con 42 años de edad, tiene tres hijos con 10, 14 y 17 años de edad, los cuales adora con todas sus fuerzas, luego de quedarse sin empleo varios meses, Maria monto su propio negocio, se dedica a la cría y venta de ganado, un medio por el cual le dio solución a todos sus problemas económicos.
Trabaja todos los días durante 4 horas.
Con el propósito de mejorar sus ventas, aumentar sus clientes e incrementar las ganancias, Maria solicita un crédito para la compra de cerdos, y alimento al por mayor para los pollos.
Su mayor sueño es tener una casa propia brindarle a su humilde familia una mejor calidad de vida y gozar de una buna salud.
Con su aporte esta mujer podrá hacer de sus sueños una realidad, anímese, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
Maria is a 42-year old woman. She has three children, ages 10, 14, and 17, who she adores with all her heart. After being unemployed for several months, Maria set up her own business breeding and selling livestock. This was a means that gave her a solution to all of her economic problems. She works very day for 4 hours.

In order to improve sales, increase clientele and increase earnings, Maria is asking for a loan to buy pigs, and wholesale food for the chickens. Her biggest dream is to have her own home, give her humble family a better quality of life and enjoy good health.

With your support, this woman will be able to make her dreams come true. Go for it, make a loan.

loans.use: to buy pigs, and wholesale food for the chickens.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is a married woman and has been blessed with two children who attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Charity has operated a poultry selling business for over six years. She mentioned disease outbreak causing losses as a challenge in the business. Charity dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future.

With the KES 30,000, she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feeds. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feeds.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en: Safia is a 45 year-old-woman residing in Lahore, Pakistan. She looks after her family consisting of a  son and three daughters. Her husband has been running a restaurant for the last 40 years. He provides services to the people for servicing good and fresh-food meals. His restaurant is situated in the main market. Many shopkeepers come in to his restaurant to eat delicious food. He needs some utensils and fresh food items to develop his business. In this regard, Safia contacted Kiva field partner BRAC Pakistan for a loan. Safia is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy food items and utensils for her husband.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is 42 years old,married and supports 2 children. She has been practicing small scale farming for the last 17 years earning an income of KES 15,000 per month. She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase animal feed and nappier grass for her cow in order to meet her client demands that have increased in the market. The surplus will be used to add a dairy cow.

She plans to use the gained profit to repay the loan and expand her business. Her hopes and dreams are to eradicate poverty and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase animal feeds and nappier grass for her cow in order to meet her client demands that have increased in the market and the surplus to add a dairy cow.

loans.name: Asael Audi

texts.es:
Asael, de 28 años de edad, se graduó de bachiller en el año 2008, se casó hace tres años, su esposa trabaja de secretaria en una clínica privada del pueblo en donde residen y aún no tiene hijos. 

Asael, trabaja en sembrando hortalizas, este trabajo se lo enseño su papá desde que tenía nueve años de edad, porque su papá trabajo en las hortalizas siempre; Asael, también ha trabajado como ordeñador de vacas y no tiene horarios fijos.- La próxima cosecha que sembrará será de tomate, porque anteriormente sembró pepino, del cual espera sacar buenas cosechas; pero además trabaja de ayudante de albañil cuando no trabaja en las hortalizas

El crédito que está solicitando es para comprar insumos agrícolas para sembrar tomates y para fertilizar el cultivo de pepino y así poder seguir generando ingresos para su hogar junto a su esposa y poder tener una mejor calidad de vida. 

El sueño de Asael, es poder instalar la luz eléctrica en su casa y comprar poliducto de mejor calidad para llevar el agua del nacimiento hasta donde tiene las hortalizas y también para llevar agua para el consumo de su familia.- Con la venta de las hortalizas ha construido su pequeña casa, además en el futuro sueña con colocar un local en el pueblo para vender las hortalizas que produce.
texts.en:
Asael is 28-years old. He graduated high school in 2008 and got married 3 years ago. His wife works as a secretary in a private clinic in the town where they live and they do not yet have children. Asael works planting vegetables. His father taught him how to do this work when he was 9 years old, because his father always worked with vegetables. Asael has also worked as a cow milker and he does not have a set schedule.

The next crop that he will plant will be tomato because he previously planted cucumber, which he hopes to get a good harvest from. He also works as an assistant bricklayer when he is not working with the vegetables.

The loan that he is asking for is to buy agricultural supplies to plant tomatoes and to fertilize the cucumber crops. This way he will be able to keep getting an income for his home, together with his wife, and be able to have a better quality of life.

Asael's dream is to be able to install electricity in his house and buy a better quality pipeline to carry the spring water to the vegetables and for his family's use. With the vegetable sales, he has built his small house. In the future, he dreams of setting up a stall in the town to sell the vegetables that he produces.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to plant tomatoes and fertilize the cucumber crops.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma, 38, is a mother of two sons and two daughters.

Her husband owns an car accessorizing shop in the market. It is the only source of income for the family. He needs to purchase a new variety of raw material such as rexine (artificial leather), leather, etc. Due to lack of money, however, he finds it difficult.

Therefore, his wife, Salma, is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her husband. He will purchase the material for seat making. This loan will help him to offer more variety to his customers and to continue his work efficiently and professionally.

Salma is quite happy that she will be able to help her husband with the loan. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy material, such as rexine, leather, etc. for her husband.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 22-year-old single lady who has been providing hair dressing and make up services from her house for two years. She is applying for a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua in order to purchase beauty cosmetics and tools necessary to develop her business.

Fatima is well known in her region with her special talents and services she provides to her customers. She got vocational training in this domain to have the basic skills she has to know. Now she is working hard on developing these talents as much as she can so she can open a beauty salon in the future.

loans.use: to purchase beauty cosmetics and tools necessary to develop her business.

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda is 24 years old, married and supports 2 children. She has been practicing small scale farming for the last 7 years earning an income of KES 15,000 per month. She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy certified fertilizers for top dressing her nappier grass in order to meet her client demands that have increased in the market. She will use the surplus to buy a dairy cow.

She plans to use the gained profit to repay the loan and and and expand her business. Her hopes and dreams are to eradicate poverty and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy certified fertilizers for top dressing her nappier grass in order to meet her client demands who have increased in the market and the surplus to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Rajaa

texts.en:
Rajaa is a 38-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and four children.

In 2013, she began to work from her home in producing homemade food. She works with excitement and enthusiasm as she likes this occupation. She is well known in her region by the delicious food that she prepares.

Today, she is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase raw materials and food provisions to increase her productivity and therefore her profits.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials and food provisions.

loans.name: Alita

texts.en:
“Abundant life for all”-- based on the Bible passage John 10:10 -- is Alita’s desire for her family and for all Filipino people.

She operates a variety store and distributes mineral water to her community in Bacolod City, Negros Occidental. For 24 years of operation, her perennial problem is the long-time debts of her neighbors, which disturb the stability of her business. Her kind consideration to them is not enough to maintain her store. This is why she fervently prays that these collectibles will lessen so she can use her capital wisely. She needs to supplement her husband, Vim’s, income as a teller to support the needs and education of their three children.

She applied for PHP 30,000 loan as additional capital for her business. She plans to add rice to her inventory, buy more grocery items and cases of beverages, and purchase more containers of mineral water. She’s hoping that this additional capital will keep her business running despite those collectibles. Eventually, she will have her store renovated to make it more stable and competitive. She aspires that her children will complete their education and enjoy a better living condition someday.

Alita is a dutiful member of CCT Credit Cooperative and meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and religion.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study religion, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy rice, grocery items, cases of beverages, and containers of mineral water.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet lives in Kagadi, Uganda, She is 35 years old, married, and a mother of six children.

Harriet trades in stationery as her major source of income. She started this business in 1998 and supplements her income with proceeds from farming. She started this business purposely to generate income for family support.

Harriet still complains of seasonal sales in that her business is at peak during school-going time but her profits lessen throughout the year. That is why she diversified her business with farming in order to have several sources of income.

She wants a loan to buy books, pens, reams of papers and other stationery for her shop ahead of the beginning of school term.

loans.use: to buy books, pens, reams of papers and other stationery.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia is 27 and a mother of three children. She lives with her spouse and children in the area of Multan, Pakistan. She has a small child in her care. Her husband is responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family. Her husband is a driver by profession. He provides transportation services using his auto rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for 6 years to meet the family’s expenses.

Nadia’s husband wants to buy new auto rickshaw for proper transportation services but due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to buy the auto rickshaw. Nadia has applied for a KIVA loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, Nadia’s husband can purchase the auto rickshaw and provide the proper transportation services to earn an income.

She and her family will be thankful to the KIVA lenders and field partner BRAC Pakistan for helping them by funding this loan to improve their living standard.

loans.use: to buy an auto rickshaw for her husband.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 46 years old and married with four children. With three children in school, Veronica works very hard to provide for them.

Veronica runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. Veronica has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, school supplies and other personal care products. In the future Veronica would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ayşe

texts.en:
Ayşe is married and has a child. She owns an optician store. With her first loan she bought materials for eyeglasses and gained money. With the help of her second loan she is planning to buy bulk quantities of lenses and frames, make money and expand her business.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Ayşe hanım evli bir çocuk annesi. Ayşe hanımın gözlükçü dükkanı var. İlk kullandığı mikro kredi ile dükkana gözlük malzemeleri aldı ve satarak para kazandı. İkinci kullandığı mikro kredi ile de gözlük camı ve çerçevesi alarak satarak para kazanmak istiyor ve işlerini geliştirmeyi hedefliyor.

loans.use: to buy optical materials.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a married woman with eight children, six attend school. She owns a house without electricity and running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household costs.

For over one year, she has operated a home-based open-air food selling business. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

She will use 15,000 KES to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, beans, firewood, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to increase her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, beans, firewood, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Zamirai

texts.ru: Эту молодую и женственную девушку зовут Замираи. Ей 20 лет. Замираи работает швеей у себя дома. Она работает и зарабатывает и помогает семье. Скоро брат Замираи женится, и она хочет ему помочь в проведении свадебного мероприятия. В Таджикистане свадьба масштабное событие и приглашаются гости около 150-200 человек. Таджики очень дружелюбная нация старавшаяся сохранять родственные связи, за счет этого приглашаются столь большое количество гостей, и соответственно свадебное мероприятие требует больших расходов. Замираи намерена заемные деньги потратить на свадьбу брата.
texts.en:
This young and graceful woman’s name is Zamirai. She is 20 years old. Zamirai works as a seamstress out of her home. Thanks to this work, she earns an income and helps her family. Zamirai’s brother is getting married soon, and she wants to help him cover the costs of the wedding reception.

In Tajkistan, weddings are big events, with some 150-200 guests. Tajiks are very hospitable and value family ties, which is why so many guests are invited. Accordingly, a wedding requires significant expenses. Zamirai plans to use her loan for her brother’s wedding..

loans.use: to pay for her brother's wedding.

loans.name: Ramona

texts.en:
Ramona is encouraged that she received financial assistance to fill her store with essential food items. She believes that her store earnings helped to support their daily life and to send her children to school.

She is again humbly asking for 17,000 PHP to restock her store with grocery items such as canned goods, coffee, soda, and instant noodles. Her store means a lot to her since it has been her source of income for the past five years. Although there are times she encounters difficulty collecting money due from some of her customers, she is thankful that somehow they are able to get through in life.

Ramona's precious dream is to see her children finish school. A college education is their hope and path to a better future. Every week, she meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to  pay for grocery items, beverages, and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Fouzia

texts.en:
Fouzia is responsible woman with 3 children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has provided taxi transportation services for 18 years. Her husband is responsible to meet the needs of the entire family. He needs to maintain his taxi because it requires more maintenance on a daily basis.

Due to insufficient finances, her husband is unable to maintain his taxi. Fouzia has applied to Kiva for a loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will help Fouzia's husband to easily afford the maintenance costs and provide better transportation services.

Fouzia also plans to save the profit to meet her family's needs in future.

Fouzia is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband repair his taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: EL SEÑOR ES UN PADRE DE FAMILIA  ACTUALMENTE ESTA PASANDO POR PROBLEMAS DE AUTOESTIMA DEBIDO A QUE SUFRE DE INFECCIÓN EN LAS ENCÍAS Y ESTO LE PROVOCA HALITOSIS . DESEA ATENDERSE DE INMEDIATO PARA CORREGIR ESTE PROBLEMA LAMENTABLEMENTE NO CUENTA CON LOS RECURSOS NECESARIOS PARA EL TRATAMIENTO.
texts.en: The man is a father who is currently going through self-esteem problems because he has a gum infection that's causing halitosis.  He wants to be taken care of immediately to fix the problem.  Unfortunately he doesn't have the necessary resources for the treatment.

loans.use: to pay for dental treatment

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr: Agée de 51 ans, Marie est une femme mariée habitant à Adidogomé. Marie est une marchande  de savons de toilette ayant trois enfants à charge. Marie s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché  et le revend de quartier en quartier. Marie sollicite ce prêt pour commander des douzaines de savons. Avec les bénéfices, Marie compte appuyer son mari dans la prise en charge des enfants et les besoins en  nourriture et santé de la famille.
texts.en:
Aged 51 years, Marie is a married woman living in Adidogomé. She sells bath soaps and takes care of three children. She gets her supplies four times per month and the market and resells from neighbourhood to neighbourhood.

Marie is requesting this loan to buy dozens of soaps. With the profits, she intends to support her husband in taking care of the children and in the family's food and health needs.

loans.use: to buy eight dozen soaps.

loans.name: Isra

texts.en:
Isra is a 22-year-old single lady from Rafah City, which is both a city and a Refugee Camp in the Gaza Strip.

Isra was living with her family in a small humble house, but during the latest conflict in Gaza her house was destroyed completely, so she had to rent a small apartment in the same area. Recently, Isra took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit and Development (FATEN) in order to rebuild her old house. The loan will allow Isra to finalize the needed construction in a short time and return her family to their normal life.

Isra appears in the photo.

loans.use: to rebuild her old house.

loans.name: Tchilalo

texts.fr: Mariée et mère d’un enfant, Tchilalo est une femme âgée de 29 ans résidant à Adidogomé. Tchilalo est une marchande de produits d’alimentations générales qui achète ses marchandises une fois par mois au marché et le revend à domicile dans sa boutique. Tchilalo sollicite ce prêt pour commander des paniers de petits poissons fumés et des cartons de tomates en vue de stocker une plus grande quantité de marchandises et maximiser son profit afin d’aider son mari dans l’éducation de ses enfants et aux charges quotidiennes éprouvées.
texts.en:
Married and mother to one child, Tchilalo is a 29-year old woman living in Adidogomé. She sells general foodstuffs that she purchases once per month at the market and resells from home in her shop.

Tchilalo is requesting this loan to order baskets of small smoked fish and boxes of tomatoes so as to stock a greater quantity of merchandise and maximise her profit. This is so that she can help her husband with their children's education and with the daily expenses they face.

loans.use: to buy three baskets of small smoked fish and nine boxes of tomatoes.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es:
Marcela es una mujer de 28 años de edad, casada, tiene 2 hijos de 7 y 10 años, y su negocio es la tienda de barrio.
Ella es buena madre, paciente y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘kalajahuira’ que se encuentra a la salida de la ciudad.
Marcela es morena de baja estatura y físico robusto. Su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español. Su vida la comparte con su esposo que se dedica a ala construcción y con sus hijos que aún no se encuentran en edad escolar, viven en una casa propiedad de la familia construida de ladrillo y cemento que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su negocio es la venta de alimentos y artículos de primera necesidad como; huevos, fideo, enlatados, gaseosas, verduras, golosinas, y otros, actividad que realiza durante toda la semana en su tienda de barrio, “anteriormente trabajaba con mi esposo como ayudante de construcción, ahorre un poco de dinero y pude abrir mi negocio…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con ventas diarias, la desventaja es la falta de capital para reabastecer el negocio con alimentos de  primera necesidad. Su sueño es trasladar su tienda sobre la avenida principal, ella desea realizar la compra de abarrotes por mayor para abastecer su tienda de barrio. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que se dedica a este negocio.
Es por esos motivos que Marcela solicita un préstamo para la compra de abarrotes por mayor para abastecer su tienda de barrio.
texts.en:
Marcela is a 28 year old woman, married with two children, ages seven and ten, and her business is a neighborhood general store.
She is a good mother, patient and very hard-working. Her business is in the 'kalajahuira' neighborhood which is on the outskirts of the city.
Marcela has a dark complexion, short-statured with a robust frame. Her native language is Aymará, and she speaks Spanish. She shares her life with her husband, who works in construction, and with her children who are not yet attending school. They live in their own family home built of brick and cement, which has all the basic services. Her business is selling groceries and basic necessities such as eggs, noodles, canned goods, soft drinks, vegetables, sweets, and more. She works during the week in her neighborhood general store: "before I worked with my husband as a helper in construction, we saved a little money and then I could open my business…" she comments. The advantage of her business is she has sales every day, the disadvantage is the lack of capital to restock the business with basic goods. Her dream is to move her store to the main avenue. She would like to buy wholesale goods to stock her store. This is the first loan she has requested in the five years since opening this business. For these reasons, Marcela is seeking a loan to purchase goods at wholesale to stock her neighborhood general store.

loans.use: to buy goods at wholesale to stock her neighborhood general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Silvia Patricia

texts.es: Doña Silvia de 50 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus 2 hijos, desde hace 15 años se dedica al cutlivo de maiz y maicillo el cual comercializa en los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su casa y con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, la clienta está solicitando nuevamente a INTEGRAL un crédito para la compra de mas fertilizantes, herbicidas, controles de plagas, etc. para seguir con su trabajo ya que le genera buenas ganancias.
texts.en: Doña Silvia is 40 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and two sons. For the last 15 years she has made her living growing corn and sorghum which she sells in the markets near her home.  With the income she earns she is able to cover some of her household expenses.  This client is requesting a new INTEGRAL loan to buy more fertilizers, herbicides, pesticides, etc. to continue her work as it generates good income.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers, herbicides and pesticides, etc.

loans.name: Esfuerzo Es Exito Group

texts.es: Victoria tiene 50 años de edad es soltero con hijos independientes. Ella  elaboración de bisutería peluches para luego expenderlos a sus conocidos y amigos hace varios años. Y a la vez presta servicios de cuidado de niños y ancianos. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materiales de bisutería y accesorios. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Victoria es la  primera persona sentada del lado derecho.
texts.en:
Victoria is 50 years old, single with children who are independent.

For several years she has made jewellery and stuffed animals which she sells to acquaintances and friends.She also offers services in caring for children and the elderly.

The loan will be used to buy materials for jewellery making and accessories. The group thanks the Kiva investors for the loan provided. Victoria is the first sitting on the right.

loans.use: to buy materials and accessories for jewellery making.

loans.name: Las Violetas Y El Girasol Group

texts.es: Alicia tiene 46 años de edad es soltera con un hijo educando. Ella posee un quiosco en el cual ofrece golosinas galletas bebidas frutas y un poco de abarrotes. De esa manera puede solventar los gastos de educación y alimentación de hijo. Ella tiene como finalidad darle una carrera profesional a su hijo. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de más golosinas bebidas galletas y bebidas. El grupo “LAS VIOLETAS Y EL GIRASOL” agradece a los inversionistas por el crédito brindado. Alicia es la segunda persona sentada del lado derecho viste chompa marron.
texts.en:
Alicia is 46 years old. She is single and has one son who studies at school. She has a kiosk where she offers candy, cookies, drinks, fruit and some groceries. In this way she can pay for the educational expenses and food for her son. She has the goal of providing education for him to become a professional. She will invest the loan in buying candy, drinks and cookies.

“Las Violetas Y el Girasol” group is grateful to the lenders for the loan awarded. Alicia is the first on the right.

loans.use: to buy more candy, drinks and cookies.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is a 38-year-old woman from Catigbian, Bohol. She is married and a mother of three children, ages 16, 14 and 6 years old.

To earn a living and to provide for the needs of their children, Margie and her husband are engaged in buying and selling pigs. Aside from pigs, she also buys and sells dried fish. She has been doing this for almost 10 years.

Margie wants to improve her business in the future to have a sustainable life. For this, she is asking for a loan to buy pigs to sell.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 60 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. Teresita works very hard to provide for them.

Teresita has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Teresita has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, diapers, shampoo and other groceries.

In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 48-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of 10 children. Her husband has been running a general store for past 12 years. Her husband is solely responsible to fulfill the needs of his entire family.

Nasreen's husband wants to purchase different kinds of commodities, e.g., rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items for his business purpose. But due to financial constraints her husband is not in a suitable position to buy all these products for reselling purposes.

Therefore, Nasreen has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all these commodities and will also be helpful for him to earn maximum profitable income to manage his household and business.

Nasreen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's general store business with the purchase of more commodities.

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad is a 19-year-old from Deir Al-Balah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip and suffers from power outages 12-16 hours a day regularly. He lives with his family in a small house. As an employee in the public sector, his father earns a low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs.

Because he is not able to save enough money, Muhammad took a USD loan from FATEN. With this loan, he will buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. Palestinians use water boilers that use either gas or gasoline to heat the water before a shower, which can be dangerous, expensive and inefficient. This will help him to provide hot water without using electricity, which is much more expensive.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 46 years old and has three children. Marissa is married, and all of her children are attending school.

Marissa is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Marissa requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Marissa has been raising pigs for eight years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marissa would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: This is 33-year-old Ibrahim. He is single and has no children. In 2013, Ibrahim established his provisions business. He began his business because he want to be self-employed. His business is located in the city center and his main customers are the public. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about SLL 900,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Ibrahim requires a loan in order to buy more goods like sugar, milk, mayonnaise, etc.  He hopes that this loan will support him to maximize profit. In the future, Ibrahim plans to be able to educate his children and help other family members. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more goods like sugar, milk, mayonnaise, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Ayni Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “AYNI”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Noemi ella es casada y tiene 64 años y tiene 5 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de lavanderia, la socia realiza servicios de lavanderias a diferentes hoteles, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 9:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de lavanderia. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar detergentes y una lavadora.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de internet, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These people are members of the AYNI Community Bank which is located in the district of Cusco, in the province of Cusco, and in the department of Cusco.

One of the members is 64-year old Sra. Noemi who is married and has five children. She runs a laundry providing services to different hotels. She works from 8 am to 9 pm and has had her business for several years. It is doing well.

Noemi's dream is to expand her business. She is seeking a loan to buy detergent and a washing machine.

The other members of the group have a variety of businesses: an Internet business; selling clothing; grocery store; restaurant. Noemi is grateful to those lenders who are helping her realize her dream and promises to pay back the money according to the schedule.

loans.use: buy detergent and a washing machine

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is from Tubigon, Bohol, and is engaged in buying and selling fruits and vegetables. She also sells fish from her husband’s catch. They work together to earn a living and to provide for the needs of their child. They have one child aged 17 years old.

Mary Jane is asking for a loan to buy fruits, vegetables and additional fish to sell. In the future, she wishes to increase her livelihood to have a better means of living.

loans.use: to buy fruits, vegetables and additional fish

loans.name: Mary May

texts.en:
Mary May is a sari-sari (variety) store owner. She has been running this business for 20 years. Mary May is a single mom from Tubigon, Bohol. Because of this, she works hard to raise her 7-year-old son.

She is asking for a loan to have additional capital to buy grocery items such as laundry soap, toiletries, spices, cooking oil, eggs, noodles, canned goods, coffee, sugar, biscuits, candies, chips, powdered chocolate drink and soft drinks.

In the future, she wants to improve her business for sustainability.

loans.use: to buy laundry soap, toiletries, spices, cooking oil, eggs, noodles, canned goods, coffee, sugar, biscuits, candies, chips, powdered chocolate drink and soft drinks.

loans.name: Fida

texts.en:
Fida is a 29-year-old, married woman from Rafah city. Her husband is an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low and unstable income. This income is barely covering all the family needs.

Fida is a student in the university where she studies business administration. She wants to take the BA degree and find a job to help her family with part of their expenses.

Fida took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new laptop for her studies. By taking this loan, Fida will be able to do her homework and reports easily.

Fida appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for her studies.

loans.name: Armendis De Jesus

texts.es:
Un hombre trabajador, humilde y lleno de vida, así es Armendis. Su situación económica empezó a desmejorar desde el día en que su esposa falleció, pues esta aportaba la mayor parte de sus ingresos en su hogar.
A pesar de esto, este hombre no se da por vencido, realiza diferentes actividades para lograr sobrevivir con los suyos.
Su deseo es montar su propio negocio, una tienda, pero su poco capital de trabajo no le permite hacerlo, es por esto que pide un auxilio económico con el cual comenzará a surtir su tienda con productos de aseo personal y productos de la canasta familiar como lo es el aceite, azúcar, sal, lentejas, carnes frías, bebidas y otros.
Su mayor sueño es comprar su casa, tener una buena calidad de vida y gozar de una buena salud.

Con su aporte este hombre hará de sus sueños una realidad, anímese, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
Hardworking, humble and full of life, that’s Armendis. His financial situation began to deteriorate since the day that his wife passed away as she contributed the greatest part of the household income. In spite of this, this man does not give up. He carries out different activities to manage to survive on his own.

His desire is to set up his own business, a store, but his little working capital doesn’t allow him to do so. For this reason he is requesting financial assistance with which he will begin to stock his store with personal hygiene products and basic staple products like oil, sugar, salt, lentils, cold cuts, drinks and other items.

His greatest dream is to buy his own house, have a good quality of life and enjoy good health. With your support this man will make his dreams come true - so, go on, make a loan!

loans.use: to stock his store with personal hygiene products and basic staple products like oil, sugar, salt, lentils, cold cuts, drinks and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy two sewing machines

loans.name: Tamr

texts.en:
Tamr is a 22-years-old single, young man from Nablus. His father works in the public sector where he gets a low and unstable income. This income barely covers all the family needs.

Tamr is a university student. He studies health administration . He wants to complete a BA degree and in the future, find a job to help support his family.

Tamr took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him pay his first semester university fees. By taking this loan, Tamr will be able to register at the university and pay part of his urgent expenses.

Tamr appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay his first semester university fees.

loans.name: Waed

texts.en:
Waed ran behind her dream without getting tired. She did not want to stop in trying her best to achieve her dream. She wants to get a bachelor's degree in Music and start her new journey.
Waed is a young, married woman with one child. She is 24 years old and a student at the university majoring in Music.

Her family wants to see her become a successful lady in the future but financial difficulties faced by her family and her marriage were an obstacles to complete her dream. She had to postpone semesters and that led her to the delay at the university. Waed decided to request an educational loan so that she can pay her university fees and complete her road to achieve her dreams.

loans.use: so that she can pay her university fees and complete her road to achieve her dreams.

loans.name: Kholoud

texts.en:
Kholoud is a married woman with three children. She is 37 years old and lives in Baqaa. She is a conservative woman and asked her son Haitham to take her place in the photo.

Haitham is one of her children who is 21 years old and studying computer engineering. He is studying this major because he feels that it will help him to show his creativity and ideas. Kholoud feels that her son Haitham will be someone important in the future and she cannot wait to see him in the graduation dress. Because of the financial crises that Kholoud and her husband have been facing, she asked for an education loan to pay his semester fees and to buy his needed books.

loans.use: To pay for her son's semester fees

loans.name: Rachide

texts.pt:
O senhor Rachide de 31 anos de idade é segurança, casado,  pai de 7 filhos dos quais 2 frequentam o ensino secundário,  sustenta  1 sobrinha que vive com ela vive na casa própria.
Diz que com o valor do empréstimo ira comprar barrotes, chapas de zinco,cimento, ferro, pedra areia para dar continuidade a construcao de sua casa.
O seu sonho é crescer no negocio e fazer outra casa num sitio melhor uma vez que a atual esta numa zona de difícil acesso.
Tem como desafios financeiros tem  estado a trabalhar para supera-los e conta também com ajuda de sua esposa que vende no mercado local e com o emprestimo anterior iniciou a construcao de sua casa com material convencional.
texts.en:
Rachide, 31, works as a security guard. He is married and the father of seven children; two of them go to secondary school. He maintains a niece that lives with him in a house he owns.

He says that he will use the loan to buy bars, zinc sheets, cement, iron, gravel and sand to continue building his house.

He dreams of expanding his business and building another house in a better location, since the one he owns now is difficult to reach.

His challenges are of a financial nature. He has been working to overcome them, and his wife helps him by selling products at the local market. With the previous loan he started to build his house with conventional materials.

loans.use: to buy bars, zinc sheets, cement, iron, gravel, and sand to continue building his house.

loans.name: Sebastian Efrain

texts.es: Sebastian es soltero tiene 34 años de edad se dedica al comercio y el dinero que pide es para implenter mas cerdos para cubrir la necesidad de las personas que le compran quiere realizar el sueño de poder comprar un terreno y le gusta hacer deporte
texts.en:
Sebastian, age 34, is single. He devotes himself to commerce.

The money that he is requesting is to get more pigs to cover the need of his customers.

He wants to fulfill his dream of being able to buy a piece of land.

He likes to play sports.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is 32 years old and lives in Salt. She is conservative woman and asked her brother Mohammad to take her place in the photo. Her dream was to complete her education and find work with a good income, but she could not achieve this dream because of the financial situation for her family.

Fatima's brother Mohammad is majoring in space engineering and is working hard to complete his education and find a good job with a good salary. 
Fatima requested an education loan, which she will use to help her brother pay for his university fees and complete his education.

loans.use: to help her brother to pay for his university fees and complete his education.

loans.name: Wendy Marily

texts.es:
Wendy, de 29 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, no siguió debido a problemas económicos que tenían sus padres, es madre de dos hijos de 2 y 7 años de edad, se acompaño cuando tenía 19 años de edad, su pareja trabaja en la agricultura y la ganadería.

Wendy, actualmente se dedica a la venta de pan y de tamales, los cuales hace tres o cuatro veces a la semana; su madre le ayuda a cuidar de sus hijos, mientras su esposo trabaja en el cultivo de maíz y el cuido del ganado que tienen como familia. Además de la venta de pan y tamales, también se dedica a la crianza de pollos criollos mejorados, los cuales vende en la comunidad y los utiliza también cuando vende tamales.

Wendy, solicita el préstamo para comprar 200 pollos de engorde y para comprar concentrado y abono para el cultivo de maíz y frijoles que tienen junto con su esposo.- De esa manera podrá garantizar la alimentación de su familia y con la venta de pollos generar ingresos para el sustento de la familia.

El sueño Wendy, es llegar a tener su casa propia, porque donde actualmente vive es de la suegra y ella siempre ha querido darle a sus hijos mejores condiciones en su propia casa.- También planea en el futuro construir instalaciones más grandes, donde pueda engordar más pollos.
texts.en:
29-year old Wendy has a grade 6 education. She didn't continue at school as her parents couldn't afford it. She has two children aged 2 and 7 and got married when she was 19. Her husband is a farmer and raises cattle. Currently Wendy sells bread and tamales which she makes three or four times a week. Her mother helps look after the children while her husband works growing maize and looking after the cattle which are part of the family. As well as selling bread and tamales, Wendy also raises poultry which she sells in the community and uses the meat in the tamales.

She is seeking a loan to buy 200 chickens to fatten, specialized feed, and fertilizer for the maize and beans that she and her husband grow. Then she will be able to guarantee feeding her family, and with the sale of the chickens, she will generate income to support them too.

Wendy's dream is to have a house of her own as she now lives with her mother-in-law. She has always wanted to provide her children with good living conditions in their own home. In the future she is also planning to build bigger coops where she can raise more chickens.

loans.use: buy 200 chickens to fatten, specialized feed, and fertilizer for the maize and beans she and her husband grow

loans.name: Saúl Josías Otoniel

texts.es:
Saúl es un hombre casado de 20 años de edad, tiene una linda familia de un hijo de 10 meses, esta linda familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá. Saúl con el afán de brindarle a su familia lo necesario, cuenta con un negocio de imprenta que se ubica en la comodidad de su hogar, el lleva un año realizando este tipo de negocio, pero a pesar de tener muy poco tiempo con este negocio, ha logrado la confianza de sus clientes, pero él con este ingresos no se da abasto, y trabaja como vendedor con una empresa de celulares, con estos dos ingresos a sacado a su familia adelante.
Saúl está solicitando un préstamo para invertirlo en su negocio de imprenta, con el préstamo el comprara materiales como: lona, toners, hojas entre otras cosas más. Con esta inversión Saúl espera satisfacer mejor las necesidades de sus clientes ofreciéndoles una publicidad  a su medida.
Su esperanza de vida, es que su negocio crezca y lo logre estabilizar en Sololá con mucho más demandas.
texts.en:
Saúl, age 20, have a lovely family with a ten month old son. This beautiful family lives in a community in Sololá. Out of the desire to provide his family with what it needs, Saúl has a printing business. It is located in the comfort of his home.

He has been engaged in this type of business for one year. In spite of having been in this business for a short amount of time, he has managed to gain his customers' trust. However, this income is not enough, and he works selling cell phones for a company. With the two incomes he has gotten his family ahead.

Saúl is requesting a loan to invest in his printing business. He will use the loan to buy materials like canvas, toners, and paper, among other things. With this investment Saúl hopes to better satisfy his customers' needs by offering them customized publicity. His life hope is for his business to grow and to manage to establish himself in Sololá with a great deal more demand.

loans.use: to buy printing materials like canvas, toners. and paper.

loans.name: Champions Group

texts.en: Grace is a member of the Champions group and she indeed aspires to be a champion as a business woman. She is in the poultry business which she started in August 2014 with a batch of only 50 birds. Over the last year her batch sizes have increased significantly, this was largely due to her marketing abilities, determination to succeed, coupled with financial discipline. Currently she is about to start selling her batch of 300 chickens to her base of regular customers. Considering her fowl run has a capacity of 500 chickens, Grace has insufficient capital to restock to her desired numbers. More so, she needs to have batches of different ages to ensure constant supply. Grace together with her group approached Thrive as a group and received training. She is in need of $500 in order to boost her poultry business and challenge herself to sell more and make more profits. A Kiva loan from you will help her to get all the necessary stock so that the business will continue to grow.

loans.use: To increase her stock of chickens.

loans.name: Powerful Women Group

texts.en:
After graduating with a diploma in Marketing in 2010, Elizabeth could not find a stable job as she wished. With high hopes of being financially independent, she started a business of importing dried Kapenta (small fish) from Mozambique. Her business has been limping along for a long time now; the major challenge being inadequate working capital to make her business grow. She approached a number of financial institutions to finance her project but her efforts were all in vain since she had no property to pledge as collateral.

Elizabeth is the chairperson of the Powerful Women group, based in Kuwadzana, a high density suburb in Harare. She is single, aged 26 and she takes care of her older parents. The group has five dedicated women who aim to improve their lives as well as educate their children. Elizabeth will use her portion of the group loan to buy 120 kgs of dried Kapenta. Elizabeth hopes to continue reinvesting the profits for her business to grow. As a group, they are looking forward to a $1,100 loan from Kiva to help them achieve their objectives.

loans.use: to buy dried fish in bulk to reduce costs.

loans.name: Silvia Yaneth

texts.es:
Silvia, de 34 años de edad, es una mujer luchadora, no logró estudiar, más sin embargo desde pequeña ha trabajado fuertemente, vivió 5 años en Estados Unidos en donde tuvo un hijo, pero por circunstancias de la vida regresó a El Salvador, ahora está felizmente casada, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, y tienen 2 hijos a los cuales quiere mucho.

Silvia, desde pequeña su madre le enseño a trabajar, pues ella se dedicaba a la venta de tamales; cuando ella tuvo la edad de 15 años, tuvo su primer negocio de venta de comida, en el cual le fue muy bien, posteriormente a los 22 años de edad se acompañó y viajó a los Estados Unidos, luego de cinco años conoció a otro hombre honesto y trabajador, que es con el que actualmente vive, desde hace 2 años se dedica a hacer tamales, los cuales vende en las casas de su comunidad.

Silvia, está solicitando el préstamo para comprar insumos para la venta de tamales como: maíz y hojas de plátano para envolverlos.

Silvia, sueña con que sus hijos prosperen y lleguen a ser profesionales, para que sirvan a su país y sean un ejemplo para su comunidad.
texts.en:
Silvia, age 34, is a tenacious woman. She did not manage to continue her education. However, she has worked hard ever since she was little. She lived in the United States for five years, and she had a son there. However, due to life circumstances she returned to El Salvador. Now she is happily married, and her husband is a farmer. They have two children whom they love very much.

When she was little her mother taught her to work. She sold tamales. When she was 15 years old she had her first business selling food. It went very well for her. When she was 22 she was in a relationship and traveled to the United Stated. After five years she met another man who is honest and hard-working. He is the one she currently lives with.

She has been making tamales for two years. She sells them to houses in her community.

Silvia is requesting the loan to buy supplies for her tamale sales. She will buy things like corn and banana leaves to wrap them.

Silvia dreams of her children prospering and becoming professionals in order to serve their country and to be an example for their community.

loans.use: to buy supplies like corn and banana leaves for wrapping the tamales that she sells.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay his university fees for the first semester.

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Tahira is a simple housewife. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. For the past two years, her husband has been providing transportation services by driving a taxi. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family.

Her husband needs to do maintenance on his taxi as the current condition of his taxi is not good. It requires daily maintenance. Due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to do the maintenance on his taxi. Therefore, Tahira has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Tahira's husband can easily afford the maintenance costs and be able to provide a better transportation service to earn a more profitable income. Tahira also plans to make savings with the profit of her husband's increased income to meet her family's needs in the future.

Tahira is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband repair his taxi.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.pt:
O senhor Carlos de 47 anos de idade é motorista, casado pai de 6 filhos dos quais 4 a estudar 2 já maiores de idade e vive na casa própria.
Diz que com o valor do empréstimo pretende comprar  cimento, ferro, chapas de zinco, janelas para ampliar a sua casa com uma casa casa de banho e cozinha  internas.
O seu sonho é terminar a sua obra, fazer muro de vedação do seu quintal e fazer aviários para criação de frangos.
Diz que o seu maior desafio e o financeiro, para supera-los conta com ajuda de sua esposa que tem um negocio em casa. Com os anteriores empréstimos fez sua carta de condução o que lhe possibilitou arranjar um emprego, antes trabalhava na machamba, adquiriu alguns bens que atualmente servem de garantia e uma viatura e diz ainda que ira solicitar mais vezes para suprir as dificuldades e alcançar os seus objetivos.
texts.en:
Carlos is 47 years old and works as a driver. He is married and the father of six children; four of them study and the remaining two are adults. He owns the house where he lives.

He says that he will use the loan to buy cement, iron, zinc sheets, and windows to enlarge his house by building a bathroom and a kitchen indoors.

His dream is to finish the construction work, build a division wall in his backyard, and build some pens to raise chickens.

He says that his main challenge is financial in nature. Her wife, who runs a business at home, helps him to overcome it. With the previous loans, he got his driver’s license, which made it possible for him to find a job. He used to work in the fields. He bought some assets that can back up the loan, and a vehicle. He says that he will apply for more loans to overcome the difficulties and achieve his goals.

loans.use: to buy cement, iron, zinc sheets, and windows to build a bathroom and a kitchen indoors.

loans.name: Maria Edelmira

texts.es: Maria es casada en la actualidad tiene 37 años de edad vive con sus hijos se dedica a la venta de productos de la costa y crianza de animales con el dinero solicitado ella comprara insumos agricolas para mejorar la produccion, ella tiene el sueño de mejorar su vivienda en los tiempos libres ella descansa
texts.en:
Maria is now 37 years old. She is married and lives with her children. She earns a living by selling products from the coast and breeding animals. With the requested loan she will buy farming supplies to improve production.

Her dream is to improve her home. In her free time, she relaxes.

loans.use: to buy supplies, such as fertilisers and seeds.

loans.name: Eliana Patricia

texts.es:
Eliana es una mujer con 31 años de edad, trabajador y muy humilde, ella realiza diferentes actividades con el fin de salir adelante con su familia conformada por una menor de 9 años y su actual pareja.
Su deseo es tener su propio negocio, en un pequeño local arrendado por un familiar dedicarse a vender comida, lo que le permita generar buenos ingresos e invertirlos todos en su hogar.
Para esto solicita un préstamo con el cual comprara una nevera y queso al por mayor.
Su meta es continuar trabajando hasta cumplir el sueño de tener una vivienda propia, poder brindarle a su hija una mejor estabilidad económica y gozar de una mejor calidad de vida.

Para esto cuenta con la ayuda de los colaboradores y prestamistas del portal Kiva.
texts.en: Eliana is 31 years old, a hard worker and very humble. She works several jobs in order to provide for her family which includes her 9 year old daughter and current life partner. Her hope is to have her own business in a small location rented by a relative and make her living selling food which would enable her to generate a good income that she would invest in her home. To that end she is requesting a loan to buy a refrigerator and cheese wholesale. Her goal is to keep working until she can realize her dream of having her own home, give her daughter more economic stability and enjoy a better quality of life. To do this she is counting on the aid of the members and lenders on the Kiva website.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and cheese wholesale.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is a responsible mother of one child. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transportation services by driving a taxi for 12 years. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. 

Her husband needs to do maintenance on his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good. It requires more maintenance on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to maintain his taxi. Therefore Shazia has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Shazia's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily, and provide better transportation services to earn a profitable income. Shazia also plans to save the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future. Shazia is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's taxi

loans.name: Naser

texts.en:
Naser is 22 years old and is studying for a degree in Computer Sciences He lives in a sector in Jordan called Ramtha, and he is working really hard to get ahead and to grow.

Naser dreams of having a good job so that he could help to pay for his daily expenses and help his family in household expense.

He requested a loan to pay for his educational expenses, so that he can continue with his education and graduate. Then Naser will try to find a good job to use his education and achieve his dreams.

loans.use: to pay for his college educational expenses in Computer Sciences.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is a married woman with two children, one of whom attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past ten years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors waiting to be repaid for goods taken on credit. 

She is requesting this loan to purchase inventory of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase inventory of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Samer

texts.en:
Samer is a 22-year-old single man from Irbid city. He is a student at university majoring in Tourism Management and he is working in the university cafeteria to help fund his education. He wants to complete his studies and find a good job.

Samer has four siblings which cause his family financial problems and his father cannot cover the education fees beside the household expenses.

Therefore Samer applied for an education loan to help him pay the university fees for this semester and will help him to buy books which he needs.

loans.use: to help him pay the university fees for this semester and buy some books for his degree in Tourism Management

loans.name: Tumaini Group

texts.en:
The women of Tumaini are from Bukavu, Eastern Democratic Republic of the Congo. They have been part of Wezesha Project for almost two years and this loan will be their sixth loan and their second at the maximum loan size of $400USD per member.

Judith is a group leader and is 42 years old. She is married and has 6 children between the ages of 16 and 22. They all go to school. Judith's group is called TUMAIN, which means “HOPE” in English. They sell different products, and they wish to expand their businesses to build a better future. 

Judith sells chickens. She has been running a business for 13 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more chickens, for resale. The profits from the business will be used to pay for medical insurance and to renovate her house. Her last loan finished well and the profit from it helped her familly.

loans.use: to purchase live chickens for sale at the market.

loans.name: Glamour Group

texts.en:
The life of Abigail's widowed friend has inspired her to start her own poultry-rearing business. Abigail resides in the Budiriro suburb of Harare, and is married with three sons who are all going to school. She is currently raising broiler chickens in batches of 100 birds every six weeks. She has managed to earn enough money to pay fees for her children, as her husband’s monthly salary alone cannot cover the family bills. 

In their group called Glamour, they have known each other from their neighborhood as they are all hardworking women running various kinds of projects. Encouraging and motivating each other has been the lifeline to their group. Thrive Microfinance has trained them on group dynamics and financial training. As a group they all desire to grow their business to a level where they can also create employment and bring other people out of poverty.

With a loan of 350 USD, Abigail plans to raise a second batch of 100 broilers so that she can reduce her business cycle from 6 weeks to 3 weeks. This will help her liquidity situation as she experiences a dry spell between sales. She also intends to raise layers in the future. Glamour Group hopes that a loan of 1,300 USD backed by Kiva will help them grow their businesses.

loans.use: To increase the size of her flock.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en: Abida is a 52-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of a son. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past many days, her husband has been unable to generate any amount of income because his rickshaw has not been working properly. Her husband wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money, her husband finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore Abida has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Abida is so thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's rickshaw

loans.name: G. S. Valle De Bendicion Group

texts.es:
G.S VALLE DE BENDICION, ESTA CONFORMADO POR CINCO MUJERES, MADRES RESPONSABLES CON DIES HIJOS MENORES DE EDAD, SON ORIGINARIAS DE ACHUAPA,  SE CARACTERIZAN POR SER TRABAJADORAS, RESPONSABLES, CON GANAS DE SUPERACION PERSONAL, EN SUS RATOS LIBRE LE GUSTA DISFRUTRAR DE LA COMPANIA DE SUS HIJOS, LAMENTABLEMENTE POR FALTA DE RECURSOS ECONOMICOS NO PUDIERON ESTUDIAR Y SE VIERON EN LA NECESIDAD DE TRABAJAR  A TEMPRANA EDAD, EN LA ACTUALIDAD LUCHAN POR SUPERARSE CON SUS NEGOCIOS, Y SACAR ADELANTE A  SUS HIJOS  Y BRINDARLES LA ESTABILIDAD QUE NECESITAN.
GRACIAS A SUS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE  LA CORDINADORA ES NOEMYZ Y TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONOMICA UNA PULPERIA ES UNA PEQUEÑA TIENDA QUE VENDE PRODUCTOS COMESTIBLES COMO: ARROZ, AZUCAR, LECHE, PAN, HUEVOS, QUESO, CREMA, FRUTAS, GALLESTAS, GASEOSAS, TISTE, ETC. EL NEGOCIO LO TIENE UBICADO EN SU CASA DE HABITACION ELLA DEDICA A SU ACTIVIDAD UNAS DOCE HORAS DIARIAS OFRECIENDO SUS PRODUCTOS, PARA QUE EN UN FUTUTO NO MUY LEJANO PUEDA OBTENER MEJORES INGRESOS. EL OBJETIVO ES INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA DE PRODUCTOS COMESTIBLES, PARA SASTIFACER LA DEMANDA DE SUS CLIENTES. GS. VALLE DE BENDICION AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVESIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS  Y PAISES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
The Solidarity Group Valle de Bendicion is made up of five women who are responsible mothers with ten minor children. They come from Achuapa and they are known for being hard-working and responsible women with a desire for self-improvement. In their spare time they like to enjoy the company of their children. Regrettably, due to a lack of financial resources they could not go to school and it was seen as necessary for them to go to work at an early age. At the moment they are struggling to succeed with their businesses and to provide for their children and give them the stability that they need.

Thanks to their desire to get ahead, their coordinator is Noemyz who earns a living through her "pulperia" which is a small shop that sells groceries such as: rice, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, cheese, cream, fruit, biscuits, soft drinks, tiste (a traditional beverage) and other products. The business is located in her home. She spends twelve hours a day working, to sell her products so that in the not-too-distant future she can earn a better income.

Her aim is to invest in buying groceries to satisfy the demand of her clients. The Solidarity Group Valle de Bendicion is grateful for the help that the Kiva lenders give to people with few resources and poor countries such as Nicaragua, so that they can have a dignified way to earn a living.

loans.use: to stock her small grocery store with products such as: rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, biscuits, juices, soft drinks etc.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
La socia Marcelina pertenece al banco comunal “LOS ANGELES”.
La socia continua   dedicándose  a su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable, la socia continua vendiendo su mercadería  sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia  se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de azúcar, leche entre otros.
texts.en:
Marcelina is a member of the “Los Ángeles” [The Angels] communal bank.

She continues selling groceries. She has had this business for quite some time now, and is doing well thanks to how hard she works every day. She is a responsible person. She continues to sell her products to customers that ask for them. She would like to continue working in order to support her family.

Marcelina is grateful for the loan she received and promises to pay the installments according to plan.

Marcelina is requesting a loan to buy sugar and milk, among other products.

loans.use: to buy sugar and milk, among other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a married woman with four children. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a farming business for the past 10 years, planting mangos and oranges. She mentioned a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

She wants a loan of 30,000 to invest in her farming business. With the loan, Joyce plans to purchase seeds and fertilizer to do her farming business.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans and boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: ELLA TIENE 27 AÑOS Y  ES JEFA DE FAMILIA DESEA RECUPERAR SU SONRISA YA QUE CUANDO ERA NIÑA  PERDIÓ EN UN ACCIDENTE  UNA PIEZA DENTAL Y ESTO LE HA PROVOCADO RE ABSORCIÓN OSEA Y GINGIVAL. LAMENTABLEMENTE NO CUENTA CON LOS RECURSOS SUFICIENTES PARA COSTEAR EL TRATAMIENTO.
texts.en: She's 27 years old and the head of her household.  She wants to recover her smile because when she was a little girl she lost a tooth in an accident, which has caused her bone and gingival absorption.  Unfortunately she doesn't have enough money to pay for the treatment.

loans.use: to pay for dental treatment

loans.name: Yoanny De Jesus

texts.es:
Yoanny es un hombre con 46 años de edad, tiene su propio negocio, una pequeña tienda al lado de una piscina, un lugar donde va mucha gente, lo que hace que sus ventas sean mucho más altas.
Trabaja toda la semana durante 3 horas.
Con el propósito de mejorar sus ventas, aumentar sus clientes e incrementar sus ganancias, Yoanny solicita un préstamo con el que comprara snack, bebidas y unas pequeñas vitrinas.
Quiere seguir trabajando para cumplir el sueño de tener su vivienda propia, brindarle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica y gozar de una buena salud.
El trabajo que hace este hombre para sobrevivir con los suyos es digno de aplausos y lo hacen merecedor del beneficio de apoyo que solicita.
texts.en:
Yoanny is a 46-year-old man. He owns a business, a small store next to a swimming pool visited by many people, which results in more sales for him. He works three hours every day.

Thinking of increasing his sales, attracting more customers and improving his profits, Yoanny is requesting a loan to buy snacks, beverages, and a few small showcases.

He wants to continue working in order to buy a house, offer his family financial stability, and enjoy a good health.

This man deserves an applause for the work he does to survive with his family; he has earned the support he is asking for.

loans.use: to buy snacks, beverages, and a few small showcases.

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es:
Marcos, de 37 años de edad, es un hombre de campo, no logró estudiar, porque sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar desde temprana edad, está felizmente casado, su esposa se dedica a los oficios del hogar y viven junto con sus hijos, de los cuales dos están estudiando en la escuela.

Marcos, es originario de otra región de donde actualmente vive, sin embargo como la tierra es más fértil en donde actualmente vive, decidió vivir ahí y dedicarse al cultivo de sandía, cultivo en el que le ha ido muy bien y ha prosperado.

El préstamo solicitado es para comprar insumos para sembrar sandía, pues ya inició la tan ansiada época lluviosa y necesita aprovechar está época.

Marcos, sueña con que sus hijos lleguen a ser profesionales y que gozen de una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Marcos, 37, is a farmer. He wasn't able to go to school because his parents taught him to work from a young age. He's happily married and he and his wife, a homemaker, live with their children, two of whom attend school.

Marcos is originally from a different region from where he lives. The land is more fertile where he currently lives, however, so he decided to live there and earn a living growing watermelon. He has done well with the crop and he has prospered.

The requested loan is to buy inputs to plant because the anxiously awaited rainy season has begun and he needs to take advantage of it.

Marcos dreams that his children will become professionals and enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy inputs to plant watermelon

loans.name: Faisal

texts.en:
Faisal needs support to achieve his dreams. He is a simple guy who lives with his family in Jarash. He is 24 years old. Faisal is studying at the University, majoring in civil engineering. He chose this major because he dreams of working in this field.

His current goal is to graduate from college and start a new life, but the financial problems faced by his family are obstacles standing in his way. For this reason, he decided to apply for an education loan to be able to cover his university fees and achieve his dreams.

loans.use: to be able to cover his university fees.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To boost her restaurant business by buying food items

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is student at the age of flowers, she only need financial help to achieve her dreams.
She is a simple girl who lives with her family in Irbid and she is 21 years old. Fatima is studying at the university, majoring in economics.

She chose this major because she believes that there are many job opportunities in this field. She wants to graduate and find a good work with good salary, but the financial problems that are faced by her family are an obstacle standing in front of her.

So she decided to apply for an educational loan to be able to cover her university fees and achieve her goals.

loans.use: to cover her university fees and achieve her goals.

loans.name: Ayélé

texts.fr: Ayélé est une femme mariée qui vit avec un enfant à charge et est âgée de 36 ans. Résidant à Adidogomé, Ayélé est une revendeuse de friperies qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend en circulant les quartiers environnant .Pour avoir un stock important et maximiser son profit afin de répondre à nombreuse attentes de ses clients, Ayélé sollicite ce crédit pour commander des douzaines de jupes et de tricots en vue de gagner des bénéfices pour venir en aide à  son mari aux diverses charges quotidiennes éprouvées.
texts.en: Ayélé, aged 36, is a married woman who lives with one child in her care. A resident of Adidogomé, she is a retailer of secondhand clothing and stocks up twice a month at the market. She resells by going door to door in nearby neighborhoods. To obtain a significant inventory and to maximize her profit, so as to respond to the numerous expectations of her customer, Ayélé is requesting this loan to order dozens of skirts and knit items. Her aim is to earn profits to help out her husband in covering the diverse day-to-day expenses demonstrated.

loans.use: to purchase 12 dozen skirts and 13 dozen knit items

loans.name: Busime Group

texts.en:
Tulinabantu (far right in the photo) is part of the group Busime and lives in the Uvira, Democratic Republic of Congo. She is 34 years old and married. Together she and her husband have five children; all are attending school.

She describes herself to be jovial. She operates a retail business where she sells breads, sweets, and flour. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in an area with lots of customers and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital.

She will use the $300 loan to buy more stock of flour.

Her business goal is to have a boutique within five years and in the coming years she would like to purchase a parcel of land with her profits. She hopes that in the future she will enlarge her business.

She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to  buy bread & flour.

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es: Pedro de 43 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus tres hijos, el se dedica al cultivo granos basicos y a la ganaderia desde hace 20 años comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa y con las ganancias que obtiene logra slir adelante, el cliente esta solicitando un credito para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para continuar con su trabajo y asi tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Pedro is 43 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and three children. For 20 years he has made his living growing staple grains and raising cattle. He sells his products in the various markets found near his home. With the earnings he obtains he has been able to move forward.

Pedro is seeking a loan to buy manure and fertilizers in order to continue with his work and increase his earnings.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers.

loans.name: Krishna

texts.en: Krishna once again thanks all his Kiva lenders for financing his rice cultivation. Despite the fact that the price of rice wasn't good, he was able to save some money to overhaul his tractor with the profits he made. Now he can manage his rice fields better. Krishna wants to continue with his rice production and needs another loan of SRD 10,000 to purchase inputs like diesel and fertilizers.
