loans.use: to purchase inputs for rice farming like diesel fuel and fertilizer

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a widowed woman with eight children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

With the loan, Ruth plans to purchase seeds and fertilizers for her farming business. 

She decided to join Yehu to improve her farming business; she grows mangoes and oranges.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for her farming business

loans.name: Penninah

texts.en:
Penninah is a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity, but no piped water.

She has operated a retail shop for the past five years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors waiting to be repaid for goods taken on credit. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. 

She is requesting this loan to purchase inventory of sugar, rice, salt, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.use: to purchase inventory of sugar, rice, salt, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Mary

texts.es:
La socia Mary pertenece al banco comunal LOS ANGELES, el banco está ubicado en el departamento de Cusco.
La socia continua dedicándose a   su negocio de venta de pescados y pollos, la socia continua vendiendo su mercadería a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una persona responsable, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de pollos entre otros.
texts.en:
Mary's a member of Los Angeles Communal Bank in the department of Cusco.

She still works in her business selling fish and chickens. She sells her merchandise to her customers on request. She's a responsible person. She has had her business for a long time and it's going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into it every day, this being how she gets her family ahead.

Mary's requesting the loan to buy chickens and other items.

loans.use: to buy chickens and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Lerma

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Lerma works hard to support her family. She has a rice milling business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from fattening pigs. Lerma is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional tools and equipment for her rice milling business.

Lerma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional tools and equipment for her rice milling business.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is an amazing mother who lives in Zarqaa. She has four children and she is working hard to ensure a good life for them and ensure that they do not need anything.

Amal's husband is retired and receives a small pension. He has a small grocery, but he could not cover all the needs for his big family. She wants to help him in anyway she can and because she is a very productive and ambitious woman, she decided to open her own business.

Amal started her business five years ago. She sews clothes to sell. After she felt that she had a good experience in this business, she decided to expand and develop her work. Therefore she applied for a loan to help her buy a new sewing machine and yarns and fabrics to increase her income.

She needs your support to achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and yarns and fabrics

loans.name: Bisnoe

texts.en:
Bisnoe feels very blessed with the help of the Kiva lenders and thanks all of them. Bisnoe repaid his entire loan on time and with the profits he could pay for the school fees of his children. Furthermore, he could renovate his house a little bit.

Bisnoe wants to save more for his family future and needs another loan of SRD 10,000 buy fertilizer and pesticides to continue with his rice production.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Tungteeya - Kunkuna Group

texts.en:
Memunatu is a 35-year-old native of Kunkuna, Bimbilla in Northern Ghana. Memunatu is married and has 4 children. She belongs to a predominantly shea processor women group called Tungteeya - Kunkuna, Bimbilla. Memunatu is the woman squatting with both hands on the basin of Shea nuts in the group photo.

Memunatu and her group have been in the trade for the past eight years with a good customer base. Memunatu’s shea-butter meets the quality requirements of her buyers, so there is a ready market for her products and she enjoys doing the business because she gets good income from it.
Memunatu and group have asked for a loan of GHC 15,800.00 with her share of the loan being GHC 1,500.00 which she would use to buy additional volume of shea nuts for processing into shea-butter for sale. She wishes to get more income to pay-back this loan and grow her business and as well support her family.

Memunatu thanks Kiva lenders for being so supportive.

loans.use: to buy additional volume of shea nuts for processing into shea-butter for sale.

loans.name: Alípio

texts.pt:
O senhor Alípio de 38 anos de idade é técnico agrário, casado e pai de 4 filhos dos quais 1 no ensino secundário e 2 no primário e 1 sem idade escolar vive na casa do serviço.
Diz que com o valor do empréstimo pretende comprar  um congelador, um guarda fato e uma estante para a sua casa.
O seu sonho é  concluir a sua obra, ter um meio de transporte pessoal ver os seus filhos  com os estudos concluídos e aumentar o seu nível académico.
Diz que o seu maior desafio é a insuficiência de fundos e tem  estado a fazer trabalhos de assistência agrónomo  para particulares nas horas vagas para supera-los, com o empréstimo anterior iniciou a construção de sua casa e comprou alguns bens.
texts.en:
38-year-old Alípio is an agricultural technician. He is married, and the father of four children; one goes to secondary school, one to primary school, and one is still very young. He lives in a house provided by his employer.

He says that with the requested amount he will buy a freezer, a closet, and a shelf for his home.

He dreams of finishing the construction works, having his own vehicle, and seeing his children finish their studies and improve their education.

He says that his biggest challenge is the lack of funding, and he has been providing assistance to agricultural producers during his free time in order to overcome it. With the previous loan, he started building his home and bought some goods.

loans.use: to buy a freezer, a closet, and a shelf for his home.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 62 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Corazon has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, diapers, canned good and other groceries. 

In the future, Corazon would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Jenylen

texts.en:
Jenylen is 24 years old, married, and has two children who are both in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Jenylen has a fishing business in the Philippines. Jenylen requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Jenylen has been in this business for two years. In the future, Jenylen would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Madeline

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Madeline works hard to support her family.

She has a business building fishing boats in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from retail sales of rice. Madeline is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy materials needed for her fishing boat building business.

Madeline has been sustaining her business activities through her past 27 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her fishing boat building business

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional kitchen-wares and ingredients for her restaurant business. Liezel has been in this business for six years and also earns more income from fattening pigs.

Liezel has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional kitchen-wares and ingredients for her restaurant

loans.name: Amtumainiaye Bwana Group

texts.en:
Bilombele (second from left in photo) is 30 years old and married with four children. She is a member of the Amtumainiaye Bwana Group in Uvira City Eastern Democratic Republic of Congo. She works hard to provide for her family.

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of plastics to resell , She is a member of wezwsha Project to access loans to boost her business. Their previous group loan was fully repaid and they are asking another loan in order to purchase more goods as their earning incomes will help their family needs.

Bilombele aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase plastics.

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan is a 34-year-old man who lives with his girlfriend and their children. They have 4 kids who are 4, 5, 9 and 10 years old. They are a close family and claim to have close bonds between them. They live at Juan's brother's house and divide the expenses.

Juan has been making a living by driving a public transport truck for the last two years but a few months ago, he decided to start a small grocery store which has been succesful. He works in it 3 days per week. The remaining days he works the truck and his brother runs the store. Their grocery store has been succesful but Juan thinks it may be convenient to increase the stock to meet client demands so he is willing to take a 15,000.00 MXN loan to fill his stock. He is willing to buy different products, such as bread, cheese, milk, cream, fruits and vegetables. He sees this store as a future for his family because he knows he can continue making a living by driving the truck but he wants to establish a business that his children may be able to inherit.

loans.use: to supply his stock

loans.name: Jesus Evelio

texts.es:
Jesús es un señor casado con 59 años de edad, la adversidad que lo ha perseguido no ha sido obstáculo para querer salir adelante y alcanzar sus metas, lo que se propone lo cumple, su sueño era tener su propio negocio, ahora lo tiene, es dueño de un gran cultivo de variedad de frutos.

Trabaja con el propósito de mejorar las condiciones de su casa, ya que esta está muy deteriorada y no es la mejor para habitarla.

Se encuentra solicitando un préstamo con el que comprará insumos como insecticidas, fertilizantes, abonos y otros.

Con su aporte este hombre podrá hacer de sus sueños una realidad, anímese, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
Jesús, 59, is a married man.

The adversity that has followed him hasn't kept him from wanting to get ahead and reach his goals: He achieves what he sets out to. His dream was to have his own business, and now he does. He's the owner of a big farm with a variety of products. He works so he can improve his house, which has deteriorated and isn't in the best conditions for living in.

Jesús is requesting a loan to buy insecticide, fertilizer, soil amendments, and other inputs.

With your support this man will be able to make his dreams a reality. Get motivated and make a loan.

loans.use: to buy insecticide, fertilizer, soil amendments, and other inputs

loans.name: Milena

texts.en:
Milena has plans to build her house, but her capital was not enough to buy the materials. So with her money that was not enough, she requests a loan for more from Tuba Rai Metin to add with her capital, so that she could buy materials for her house.

She is requesting a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to buy materials like sand, stone, iron, zinc, nails, wood, cement and other materials to use.

Because she said before she build her house she must to prepare the materials. So she happy with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin.

loans.use: To buy sand, stone, iron, zinc, nails, wood, cement and other materials to use.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 58 years old, married, and has five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Remedios has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. Remedios requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF in order to buy dried fish to sell.

Remedios has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, Remedios would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy dried fish to sell

loans.name: Jodi

texts.en:
Jodi is 41 years old, married, and has three children. Two of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Jodi has a business selling frozen food in the Philippines. Jodi requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more frozen foods to sell.

Jodi has been in this business for four years. In the future, Jodi would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Melchi

texts.en:
Melchi is 41 years old and married. She has two children, both of whom are in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Melchi is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Melchi has been raising pigs for three years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs
